en: Allied Democratic Forces gained access to intelligence.
lug: Allied Democratic Forces yasobola okuketta.
mt0: <pad> The Allied Democratic Forces were able to capture the city.</s>

en: Uganda Patriotic Movement calls for change of Electoral Commission.
lug: Uganda Patriotic Movement eyagala enkyukakyuka mu kakiiko k'ebyokulonda.
mt0: <pad> The Uganda Patriotic Movement wants a change in the election commission.</s>

en: Life after Kampala bombing.
lug: Embeera y'obulamu oluvannyuma lwa bbomu ezaakubwa mu Kampala.
mt0: <pad> The situation of life after the bomb blast in Kampala</s>

en: Former Allied Democratic Forces rebels warned of return to terror activities.
lug: Abaaliko abayeekera ba Allied Democratic Forces baalabudde okuddamu ebikolwa eby'entiisa.
mt0: <pad> The former Allied Democratic Forces have warned of the resumption of terror acts.</s>

en: At the Lugogo terror scene, security found a Koran next to the severed head of the suicide bomber.
lug: E Lugogo ewaakolebwa obutujju, ab'ebyokwerinda baasanga Kolaani okumpi n'omutwe gw'omutujju eyatega bbomu.
mt0: <pad> In Lugogo where the bombing occurred, security forces found Kolaani near the head of the bomber who planted the bomb.</s>

en: Inside the Koran were telephone numbers which also have given police important leads.
lug: Munda mu Kolaani mwalimu ennamba z'amasimu eziyambye poliisi okufuna okubagulizibwako okw'omugaso.
mt0: <pad> Inside the container were phone numbers that helped police get important information.</s>

en: From these leads, police believe the bombs were assembled in Kampala, largely but not entirely, around Namasuba suburb towards the end of June.
lug: Okuva ku kubagulizibwako kuno, poliisi esuubira nti bbomu zaategekebwa okusingira ddala mu bitundu bya Kampala ebimu okwetooloola akabuga k'e Namasuba awo ku nkomerero y'omwezi Gwomukaaga.
mt0: <pad> From this intelligence, police expect bombs to be planted in some parts of Kampala and around Namasuba by the end of June.</s>

en: General Aronda informed Museveni seven days to the attacks, security find new clues on the terror attacks.
lug: Genero Aronda yategeeza Museveni ennaku musanvu ng'obulumbaganyi tebunnabaawo, ng'abebyokwerinda bwe bafunye obubaka obupya ku bulumbaganyi bw'ekitujju.
mt0: <pad> The riots were not expected for seven days, Gen Aronda told Museveni, after security forces received new information about the threat of a riot.</s>

en: In 2009, Ronald Mukasa stepped on a needle in a rubbish dump.
lug: Mu nkumi bbiri mu mwenda, Ronald Mukasa yalinnya ku mpiso mu kasasiro.
mt0: <pad> In the early days of the year, Ronald Mukasa was a successful boxer in the Ugandan national football team.</s>

en: He later developed a high temperature and his mother rushed him to Kamwokya Christian Caring Community Centre.
lug: Oluvannyuma yafunye ebbugumu ery'amaanyi era maama we n'amuddusa ku Kamwokya Christian Caring Community Centre.
mt0: <pad> He later suffered a severe heatstroke and his mother took him to Kamwokya Christian Caring Community Centre.</s>

en: Doctors revived him but he died a few days later of tetanus at Mulago Hospital.
lug: Abasawo baamuzza engulu naye n'afa oluvannyuma obulwadde bwa tetanus mu ddwaliro e Mulago nga waakayita ennaku ntono.
mt0: <pad> Doctors treated him in the hospital but he died later of tetanus in the hospital in Mulago after a short time.</s>

en: You are not helping Ugandans to calm down.
lug: Toli mu kuyamba Bannayuganda kukakkana.
mt0: <pad> To help the Ugandans fight back</s>

en: Hutu majority have all the time to work.
lug: Abahutu abasinga balina obudde bwonna okukola.
mt0: <pad> Most Buddhists have all the time to work.</s>

en: The Hutu majority have all the time to work hard indeed as they stand in opposition to the dictatorship.
lug: Aba Hutu abasinga bayina obudde bungi nnyo ddala okukola nga bwe bawakanya obwannakyemalira.
mt0: <pad> Most Hutu have a lot of time to do while they fight against the government.</s>

en: Do the best for the people so that at the end of the day they can see the rationale of choosing a better African government.
lug: Kolera abantu ekisingayo obulungi okusobola okulaba nti ku nkomerero basobola okulaba ensonga y'okulonda gavumenti y'Abafirika ennungi.
mt0: <pad> Do your best to make sure that at the end of the day they can see why they should vote for a good African government.</s>

en: The Hutu majority should have done better when during the Mobutu era they propped up a dictatorship of Juvenal Habiryamani instead.
lug: Abahutu abasinga bandikoze bulungi mu kiseera ky'obukulembeze bwa Mobutu, mu kifo ky'okuwagira obwannakyemalira bwa Juvenal Habyarimana
mt0: <pad> Most Hutus treated me well during Mobutu's rule, instead of supporting the democratic government of Juvenal Habyarimana.</s>

en: One would like to compare Mobutu and Kabila, or Habiryamani and Paul Kagame, or Amin and Obote versus Museveni.
lug: Omuntu okugeraageranya Mobutu ne Kabila, oba Habyarimana ne Paul Kagame, oba Amin ne Obote ku Museveni.
mt0: <pad> someone to compare Mobutu and Kabila, or Habyarimana and Paul Kagame, or Amin and Obote to Museveni.</s>

en: All these are now well known African dictators.
lug: Bano bonna kati bannakyemalira Abafirika abamanyiddwa obulungi.
mt0: <pad> They all now have to explain the well-known Africans.</s>

en: Christine Kabayekka curses won't kill the terrorists Baganda say "curses of a hen do not kill the kite".
lug: Ebikolimo bya Christine Kabayekka tebijja kutta batujju , Abaganda bagamba nti "ekikolimo ky'enkoko tekitta kamunye."
mt0: <pad> The fever of Christine Kabayekka will not kill the hunters, the Gambians say "a fever of a dog does not kill anybody."</s>

en: The US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton played mother hen, whose curses have never killed the kite.
lug: Minisita w'ensonga z'amawanga amalala Hillary Clinton yazannya nga maama w'enkoko ng'ebikolimo bye tebittanga kamunye.
mt0: <pad> The former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton was nicknamed the "Mother of the Birds" by her critics because her foreign policy doesn't have a single objective.</s>

en: Now, wait for even more impotent ash from the "African Union Heads of State" summit.
lug: Kaakati lindako nate abatayina mugaso balala okuva mu lukungaana lw'abakulembeze b'amawanga ga Afirika.
mt0: <pad> I'm still waiting for other officials from the African Union Conference.</s>

en: Those in Nkore Karag hold that "curses of the hunter do not kill the buffalo".
lug: Ab'omu Nkore Karag bagamba nti, "ebikolimo by'omuyizzi tebitta mbogo."
mt0: <pad> The chief of the Karag family said, "The wife's behavior is not acceptable."</s>

en: All Somali refugees should go to refugee camps.
lug: Abanoonyiboobubudamu Abasomalia bonna balina okugenda mu nkambi z'abanoonyiboobubudamu.
mt0: <pad> All Somali volunteers must go to the Somalia relief camps.</s>

en: Ministers Matia Kasaija, Tarsis Kabwegyere, your task is clearly cut for you.
lug: Baminisita Maria Kasaija, Tarsis Kabwegyere, obuvunaanyizibwa bwammwe bulambikiddwa bulungi.
mt0: <pad> Madams Maria Kasaija and Tarsis Kabwegyere, your duties have been well distributed.</s>

en: Ugandans have no reason to die for Somalia.
lug: Bannayuganda tebalina nsonga kufiiririra Somalia.
mt0: <pad> Ugandans have no reason to invade Somalia.</s>

en: As for the Excellencies gathered in Kampala for the African Union summit, their number is close to that of the innocent lives who perished on July 11.
lug: Nga abakulembeze b'amawanga bwe baakungaanidde mu Kampala mu African Union summit, omuwendo gwabwe gukunukkiriza ogwa bassaalumanya abaazikirira nga 11 omwezi Ogw'omusanvu.
mt0: <pad> When leaders of the African Union summit met in Kampala, they added to the number of victims of the 11 July terrorist attacks.</s>

en: A few weeks ago I argued for the superpowers to take over Africa.
lug: Wiiki ntono emabega nakaayanira amawanga ga kirimaanyi okweddiza Afirika.
mt0: <pad> Last week I announced the formation of a new superpower to dominate Africa.</s>

en: One patriotic General, my classmate at Makerere University, labelled me "saboteur" Ndugu Afande.
lug: Genero omu mwoyo gwa ggwanga, gwe nasomako naye mu kibiina ku ssettendekero wa Makerere yankazaako lya "Saboteur" Ndugu Afande.
mt0: <pad> a national hero, my classmate at the University of Makerere who called himself "Saboteur"</s>

en: What sort of sovereignty is this Amon B?
lug: Amon B ono alina buyinza bwa ngeri ki obwenkomeredde?
mt0: <pad> simply say you don't know how much power this Amon B has over the entire universe.</s>

en: Mbekiza inquired if Uganda could export peace it does not have at home.
lug: Mbekiza yeebuuzizza oba Uganda esobola okutwala emirembe gy'etalina ewaka.
mt0: <pad> Mbekiza wondered if Uganda could achieve peace without a homeland.</s>

en: The entire African Union can only "condemn in the strongest terms possible" while Ugandans are murdered in cold blood.
lug: Omukago gw'amawanga ga Afirika kye gusobola kyokka "kuvumirira mu ngeri yonna esoboka" nga bannayuganda battibwa kyere.
mt0: <pad> The African Union can only "condemn in every possible way" the killing of Ugandans yesterday.</s>

en: Amon Mbekiza's comment in New Vision, July 19, 2010, on the July 11 terror attacks in Kampala missed one key point.
lug: Endowooza ya Amon Mbekiza mu New Vision w'omwezi ogwomusanvu nga 19, 2010 ku bulumbaganyi bw'ekitujju mu Kampala yabulamu ensonga enkulu emu.
mt0: <pad> The opinion of Amon Mbekiza in New Vision on July 19, 2010 on the riots in Kampala saved one important point.</s>

en: As we mourn the dead, we must ask; whose political, economic interests does Uganda serve by being in Somalia?
lug: Nga tukungubagira omugenzi, tulina okwebuuza bigendererwa by'ani ebyebyobufuzi n'ebyenfuna bannayuganda bye batuukiriza e Somalia?
mt0: <pad> While we mourn the dead, we must ask ourselves whose interests were the Ugandan political and economic initiatives in Somalia?</s>

en: The insurgency in northern Uganda has lasted over 20 years.
lug: Akasambattuko mu bukiikakkono bwa Uganda kaamala emyaka egisoba mu 20.
mt0: <pad> The conflict in the north of Uganda has been ongoing for over 20 years.</s>

en: Millions of Ugandans were born during the rebellion and entered adulthood before it ended.
lug: Obukadde bwa bannayuganda bwazaalibwa mu lutalo ne bakula nga terunaggwa.
mt0: <pad> Many Ugandans were born in the war and grew up without education.</s>

en: While some peace has returned, people in northern Uganda think the war has subsided, not ended.
lug: Wadde emirembe emisaamusaamu gikomyewo, abantu mu bukiikakkono bwa Uganda balowooza nti olutalo lusiriseemu so terunaggwa.
mt0: <pad> Although the interim peace has been restored, people in north Uganda still think that the war is not over and will never end.</s>

en: The war cannot be pronounced over' unless Joseph Kony and his top commanders are captured or killed.
lug: Olutalo terusobola kulangirirwa nti 'luwedde' okuggyako nga Joseph Konny n'abaduumizi be ab'oku ntikko bakwatiddwa oba nga battiddwa.
mt0: <pad> The war cannot be declared "over" until Joseph Konny and his top commanders are captured or killed.</s>

en: I find Mbekiza's criticism of President Obama and Clinton misplaced.
lug: Ndaba nga Mbekiza okukolokota Pulezidenti Obama ne Clinton tekisaana.
mt0: <pad> I wonder if the debate between Obama and Clinton was a failure.</s>

en: President Obama is not an African head of state.
lug: Ssuubi okufaananako ne Kabaka Yekka kijja kwesamba Buganda, omuyaga gw'ebyobufuzi omupya ogwatandikiddwawo bammemba ba Democratic Party abatali bamativu.
mt0: <pad> I hope to be like the King</s>

en: Ssuubi like Kabaka Yekka will simply isolate Buganda, the new political pressure group formed by some disgruntled Democratic Party members.
lug: Ssuubi okufaananako ne Kabaka Yekka ekyajja kwesamba Buganda, omuyaga gw'ebyobufuzi omupya ogwatandikiddwawo bammemba ba Democratic Party abatali bamativu.
mt0: <pad> I hope to be like the King</s>

en: This reflects a repeat of the Kabaka Yekka Uganda People's Congress unholy alliance of 1961 to deny Benedict Kiwanuka of Democratic Party
lug: Kino kyeyolekera mu kkobaane ly'omukago ogutaali mulungi ogwa Kabaka Yekka ne Uganda People's Congress ogwa lukumi mu lwenda nkaaga mu gumu okugaana Benedict Kiwanuka owa Democratic Party.
mt0: <pad> This was revealed in the agreement of the Queen and the Uganda People's Congress of August 2010 to deny Benedict Kiwanuka of the Democratic Party.</s>

en: The Kabaka Yekka allied with the Uganda Peoples Congress but the marriage crumbled in 1966 when the Kabaka was forced to flee to exile.
lug: Kabaka Yekka yeegatta ne Uganda People's Congress naye omukago gwasaanawo mu lukumi mu lwenda nkaaga mu mukaaga Kabaka bwe yakakibwa okugenda mu buwanganguse.
mt0: <pad> The King himself joined the Uganda People's Congress but the coalition broke up in 1978 when the King was barred from running for president.</s>

en: In spite of Buganda abandoning the Democratic Party for Uganda People's Congress in the 1960s, Democratic Party remained its honest and only ally.
lug: Wadde nga Buganda yasuulawo Democratic Party n'edda ku Uganda People's Congress mu myaka gya lukumi mu lwenda nkaaga, Democratic Party yasigala nga ye munywanyi waayo yekka ow'amazima.
mt0: <pad> Although Uganda has removed the Democratic Party from the Uganda People's Congress in the 1980s, the Democratic Party remains its only true member.</s>

en: Democratic Party now remains in the hearts of the majority of the Baganda, a big reason why Ssuubi members faced resistance in Masaka.
lug: Democratic party kati esigala mu mitima gy'Abaganda abasinga, ensonga enkulu lwaki bammemba ba Ssuubi baasanga okuvuganyizibwa mu Masaka.
mt0: <pad> The Democratic Party is still in the heart of many Ugandans, the main reason why members of Ssuubi found themselves being contested in Masaka.</s>

en: Ssuubi 2011 was formed by some people who didn't want a non Muganda to take the Democratic Party leadership.
lug: Ssuubi mu nkumi bbiri kkumi na gumu yatandikibwawo abantu abataayagala muntu ataali Muganda okutwala obukulembeze bwa Democratic Party.
mt0: <pad> The Ssuubi movement was started by people who did not want a non-Ganda to be the leader of the Democratic Party.</s>

en: Ssuubi 2011 was formed by those who were opposed to the election of Norbert Mao from the north.
lug: Ssuubi mu nkumi bbiri kkumi na gumu yatandikibwawo abo abaali baawakanya okulondebwa kwa Norbert Mao okuva mu bukiikakkono.
mt0: <pad> The Hope in the 1920s was founded by those who opposed the election of Norbert Mao from the north.</s>

en: Democratic Party refused to join the Inter-Party Cooperation because it has no serious future plan other than removing Museveni.
lug: Democratic party yagaana okwegatta ku mukago ogutaba ebibiina kubanga tegulina biseera bya mu maaso bisimbiddwako ssira ng'oggyeko okuggyako Museveni.
mt0: <pad> The Democratic Party refused to join the conference of the assembly because it did not have a clear future outlined except for Museveni.</s>

en: The arrogance exhibited by Forum for Democratic Change leaders especially when Democratic Party suggested reforms was self-explanatory.
lug: Amalala agaayolesebwa abakulembeze ba Forum for Democratic Change naddala nga Democratic Party esaba enkyukakyuka gaali geyoleka lwatu.
mt0: <pad> The threats made by the leaders of Forum for Democratic Change and the Democratic Party for Change were clearly visible to us.</s>

en: Democratic Party said not all parties can bring the same numbers in the Inter-Party Cooperation to elect one flag bearer.
lug: Democratic party yagambye nti ebibiina byonna tebisobola kuleeta muwendo gwa bammemba gwe gumu mu mukago ogutaba ebibiina okulonda anaabikwatira bendera omu.
mt0: <pad> The Democratic Party said that all the parties could not bring together a single number of members in the assembly to vote for a single flag.</s>

en: How sure are we that delegates will not be donated to such parties?
lug: Tukakasa tutya nti abakiise tebaagabweyo eri ebibiina ebo?
mt0: <pad> We are very pleased that the winners were not invited to those groups.</s>

en: For Democratic Party to just enter Inter Peoples Congress is to deny Ugandans a choice.
lug: Democratic party okumala gayingira mu Inter Peoples Congress kya kumma Bannayuganda eky'okulondako.
mt0: <pad> The Democratic Party after entering the Inter Peoples Congress has promised Ugandans a vote.</s>

en: For members in Ssuubi to say they will support Mao in the congress while roaming with Forum for Democratic Change shows their intentions.
lug: Bammemba ba Ssuubi okugamba nti bajja kuwagira Mao mu mukago ng'ate bakolagana ne Forum for Democratic Change kiraga ebiruubirirwa byabwe.
mt0: <pad> The Promised Land members' statement that they will support Mao in the presidential election and work with the Forum for Democratic Change shows their concerns.</s>

en: Parties like Conservative Party, Social Democratic Party, the Justice Forum don't have roots even in Kampala.
lug: Ebibiina nga Conservative Party, Social Democratic Party, Justice Forum tebirina mirandira wadde mu Kampala.
mt0: <pad> Conservative Party, Social Democratic Party, Justice Forum have no offices in Kampala.</s>

en: Buganda has been a serious victim of deceit.
lug: Buganda erimbiddwa nnyo.
mt0: <pad> Uganda has been very hit.</s>

en: In 1961 allied with Uganda Peoples Congress but betrayed in 1967.
lug: Mu lukumi mu lwenda nkaaga mu gumu yeegatta ne Uganda People's Congress naye n'eriibwamu olukwe mu lukumi mu lwenda nkaaga mu musanvu.
mt0: <pad> In 1980 he joined the Uganda People's Congress but was disbanded in 1977.</s>

en: In the 1980s Buganda was promised a federal system of governance by National Resistance Movement but has been denied to date.
lug: Mu mwaka gwa lukumi mu lwenda kinaana Buganda yasuubizibwa aba National Resistance Movement enkola ya Federo naye egimmiddwa okutuuka leero.
mt0: <pad> In 1948 Uganda was declared a republic by the National Resistance Movement, but it was retained till today.</s>

en: Mwaka Lutukumoi was the Democratic Party National Spokesperson.
lug: Mwaka Lutukumoi ye yali ssekamwa wa Democratic Party.
mt0: <pad> In October he was the Democratic Party's candidate for the presidential election.</s>

en: Kayonza Furniture Palace Plot 11, Old Port bell Road Opposite Sadolin Paints is your ultimate source for office and household furniture.
lug: Kayonza Furniture Palace Plot kkumi n'emu, Old Portbell Road eyolekaganye ne Sadolin Paints y'ensibuko y'ebibajje ebya woofiisi n'awaka yokka.
mt0: <pad> Kayonza Furniture Palace Plot 11, Old Portbell Road across from Sadolin Paints is the source of only one-of-a-kind office furniture and home furnishings.</s>

en: Thus, Ugandans should not ask what Obama and Clinton have done to castrate the African terrorists.
lug: N'olwekyo Bannayuganda tebalina kubuuza ki Obama ne Clinton kye bakoze okumalawo abayeekera ba Africa.
mt0: <pad> So Ugandans should not ask Obama and Clinton what they have done to end slavery in Africa.</s>

en: Rather we should ask what the African nationals are doing to liberate Africa from bad governance and poverty.
lug: Wabula tulina kubuuza ki Abafirika kye bakola okununula Africa okuva mu bukulembeze obubi n'obwavu.
mt0: <pad> But we have to ask what Africans are doing to free Africa from evil and poverty.</s>

en: Julius Kiiza said that Makerere University Military can't win the war.
lug: Julius Kiiza yagamba nti bannamagye ba Makerere University tebasobola kuwangula lutalo.
mt0: <pad> Julius Kiiza said that the army of Makerere University could not win the war.</s>

en: I don't agree with those who support the government's position to launch a full-scale war on Al-Shabaab militants in Somalia.
lug: Sikkiriziganya n'abo abawagira ekirowoozo kya gavumenti eky'okuggulawo olutalo ku bamukwatammundu ba Al-Shabaab mu Somalia.
mt0: <pad> I disagree with those who support the government's decision to launch a war against Al-Shabaab in Somalia.</s>

en: The attack on Al-Shabaab is a very small part of the War on Terror, certainly not the heart of it.
lug: Obulumbaganyi ku Al-Shabaab katundu katono nnyo ku lutalo lw'obutujju, si gwe mutima gwabwo.
mt0: <pad> The attacks on Al-Shabaab are a small part of the war on terror, not the heart of it.</s>

en: I disagree with President Museveni's war drums.
lug: Sikkiriziganya na kya Pulezidenti Museveni ku ngoma z'olutalo.
mt0: <pad> I don't agree with President Museveni on the political situation in Uganda.</s>

en: At this time, I don't understand our need to go to war with Al-Shabaab despite the recent bombs in Kampala.
lug: Mu kiseera kino, sitegeera bwetaavu bwaffe okugenda mu lutalo ne Al-Shabaab ng'oggyeko bbomu ezaali mu Kampala gye buvuddeko.
mt0: <pad> At this point, I don't see the need for us to fight Al-Shabaab, except for the bombing in Kampala last week.</s>

en: Perhaps some Ugandans are contented with Museveni's reasons.
lug: Oboolyawo Bannayuganda abamu bamativu n'ensonga za Museveni.
mt0: <pad> However, some Ugandans are not happy with the reasons of Museveni.</s>

en: Ask former United States president George Bush.
lug: Buuza eyaliko Pulezidenti wa United States George Bush.
mt0: <pad> Ask former United States President George Bush.</s>

en: It's also so unfair when some people generalise that all Muslims are terrorists.
lug: Era si kya bwenkanya abantu abamu bwe bakitwalira awamu nti abasiraamu bonna batujju.
mt0: <pad> And it is not fair for some people to generalize that all Muslims are evil.</s>

en: While there are some scriptures in the Koran that encourage violence, they are insignificant.
lug: Wadde waliwo ebyawandiikibwa ebimu mu Kolaani ebikkiriza obutabanguko, si by'amaanyi.
mt0: <pad> Although there are some written texts in the Korán that support non-mortality, they are not strong enough.</s>

en: Islam has no central religious authority like the Vatican in Catholicism.
lug: Obusiraamu tebuyina buyinza bwa ddiini bwa wamu nga Vatican mu Bakatoliki
mt0: <pad> Islam does not have a central religion like the Vatican in Catholicism.</s>

en: Abbey Kibirige Semuwemba United Kingdom on the story "Ganging up on Museveni" I can sense dome truth in this article.
lug: Abbey Kibirige Semuwemba mu United Kingdom mu bubaka bwe "okwegattira ku Museveni" Ndaba amazima amajjuvu mu kiwandiiko kino.
mt0: <pad> Abbey Kibirige Semuwemba, the UK's ambassador to Uganda, in his letter "to Museveni" I see a lot of true facts in this letter.</s>

en: Though the National Resistance Movement spokesperson is trying to downplay Ssemwogerere Mulwanyamuli's role on Uganda's political scene, National Resistance Movement and President Museveni feel politically threatened.
lug: Newankubadde omwogezi wa National Resistance Movement agezaako okufeebya omulimu gwa Ssemogerere Mulwanyamuli mu byobufuzi bya Uganda, National Resistance Movement ne Pulezidenti Museveni bawulira batidde mu byobufuzi.
mt0: <pad> Although the National Resistance Movement's spokesman is trying to denigrate the role of Ssemogerere Mulwanyamuli in the politics of Uganda, the National Resistance Movement and President Museveni have said they are out of the politics.</s>

en: That is why the government is now pursuing him using National Social Security Fund, labelling his Ssuubi 2011 political group a Kabaka Yekka party.
lug: Eyo y'ensonga lwaki gavumenti egezaako okumulemerako nga ekozesa National Social Security Fund ng'etuuma ekibiina kye eky'ebyobufuzi Ssuubi nkumi bbiri kkumi na gumu ekibiina kya Kabaka Yekka.
mt0: <pad> That's why the government is trying to get him out of power by using the National Social Security Fund to send his political party, the 22nd King's Hope Party, the Queen's Only Trust Party.</s>

en: Konny Jovia Ssuubi inquired if Kabaka Yekka was opportunism to the Muganda peasant
lug: Konny Jovia Ssuubi yabuuza oba Kabaka Yekka yali nakigwanyizi eri Omuganda owa wansi.
mt0: <pad> Konny Jovia Ssuubi asked if the King himself was a teacher to the poor.</s>

en: The only person capable of delivering that security is Yoweri Museveni.
lug: Omuntu yekka asobola okussaawo obukuumi ye Yoweri Museveni.
mt0: <pad> The only person who can end the crisis is Yoweri Museveni.</s>

en: Kizza Besigye is already in league with the perceived enemies of Buganda.
lug: Kiiza Besigye ali mu mpaka n'abatwalibwa ng'abalabe ba Buganda.
mt0: <pad> Kiiza Besigye is in a fight with the people who are considered to be the enemies of Uganda.</s>

en: Norbert Mao has been wise to avoid that lot.
lug: Nobert Mao abadde mugezi okwewala abantu abo.
mt0: <pad> Nobert Mao was a master of avoiding those people.</s>

en: Democratic Party and National Resistance Movement are the real friends of Buganda.
lug: Democratic Party ne National Resistance Movement gye mikwano gya Buganda egya ddala.
mt0: <pad> Just say you don't know where the Democratic Party and National Resistance Movement, friends of Uganda, are.</s>

en: The Inter-Party Cooperation, Forum for Democratic Change and Uganda Peoples Congress are not true friends of Baganda
lug: Omukago ogutaba ebibiina, Forum for Democratic Change ne Uganda Peoples Congress si mikwano gya Baganda emituufu.
mt0: <pad> The Ugandan government, Forum for Democratic Change and the Uganda Peoples Congress are not true friends of the Ugandan people.</s>

en: President Museveni and his Ethiopian counterpart Meles Zenawi have many things in common.
lug: Pulezidenti Museveni ne munne ow'e Ethiopia Meles Zenawi balina bingi bye bafaanaganya.
mt0: <pad> President Museveni and his Ethiopian counterpart Meles Zenawi have many common ground.</s>

en: Pre-election events in Ethiopia and Rwanda show you can win an election before people go to the polls.

en: Following the July 11 bomb blast attacks in Kampala, security has been beefed up in crowded areas in the city of Kampala.

en: On July 12 another suicide bomber vest was discovered in a bar in Makindye confirming fears that the bombers were targeting other places.

mt0: <pad> On July 12, a bomb-making kit was found in a bar in Makindye, which led to fears that the bomb makers were trying to hit another target.</s>

en: Since the bombings, security forces have been extra alert responding to every bomb scare that the public has alarmed about.

en: At Nakumatt, security officers check all vehicles, while body searches have become common at Garden City and Shoprite Lugogo.

en: Police have called on the public to help in identifying two suspected suicide bombers whose likely appearance has been reconstructed by Interpol.

mt0: <pad> The police have asked for help in identifying two suspected bomb bombers after they were sent out a series of CCTV images by the world's police.</s>

en: Various churches in Kampala have suspended overnight prayers following the July 11 deadly bombings.
lug: Amakanisa ag'enjawulo mu Kampala gayimirizza okusaba okw'ekiro oluvannyuma lwa bbomu nnamuzisa eza nga kkumi na lumu ogwomusanvu.

en: The National Fellowship of Born-Again Churches' chairman, Bishop David Kiganda, was speaking during a meeting with Kampala Capital City officials. Bishop David Kiganda recently said metal detectors would be placed at church entrances.

en: The measures follow a directive by Kampala City Council that restricts churches, bars and nightclubs from staying open past ten.

mt0: <pad> The actions followed a decision by the Kampala Capital City Authority to ban churches, bars and other entertainment venues from staying open after 10:00 a.m.</s>

en: Henry Luke Orombi, the Archbishop of the Church of Uganda, called for tighter security on July fourteen at places of worship.

mt0: <pad> Orombi had sent a special prayer to All Saints Cathedral in Nakasero to commemorate the dead.</s>

en: Following Orombi's call, security was tight on Sunday at various city churches, including Rubaga, Namirembe and All Saints cathedral.

en: At Rubaga Cathedral, the administrator is known as Father Francis Lubanga.

en: Father Francis Lubanga, told the gathering that only one door to the church would be open so that everyone could be checked.

en: Archbishop Cyprian Kizito Lwanga requested all Christians to accept the new security measures.

en: The Sunday prayers were part of the seven-day national mourning declared.
lug: Okusaba kw'oku Ssande kwabadde kitundu ku nnaku omusanvu ezaalangirirwa mu ggwanga lyonna ez'okukungubaga.
mt0: <pad> The Wednesday prayers were part of a week-long national protest.</s>

en: The force comes after six months of thorough training, in which three hundred ten trainees were chosen from the police force and UPDF.
lug: Eggye lijja oluvannyuma lw'okutendekebwa kw'emyezi omukaaga, ng'abaatendekeddwa bisatu mu kkumi baggiddwa mu poliisi mu UPDF.
mt0: <pad> The recruitment comes after 10 months of training, with three-quarters of the trainees being recruited to the UPDF.</s>

en: Three hundred ten trainees were chosen to represent Uganda Peoples Defence Forces by their commanders.
lug: Abaatendekeddwa ebisatu mu ekkumi baalondeddwa omuduumizi waabwe okuva mu ggye lya Uganda peoples Defence Forces.
mt0: <pad> The 30 recruits were presented to their leader from the Uganda people's Defence Forces.</s>

en: According to Orland Balak, the chief instructor of the squad, the graduates have skills to counter terrorism threats of any kind.
lug: Okusinziira ku Orland Balak, eyakulembedde okutendeka eggye, yagambye nti abaatendekeddwa balina obukugu okwanganga obulumbaganyi bw'abatujju okw'ekika kyonna.
mt0: <pad> Orland Balak, the commander of the training camp, said that the trainees were equipped to fight any kind of bandit attack.</s>

en: The Chief of Military Intelligence, Brigadier Abel Kandiho is one of the people that personally interrogated Kale Kayihura in two thousand eighteen.
lug: Akulira bambega mu magye, Brig. Abel Kandiho y'omu ku bantu abaabuuza Kale Kayihura kajjogijjogi w'ebibuuzo mu nkumi bbiri mu kkumi na munaana.
mt0: <pad> Brig. Abel Kandiho was one of the interrogators who asked Kale Kayihura a series of questions in 1988.</s>

en: James Mugira said the new squad comes in at a time when the country is on the hunt for terrorists who struck Kampala killing seventy-six people.
lug: James Mugira yagambye nti eggye eppya lijjidde mu kiseera ng'eggwanga liri ku muyiggo gw'abatujju abaalumba Kampala ne batta abantu nsanvu mu mukaaga.
mt0: <pad> James Mugira said the new army came at a time when the country was on the verge of being attacked by bandits who killed seven people in Kampala.</s>

en: The brigadier, however, dismissed claims that the Al-Shabaab attacked Uganda because of the Uganda Peoples Defence Forces presence in Somalia.
lug: Buligediya yasambazze ebigambibwa nti Al-Shabaab yalumba Uganda lwa ggye lya Uganda Peoples Defence Foreces eriri e Somalia.
mt0: <pad> Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni has said that Al-Shabaab has launched an attack on Uganda because of the presence of the Uganda People's Defence Forces in Somalia.</s>

en: A lady collects water from a non protected source of water in Nsambya Gogonya zone one on July nineteen.
lug: Omukazi akima amazzi okuva mu kifo eky'olukale mu Zzooni ya Nsambya Gogonya I nga kkumi na mwenda Ogwomusanvu.
mt0: <pad> A woman fetches water from a well in the village of Nsambya Gogonya I on July 15, 2017.</s>

en: Such sources of water are the possible causes of illnesses around Kampala slams.
lug: Ebifo ng'ebyo awaggibwa amazzi bisobola okuvaako obulwadde mu migotteko gya Kampala.
mt0: <pad> These water sources can cause illnesses in the streets of Kampala.</s>

en: Jimmy Siya, President Museveni inspects a scout parade during the African Youth Forum at Imperial Botanical Beach Hotel, Entebbe, on July seventeen.
lug: Jimmy Siya, Pulezidenti Museveni yalambula ennyiriri z'abasikawutu mu lutuula lw'abavubuka ba Afirika ku Imperial Botanical Beach Hotel e Ntebbe nga kkumi na musanvu Ogwomusanvu.
mt0: <pad> President Museveni visited the youth delegates at the African Youth Conference in Ntebbe on 17th July.</s>

en: Kayihura confirmed last week that the police will start using the biometric technology that was used in the Electoral Commission voters' registration.
lug: Kayihura yakakasizza wiiki ewedde nti poliisi ejja kutandika okukozesa tekinologiya akebera ebinkumu eyakozesebwa akakiiko k'ebyokulonda mu kuwandiisa abalonzi.
mt0: <pad> Kayihura confirmed last week that the police will start using technology to check for fraudulent voting which was used by the Electoral Commission in the counting of voters.</s>

en: Police will use the technology before the government carries out the national identification project.
lug: Poliisi ejja kukozesa tekinologiya nga Gavumenti tennatandika kuwandiika bantu kufuna Densite.
mt0: <pad> The police will use technology before the government starts to register people for a census.</s>

en: Uganda contracted the Muehlbauer Technology Group from Germany for the national identification project.
lug: Uganda yasse omukago ne Muehlbauer Technology Group okuva e Bugirimaani okukola ku Densite.
mt0: <pad> Uganda has signed an agreement with the German company Muehlbauer Technology Group to work on Densite.</s>

en: According to the Inspector General of Police, the registration progress will also entail registration of all local council residents.
lug: Okusinziira ku Muduumizi wa poliisi, ng'okwewandiisa kujja kuzingiramu n'okuwandiika abatuuze bonna mu byalo.
mt0: <pad> According to the police commissioner, the registration will include the registration of all villagers.</s>

en: The National Social Security Fund has agreed to pay the victims of the recent terrorist attacks that ripped through Kyadondo Rugby Club.
lug: Ekitongole kya National Social Security Fund kikkirizza okusasula abantu abaakosebwa mu butujju obwaliwo ku Kyadondo Rugby Club.
mt0: <pad> The National Social Security Fund has agreed to pay the victims of the riot at Kyadondo Rugby Club.</s>

en: The terrorist attacks hit Kyadondo Rugby Club and an Ethiopian restaurant in Kabalagala.
lug: Abatujju baakuba Kyadondo Rugby Club ne Ethiopian Restaurant e Kabalagala.
mt0: <pad> The bandits have burned the Kyadondo Rugby Club and the Ethiopian Restaurant in Kabalagala.</s>

en: Mr. Grace Isabirye is the acting National Social Security Fund managing director.
lug: Omwami Grace Isabirye y'akola nga Ssenkulu wa National Social Security Fund.
mt0: <pad> Mrs Grace Isabirye is the chief of National Social Security Fund.</s>

en: Mr Isabirye did not provide a specific time frame on when the relatives of the bomb victims should pick their cash.
lug: Mwami Isabirye teyawadde budde bwe nnyini abooluganda lw'abaakosebwa bbomu lwe balina okukimirako ssente zaabwe.
mt0: <pad> Mr Isabirye did not give a date for when the families of the victims of the bomb blast should deposit their money.</s>

en: The move came after Members of Parliament led by Mr. Okumu ordered National Social Security Fund to pay all the bomb victims their money.
lug: Kino kyaddiridde ababaka ba Paalamenti nga bakulembeddwa Okumu okulagira National Social Security Fund okusasula abo bonna abaakosebwa bbomu ssente zaabwe.
mt0: <pad> This followed the parliamentary committee led by Omukulu to order the National Social Security Fund to pay all victims of the bomb blast.</s>

en: Mr Okumu said that Desperate measures call for desperate actions.
lug: Okumu yagambye nti ebintu ebigwawo amangu byetaaga okukolebwako amangu.
mt0: <pad> Okumu said that early detections need early action.</s>

en: All the National Social Security Fund contributing members who either died or got injured in Sunday's bomb attack should be paid their money.
lug: Bonna abatereka ssente mu National Social Security Fund abaafa oba abaafuna obuvune mu bulumbaganyi bwa bbomu obwa Ssande balina okusasulwa ssente zaabwe.
mt0: <pad> All those who have saved money in the National Social Security Fund who died or were injured in the Friday bomb blast should be reimbursed.</s>

en: Twenty have been imprisoned by Uganda Police over Al-Shabaab links.
lug: Abantu abiri baggaliddwa poliisi ya Uganda ku byekuusa ku kuba n'akakwate ne Al-Shabaab.
mt0: <pad> Two people have been arrested by the Ugandan police on suspicion of having links to Al-Shabaab.</s>

en: The photos professing how the suspects looked were reconstructed using computer technology.
lug: Ebifaananyi ebiraga engeri abateeberezebwa bwe bafaanana byakoleddwa nga bakozesa tekinologiya wa kompyuta.
mt0: <pad> The images of the suspects were made using computer technology.</s>

en: The photos have been uploaded on the Interpol and American Bureau of Investigations websites to help in identification.
lug: Ebifaananyi biwanikiddwa ku mikutu gya poliisi y'ensi yonna ne ku bibanja bya American Bureau of investigations okuyambako okubazuula.
mt0: <pad> The pictures were posted to the world police and American Bureau of Investigation websites to help in the search for them.</s>

en: Two hotlines were released to the public to volunteer any information on the two terror suspects.
lug: Ennamba z'amasimu bbiri zaaweereddwa abantu okuwaayo obubaka bwonna ku butujju obw'emirundi ebiri.
mt0: <pad> Two telephone numbers have been given to people to provide information about the two-day flood.</s>

en: Twenty suspects have been arrested by the police in various parts of the country for suspected links to the Al-Shabaab militants.
lug: Abantu amakumi abiri baakwatiddwa poliisi mu bitundu by'eggwanga eby'enjawulo olw'okuteeberezebwa okuba n'akakwate ku bamukwatammundu ba Al-Shabaab.
mt0: <pad> Twenty two people have been arrested by police in different parts of the country for suspected links to Al-Shabaab militants.</s>

en: New research shows that African elections are far from promoting democracy on the continent.
lug: Okunoonyereza okupya kulaga nti okulonda kw'Abafirika kuli wala nnyo n'okutumbula Demokulasiya ku Ssemazinga.
mt0: <pad> New research shows that the African election is closely linked to the emergence of democracy in South Africa.</s>

en: Finance Minister Syda Bbumba's recently announced national budget was made with the two thousand eleven elections in mind.
lug: Minisita w'ebyensimbi Syda Bbumba yalangiridde gye buvuddeko nti embalirira y'eggwanga yakolebwa n'okulowooza ku kalulu ka nkumi bbiri mu kkumi na gumu.
mt0: <pad> The Ministry of Finance has announced that the budget for 2013 was based on the anticipated growth of the country's economy.</s>

en: Government critics claimed that the national budget read out in the Uganda Parliament is full of politics.
lug: Abakolokota Gavumenti bagamba nti embalirira y'eggwanga eyasomeddwa mu Paalamenti ejjudde ebyobufuzi.
mt0: <pad> Critics of the government say that the National Report which was read in the House of Commons is full of politics.</s>

en: New research conducted in Nigeria, Zimbabwe, Kenya, Uganda and Ivory Coast demonstrates that elections held in Africa have an impact.
lug: Okunoonyereza okuggya okwakoleddwa mu Nigeria, Zimbabwe, Kenya, Uganda ne Ivory Coast kulaga nti okulonda okubeerawo mu Afirika kulina ekikuvaamu.
mt0: <pad> Random research in Nigeria, Zimbabwe, Kenya, Uganda and Ivory Coast suggests that the African election must be transparent.</s>

en: It is one of the few things which presents challenges in elections in different elections in countries in Africa.
lug: Ky'ekimu ki bintu ebitono ebireetawo okusoomoozebwa mu kulonda okw'enjawulo mu mawanga ga Afirika.
mt0: <pad> One of the main reasons for the failure of the different African elections is that they were not transparent.</s>

en: In Uganda, it is shown that the economic reforms that the country was pursuing leading up to the election were not going to work.
lug: Mu Uganda, embeera eraga nti enkyukakyuka mu byenfuna eggwanga bye lyali liruubirira nga ligenda mu kulonda tebijja kukola.
mt0: <pad> In Uganda, the situation seems to show that the economic reforms the country had hoped for before the election will not happen.</s>

en: African finance ministers and reformers who are known for their fiscal discipline are usually fired around election time.
lug: Baminisita b'ebyensimbi aba Afirica ne bannankyukakyuka abamanyiddwa olw'engeri gye bakwatamu ensimbi batera okugobwa ng'ebiseera by'okulonda bigenda kutuuka.
mt0: <pad> African finance ministers and reformists known for their use of money are often accused of corruption as they approach the time of elections.</s>

en: War, guns and votes also show unsuprisingly that voting decisions in African countries are based on ethnic voting blocks.
lug: Olutalo, emmundu n'obululu nabyo byewuunyisa nti okusalawo ku kulonda mu mawanga ga Afirika kwesigamizibwa ku biwayi by'amawanga.
mt0: <pad> War, violence and corruption also complicate the process of electing African presidents.</s>

en: A case study of two Ugandan state ministers is shown.
lug: Okusoma ku baminisita ba Uganda ababeezi babiri kulagiddwa.
mt0: <pad> Two Ugandan women ministers have been banned from attending the lectures.</s>

en: An alumni from Makerere University focuses on winning re-election to the Uganda Parliament.
lug: Eyasomerako e Makerere aluubirira okuwangula akalulu akaddiddwamu okugenda mu Paalamenti ya Uganda.
mt0: <pad> The former student at Makerere University is hoping to win the runoff election to the Ugandan parliament.</s>

en: The member of parliament who bet his re-election on perfromance lost the election while ethnic posturing won the day.
lug: Omubaka wa Paalamenti eyeesigamya okuddamu okulondebwa kwe ku ngeri gye yali akolamu yawangulwa abantu bwe baalonda nga beesigamye ku ggwanga.
mt0: <pad> The parliamentarian whose re-election was based on his previous performance was defeated by the people when they voted for him based on the country.</s>

en: Further evidence that Barrack Obama could never win an African election can be found here.
lug: Obujulizi obulala nti Barrack Obama tasobola kuwangula kalulu ka Afirika kusobola kusangibwa wano.
mt0: <pad> More proof that Barack Obama can't win the African election can be found here.</s>

en: Besides, quality information on governmental performance in Africa is scanty and hard to come by.
lug: Ng'oggyeko, obubaka obukwata ku mutindo gw'ebyo Gavumenti bye zikoze butono era buzibu bwa kufuna.
mt0: <pad> Also, information on the quality of government performance is limited and difficult to find.</s>

en: Think of Iraq under Saddam Hussein and today's dysfunctional Iraqi democracy.
lug: Lowooza ku Iraq wansi wa Saddam Hussein ne demokolasiya w'Abayiraaka owa leero atakyakola.
mt0: <pad> Think about Iraq under Saddam Hussein and the democratic Iraq of today.</s>

en: Ethnic violence in Kenya is usually rife during elections such as those in two thousand two and two thousand seven.
lug: Obutabanguko bw'amawanga mu Kenya butera okubalukawo mu biseera byokulonda ng'obwo obwa nkumi bbiri mu ebiri ne nkumi bbiri mu musanvu.
mt0: <pad> Kenyan ethnic tension often occurs during election periods such as the 2002 and 2007</s>

en: Interestingly, the rough and tumble of African elections discourages decent African candidates from competing for political office and instead encourages some not so well suited candidates.
lug: Ekyewuunyisa, okulonda kwa Afirika okuzibu era okw'obumenyi bw'amateeka kulemesa abantu abalungi okwesimbawo okuvuganya wabula ate abatalina busobozi ne bavuganya.
mt0: <pad> In a strange way, the complicated and ineffective African election system prevents good people from running for office but allows poor people to run.</s>

en: Mu mawanga agakyakula abeesimbyewo batera okwogera ebisasamaza abalonzi ne bamenya amateeka.
lug: Mu mawanga agakyakula abeesimbyewo batera okwogera ebisasamaza abalonzi ne bamenya amateeka.
mt0: <pad> In developed countries, politicians often speak ill of the people and violate the law.</s>

en: Uganda is not short of examples in this regard.
lug: Uganda erina ebyokulabirako bingi mu kiti kino.
mt0: <pad> Uganda has many good examples in this field.</s>

en: After all winning an election in Africa can mean immunity from prosecution and he who reins of state power controls the judicial machinery as well.
lug: Ekirungi kya byonna okuwangula akalulu m Afirica kikusibozesa obutavunaanibwa ku bw'egugungo obubalukawo kubanga ali mu buyinza y'afuga n'ebitongole ebiramuzi.
mt0: <pad> The advantage of all-African success is that he cannot be held accountable for the violence that resulted because he is in power of the presidency and judiciary.</s>

en: Collier presents research by Pedro Vicente in Sao Tome which found that candidates who bribed voters won as compared to those who did not.
lug: Abeesimbawo abagulirira abalonzi bawangula bw'ogeraageranya n'abo abatagulirira.
mt0: <pad> The winners of the races who buy the lions are successful compared to the ones who don't buy.</s>

en: It is an empirical fact that bribery wins elections in poor countries.
lug: Kya mazima ag'enkukunala nti okugulirira abalonzi kuwangula okulonda mu mawanga agakyakula.
mt0: <pad> It is a well-known fact that bribery of voters has won elections in developing countries.</s>

en: After all African voters do not expect that the competing politicians will deliver on their promises and elections are their only chance to cash in.
lug: Oluvannyuma lwa byonna abalonzi ba Abafirika tebasuubira nti bannabyabufuzi abavuganya kutuukiriza bweyamo bwabwe era okulondebwa kusinziira ku ssente z'otaddemu.
mt0: <pad> After all, African voters do not expect politicians to fulfill their promises and the election is based on your father's money.</s>

en: Some politicians will actually be seen again four years later at the next election.
lug: Bannabyabufuzi abamu baakuddamu okulabibwako oluvannyuma lw'emyaka ena mu kulonda okuddako.
mt0: <pad> Some politicians will be re-elected after four years in the next general election.</s>

en: Collier and Pedro, during the two thousand seven Nigerian election determined that electoral bribery and vote miscounting were used to win elections.
lug: Mu kulonda kwa nkumi bbiri mu Nigeria baakakasa nti okugulirira abalonzi n'okubala obubi obululu byakozesebwa okuwangula okulonda.
mt0: <pad> In the 2010 Nigerian election, electoral fraud and poor voting were used to win the election.</s>

en: War, guns and votes is an insightful reading into how electoral democracy has had the opposite effect in African countries.
lug: Olutalo, emmundu n'obululu bulaga engeri Demokulasiya w'okulonda bw'akoze ekikontana n'ebyo ebyasuubirwa mu nsi za Afirika.
mt0: <pad> War, violence and chaos show how the electoral democracy has done the opposite of what was hoped for in African countries.</s>

en: Since Uganda was bombed in July two thousand eleven, Al-Shabaab terrorist group in Somalia claimed responsibility.
lug: Okuva Uganda lwe yakubibwa bbomu mu Gwomusanvu mu nkumi bbiri kkumi na gumu, akabinja k'abayeekera ba Al-Shabab mu Somalia keewaana okukola obulumbaganyi.
mt0: <pad> Since the bombing of Uganda in July 2012, the Somali Islamist group Al-Shabab has been responsible for launching terrorist attacks.</s>

en: There has been a lot of tough talk in Kampala.
lug: Wabaddewo okwogeza obukambwe kungi mu Kampala.
mt0: <pad> There were many demonstrations in Kampala.</s>

en: President Yoweri Museveni has promised to hit back at Al-Shabaab by increasing our troops in that country.
lug: Pulezidenti Yoweri Museveni asuubizza okwesasuza aba Al-Shabaab ng'ayongera amagye mu ggwanga eryo.
mt0: <pad> President Yoweri Museveni hopes to wipe out Al-Shabaab by increasing the number of troops in Somalia.</s>

en: Many Ugandans support the government in its posturing for a surge.
lug: Bannayuganda bangi bawagira Gavumenti mu ngeri gy'edduukiriramu enjega eno.
mt0: <pad> Many Ugandans support the government for its response to this threat.</s>

en: Yet the surge will increase rather than reduce the problem of the fragmentation of the state in Somalia.
lug: Enjega ejja kweyongera okusinga okukendeeza obuzibu mu mawanga agataaguddwataaguddwa mu Somalia.
mt0: <pad> The funding will be more to reduce the problems in the countries affected by Somalia than to ease them.</s>

en: It will also increase the financial and human cost on the state of Uganda.
lug: Kijja kwongera okufiiriza Uganda ensimbi n'abantu.
mt0: <pad> It will only increase the cost of Uganda's money and people.</s>

en: No amount of Uganda Peoples Defence Forces' presence in Somalia will bring peace to that country.
lug: Tewali muwendo gwa magye ga Uganda mu Somalia gujja kuleeta mirembe mu nsi eyo.
mt0: <pad> No Ugandan troops in Somalia will bring peace to the country.</s>

en: Only Somalis' can.
lug: Abasomaali bokka be basobola.
mt0: <pad> Only Somalis can translate.</s>

en: Uganda's troops can only assist in peace building if there are strong internal forces with a strong vested interested in peace.
lug: Amagye ga Uganda gasobola kuyambako buyambi mu kuzzaawo mirembe singa wabaawo eggye ery'omunda ery'amaanyi nga lyagala okukuuma emirembe.
mt0: <pad> The Ugandan army can help to restore peace if there is a strong internal force that wants to keep peace.</s>

en: Somalia needs a war lord able to mobilise reources and build a military capability to take effective control of the entire country.
lug: Somalia yeetaaga omuduumizi w'amagye asobola okukungaanya ebintu ebyetaagisa n'okuzimba eggye eririna obusobozi okukuuma obulungi eggwanga lyonna.
mt0: <pad> Somalia needs a general manager who can gather the necessary resources and build a strong army capable of protecting the whole country.</s>

en: The crisis of the state in Somalia, though initially created by internal factors, has been worsened by international interference in its domestic politics.
lug: Akasambattuko mu Somalia wadde nga kaatandikibwawo embeera okuva mu ggwanga munda, kasajjuddwa amawanga gw'ebweru okweyingiza mu byobufuzi byalyo.
mt0: <pad> The Somalian crisis, although it was initiated by the internal situation of the country, was fueled by the international intervention to interfere in its politics.</s>

en: Indeed it is part of the wider African dilemma.
lug: Mu butuufu kitundu ku kusoomoozebwa ku Afirika okw'awamu.
mt0: <pad> In fact, it is part of the collective hope for Africa.</s>

en: Quality information on governmental performance in Africa is scarcely a basis of voter choice as compared to ethnic identity and loyalty.
lug: Obubaka ku mutindo gw'enkola za Gavumenti mu Afirika butono olw'okusalawo kw'abalonzi okwesigamiziddwa ku mawanga n'okwewaayo.
mt0: <pad> The debate on the quality of government in Africa is limited due to the election system based on nationalism and corruption.</s>

en: Voting decision in African countries are not based on government performance as is the case in the west.
lug: Okusalawo mu kulonda mu mawanga ga Afirika tekwesigamizibwa ku kukola kwa Gavument nga bwe kiri mu Bazungu.
mt0: <pad> The electoral process in African countries is not based on the performance of governments as it is in Western countries.</s>

en: Elections held in Africa increase political violence, ethnic tensions, electoral bribery and imprisonment of formidable opposition candidates.
lug: Obutabanguko bw'ebyobufuzi, okutya kw'amawanga, okugulirira abalonzi n'okusiba ab'oludda oluvuganya abamanyiddwa.
mt0: <pad> Political instability, international fears, bribery of politicians and the corruption of the opposition are well known.</s>

en: The July eleven twin bomb blasts in the city that killed seventy six people and left dozens of others injured.
lug: Okubwatuka kwa bbomu ebbiri mu Gwomusanvu nga kkumi na lumu mu kibuga kwatta abantu nsanvu mu mukaaga n'abalala nkumu ne basigala n'ebisago.
mt0: <pad> The two bomb explosions in the city on July 11 killed seventeen people and injured twenty-five others.</s>

en: Mr. Okumu said the reason why they have ordered National Social Security Fund to pay people who were affected by the Sunday night disaster.
lug: Okumu yayogedde ensonga lwaki baalagidde National Social Security Fund okusasula abantu abaakosebwa ekikangabwa ky'ekiro kya Ssande.
mt0: <pad> Okumu explained why they had asked the National Social Security Fund to pay for people affected by the Saturday night earthquake.</s>

en: Mr Grace Isabirye told that on July fourteen all the bomb victims will be paid the money they saved with National Social Security Fund. Uganda Peoples Defence Forces last week approved one hundred ninety six strong Joint Anti-terrorism Taskforce to secure the search and fight against terrorists .
lug: Grace Isabirye yagambye nti nga kkumi na nnya Ogwomusanvu bonna abaakosebwa bbomu bajja kusasulwa ssente ze baatereka ne National Social Security Fund.
mt0: <pad> Grace Isabirye said that on July 17 all victims of the bomb blast will be paid their insurance by the National Social Security Fund.</s>

en: The fight against terrorism in Uganda was inspired by the terror attacks that happened on July eleven in the country.
lug: Okulwanyisa obutujju mu Uganda kwava ku bulumbaganyi bwa bbomu obwaliwo mu ggwanga nga kkumi na lumu Ogwomusanvu.
mt0: <pad> The fight against drugs in Uganda began after the bomb blast that occurred in the country on July 11.</s>

en: Kunsa also underscores the need for a thorough legal framework behind the Bill.
lug: Kunsa naye tawagira kya bwetaavu bwa kakiiko k'amateeka akaali emabega w'ebbago lino.
mt0: <pad> But I did not agree with the legal need of the committee that was behind this bill.</s>

en: Grace Isabirye, Onegi Obel, Amama Mbabazi former Managing Director, David Jamwa and Ezra Suruma are going to be hear today.
lug: Grace Isabirye, Onegi Obel, Amama Mbabazi eyaliko ssenkulu, David Jamwa ne Ezra Suruma bagenda kubeera wano leero.
mt0: <pad> Grace Isabirye, Onegi Obel, former Prime Minister Amama Mbabazi, David Jamwa and Ezra Suruma are going to be here today.</s>

en: The Independent randomly interviewed some workers who save with the National Social Security Fund.
lug: Independent yabuuza abamu ku bakozi abatereka ne National Social Security Fund.
mt0: <pad> The Independent asked some of the workers who are enrolled in the National Social Security Fund.</s>

en: There have been numerous complaints about the inefficiencies of National Social Security Fund, and the never ending scandals.
lug: Wabaddewo okwemulugunya kungi ku nkola embi eya National Social security fund n'emivuyo egitaggwa.
mt0: <pad> There have been many complaints about the poor management of the National Social Security Fund and the benefits paid.</s>

en: John Matovu said that if government chose to allow competitors to National Social Security Fund perhaps we would see improved service.
lug: John Matovu yagambye nti singa gavumenti esalawo okukkiriza abavuganya National Social Security Fund oboolyawo tuyinza okulaba ng'obuweereza bulongooka.
mt0: <pad> John Matovu said that if the government decides to approve the National Social Security Fund, we can see the service improve.</s>

en: Joan Nantume wished that people could save with any organization they wanted instead of National Social Security Fund.
lug: Joan Nantume afundako nti singa abantu basobola okutereka n'ekitongole kyonna kye baagala ekitali National Social Security Fund.
mt0: <pad> Joan Nantume added that if people can choose to join any organization they want, then the National Social Security Fund should be replaced by a private company.</s>

en: I have been saving with National Social Security Fund for 10 years now.
lug: Mbadde ntereka ne National Social security Fund okumala emyaka kati kkumi.
mt0: <pad> I've been working with the National Social Security Fund for about 20 years.</s>

en: Gilbert Okello from Mukwano Group of companies said he will get them some time, even if government changed.
lug: Gilbert Okello okuva mu Mukwano Group of Companies yagambye nti ajja kubawaayo obudde Gavumenti ne bw'enaaba ekyuse.
mt0: <pad> Gilbert Okello of the Mukwano Group of Companies said he will give time to the government even if it asks for a change.</s>

en: Government needs to craft this law well maybe setting a minimum interest rate on the workers' savings, says Immaculate Akanyo.
lug: Gavumenti yeetaaga okutereeza etteeka lino oboolyawo ng'essawo amagoba eg'essalira ku ssente z'abakozi eziterekebwa, Immaculate Akanyo bwe yategeezezza.
mt0: <pad> The government needs to review this law again and remove the taxes on the unpaid wages of the workers, Immaculate Akanyo said.</s>

en: According to the Independent issue of July 23 - 29, 2010, by John Njoroge, the air is pungent with urine, fecal matter and cow dung.
lug: Okusinziira ku Independent ow'Ogwomusanvu 23-29, 2010, ebyawandiikibwa John Njoroge, empewo ejjudde ekivundu ky'omusulo, obubi n'obusa.
mt0: <pad> According to the Independent of July 23-29, 2010, by John Njoroge, the air is full of poisonous dust of sickness, evil and poverty.</s>

en: This is Kifumbira, a slum in Kamwokya, a suburb of Kampala city.
lug: Eno ye Kifumbira, enzigotta mu Kamwokya, esangibwa ku nkingizzi z'ekibuga Kampala.
mt0: <pad> This is Kifumbira, a village in Kamwokya, located on the outskirts of Kampala.</s>

en: This issue is not exclusive to Kifumbira; the suburbs of Kawempe, Kalerwe, Wandegeya, Bwaise, Kisaasi, Kiwatule, Kitintale and Banda are also affected.
lug: Embeera eno teri mu Kifumbira yokka, enzigotta eza Kawempe, Kaleerwe, Wandegeya Bwaise, Kisaasi, Kiwatule, Kitintale n'e Bbanda.
mt0: <pad> This is not only in Kifumbira, but also in the neighbourhoods of Kawempe, Kaleerwe, Wandegeya Bwaise, Kisaasi, Kiwatule, Kitintale and Bbanda.</s>

en: At the Kitintale market, used needles, bandages and syringes are openly dumped with domestic food waste.
lug: Ku katale k'e Kitintale, empiso ezikozeseddwa, bbandeegi, bisuulibwamu lujjudde.
mt0: <pad> On the third day of the festival, all the ingredients, decorations, and music are included.</s>

en: In late November 2009, Ronald Mukasa, fell ill after he stepped on a needle while looking for plastic bottles and scrap metal in a rubbish dump.
lug: Mu Museenene wa 2009 ng'aggwaako, Ronald Mukasa yalwala oluvannyuma lw'okulinnya ku mpiso bwe yali anoonya obucupa bwa pulasitiika n'ebyuma ebikadde mu kasasiro.
mt0: <pad> In late June 2009, Ronald Mukasa became ill after falling on his face while looking for plastic cups and old tools in the basement.</s>

en: He developed an extremely high temperature, and began losing consciousness and he was then rushed to Mulago National Referral Hospital.
lug: Yafuna omusujja ogw'amaanyi n'afuna n'obukosefu ku bwongo oluvannyuma n'addusibwa mu ddwaliro ekkulu e Mulago.
mt0: <pad> He suffered a severe head injury and was transported to the Mulago General Hospital.</s>

en: He was rushed to Kamwokya Christian Caring Community Centre, a health centre in the Kamwokya area.
lug: Yaddusiddwa mu kalwaliro ka Kamwokya Christian Caring Community Centre.
mt0: <pad> He was transferred to Kamwokya Christian Caring Community Centre.</s>

en: Doctors there revived him but Mukasa died a few days later of tetanus while at Mulago Hospital.
lug: Abasawo b'eyo baamukolako naye Mukasa oluvannyuma lw'ennaku ntono yafa obulwadde bwa ttetanansi bwamuttira e Mulago.
mt0: <pad> Doctors there treated him but Mukasa died shortly afterwards of a fever he had contracted in Mulago.</s>

en: We show the Minister for Primary Health, James Kakooza, some photos from Kifumbira.
lug: Tulage minisita w'ebyobulamu ebisookerwako, James Kakooza ebimu ku bifaananyi okuva mu Kifumbira
mt0: <pad> Uganda's first minister of health, James Kagame, shares some pictures from the country's traditional festivals.</s>

en: The problem is the "I don't care" attitude of people in Kampala especially.
lug: Obuzibu bwa nkola ya bantu b'omu Kampala okusinga ey'obutafaayo.
mt0: <pad> The problem of Kampala is more a cultural one than a historic one.</s>

en: There are hospitals in the rural areas, both government and private where people can go instead of coming to Kampala.
lug: Waliwo amalwaliro ga Gavumenti mu bitundu by'ebyalo n'ag'obwanannyini abantu gye basobola okugenda okusinga okujja e Kampala.
mt0: <pad> There are government and private hospitals in the provinces where people can go instead of going to Kampala.</s>

en: However, according to the Commissioner of Clinical Services at the Ministry of Health Jacinto Amandwa, the problem goes well beyond attitude.
lug: Wabula, okusinziira ku mukungu w'amalwaliro ku minisitule y'ebyobulamu, Jacinto Amandwa ekizibu kya maanyi ddala.
mt0: <pad> But according to the director of hospitals in the ministry of health, Jacinto Amandwa the problem is very serious.</s>

en: Amandwa, is suddenly shocked and saddened when he views the pictures.
lug: Amandwa, yeewuunyizaawo era n'anyolwa bwe yalabye ebifaananyi.
mt0: <pad> When he saw the pictures, he was amazed and moved.</s>

en: Amandwa apportions part of the blame to the Uganda Medical Council, the licensing body for private hospitals in Uganda.
lug: Amandwa omusango agusalira kibiina ekigatta abasawo ekiwa layisinsi amalwaliro ag'obwanannyini mu Uganda.
mt0: <pad> The Ugandan Medical Council has been accused of failing to license private hospitals in the country.</s>

en: According to the independent issue of July 23 - 29, 2010, many are operating without clear medical waste disposal channels.
lug: Okusinziira ku Independent ow'Ogwomusanvu 23-29, 2010, mangi gakola nga tegalina watuufu we gasuula kasasiro avudde mu ddwaliro.
mt0: <pad> According to the Independent of July 23-29, 2010, many schools worked without a proper foundation when they took a sick child out of hospital.</s>

en: The Uganda's Healthcare Waste management system Plan of 2007/08-2009/10 suggested that, it should collect and destroy waste.
lug: Enteekateeka y'enkwata ya kasasiro eya nga 2007/08-2009/10, yateesa nti, erina okukungaanya era eyokye kasasiro.
mt0: <pad> The 2007/08-2009/10 tax framework, which established that it must collect and pay taxes.</s>

en: Major hospitals like Mulago National Referral Hospital, St. Francis Hospital, Nsambya and Kibuli have their own incinerators.
lug: Amalwaliro amanene nga ekkulu ery'e Mulago, St. Francis Hospital, Nsambya ne Kibuli galina ebyuma byago ebyokya kasasiro.
mt0: <pad> Large hospitals like Mulago, St. Francis Hospital, Nsambya and Kibuli have advanced sterilizers.</s>

en: The government has a burner in Nakasongola but hospitals and clinics do not have burners.
lug: Gavumenti erina we bayokyeza kasasiro e Nakasongola naye amalwaliro amanene n'obutono tebulina we bayokyeza kasasiro.
mt0: <pad> The government has a water pump in Nakasongola but the big and small hospitals don't have water pumps.</s>

en: Health facilities retain the duty of transporting their waste to collection centres from where contracted companies pick it and take it to Nakasongola.
lug: Amalwaliro gasigaza obuvunaanyizibwa bw'okutwala kasasiro waago mu bifo w'akungaanyizibwa kkampuni ezaapatanibwa we zimuggya okumutwala e Nakasongola.
mt0: <pad> The hospital loses its authority to transport the patient to the appropriate hospitals where the company that took him to be transferred to Nakasongola is responsible.</s>

en: Minister Kakooza said that they provide armed escorts for expired drugs to ensure that they are transported to Nakasongola.
lug: Minisita Kakooza yagambye nti bawaayo abakuumi ab'emmundu okugendera ku ddagala eriyiseeko okukakasa nti litambuziddwa okutwalibwa e Nakasongola.
mt0: <pad> Minister Kakooza said that they had ordered the drugs officers to check the container to make sure it was not tampered with.</s>

en: Dr Appolo Ahimbisibwe from Kamwokya Christian Caring Community Centre said that they have an understanding with the health centre in Kisenyi.
lug: Musawo Appolo Ahimbisibwe okuva ku Kamwokya Christian Caring Community Centre yagambye nti balina entegeeragana n'eddwaliro mu Kisenyi.
mt0: <pad> Please don't know.</s>

en: Ahimbisibwe adds that the centre pays Shs. 2000 for every kilo of medical waste it transports to Kisenyi.
lug: Ahimbisibwe agattako nti eddwaliro lisasula 2000/- ku buli kkiro ya kasasiro w'eddwaliro atwalibwa mu Kisenyi.
mt0: <pad> He added that the hospital will pay 2000/- for every kilo of hospital garbage transported to Kisenyi.</s>

en: A spot survey of private medical units in Kifumbira Kamwokya reveals that many private clinics are not willing to pay these additional disposal costs.
lug: Okunoonyereza ku malwaliro g'obwannannyini mu Kifumbira mu Kamwokya kulaga nti amalwaliro g'obwannanyini mangi si meetegefu kusasula ssente za kasasiro zino ez'ennyongereza.
mt0: <pad> A survey of private hospitals in Kifumbira in Kamwokya shows that many private hospitals are not willing to pay for the costs of this expansion.</s>

en: At Kasee Clinic, one of 12 private medical units within a 200 metre radius, an attendant was initially helpful but suddenly became hostile.
lug: Ku ddwaliro ly'e Kasese, akamu ku busenge 12 ak'obwanannyini mu bbanga lya mmita 200, omujjanjabi okusooka yali wa mugaso naye oluvannyuma yafuuka mukambwe.
mt0: <pad> At the Kasese Hospital, one of 12 private rooms a 200-meter distance, the first doctor was a nurse but became an expert.</s>

en: Life clinic and Nyange clinic also offered very rude responses.
lug: Amalwaliro nga Life clinic ne Nyange clinic nago gaweereza bulungi.
mt0: <pad> The clinics of Life Clinic and Nyange Clinic are operating well.</s>

en: "We don't want journalists here"one attendant shouted in Luganda before slamming her door.
lug: Omujjanjabi omu yaleekaana mu Luganda nti, ''tetwagala bannamawulire wano'' nga tannagalawo luggi lwe.
mt0: <pad> One doctor told the media in Luganda, "We don't want journalists here" before closing his door.</s>

en: Unrecognized by government and the Ministry of Health, these illegal clinics operate without letters from the medical council.
lug: Olw'obutakkirizibwa gavumenti ne Minisitule y'ebyobulamu, amalwaliro ago agatali mu mateeka gakola nga tegalina bbaluwa kuva mu kakiiko akafuga abasawo.
mt0: <pad> Because they do not have government and health ministry approval, these unauthorized hospitals are operating without a license from the medical board.</s>

en: Many clinics in Kampala, Wakiso, Mukono and central region do not have professional people working in them.
lug: Amalwaliro mangi mu Kampala, Wakiso, Mukono ne mu kitundu ky'omu masekkati tegalina bakugu bagakolamu.
mt0: <pad> Many hospitals in Kampala, Wakiso, Mukono and the central region do not have enough doctors to treat patients.</s>

en: According to Ahimbisibwe, slum dwellings like Kifumbira-Kamwokya are ideal for unregistered private medical centres to operate.
lug: Okusinziira ku Ahimbisibwe, enzigotta nga Kifumbira-Kamwokya zirabika zirimu amalwaliro agatali mawandiise kukola.
mt0: <pad> According to the investigation, districts like Kifumbira-Kamwokya are still housing unlicensed clinics.</s>

en: "You do not expect such people to be responsible," Ahimbisibwe notes in frustration.
lug: Tosuubira bantu abo kuba na buvunaanyizibwa, Ahimbisibwe bwe yagambye mu busungu.
mt0: <pad> Don't expect those people to be responsible, Ahimbisibwe said in anger.</s>

en: Mulago Hospital is a shining example of how medical waste disposal is supposed to work.
lug: Eddwaliro ly'e Mulago kyakulabirako ekirungi ku ngeri enkwata ya kasasiro w'eddwaliro gy'erina okuba.
mt0: <pad> The Mulago Hospital is a good example of how the hospital's budget should be.</s>

en: With three incinerators, Mulago boasts an organised and elaborately systematic method of medical waste management.
lug: N'ebyuma bisatu ebyokya kasasiro, Mulago erina enkola ennambulukufu ey'okukwatamu kasasiro.
mt0: <pad> With three smoke removal machines, Mulago has a sophisticated system for controlling the smoke.</s>

en: Plastic bottles are recycled, domestic waste is collected by Kampala City Council and human body parts are taken to the mortuary grounds in Bukasa.
lug: Obucupa obwa pulasitiika buddamu okusaanuusibwa, kasasiro w'awaka akung'aanyizibwa Kampala Capital City Authority n'ebitundu by'emibiri gy'abantu bitwalibwa mu ggwanika e Bukasa.
mt0: <pad> Political corruption is again being exposed, the taxes of the house are being levied by the Kampala Capital City Authority and parts of human bodies are being moved to the Bukasa cemetery.</s>

en: But for the residents of Kifumbira Kamwokya, just two kilometres away, Mulago's organisation offers little comfort.
lug: Naye mu batuuze b'e Kifumbira Kamwokya, abawukanako kkiromita bbiri zokka, enteekateeka ya Mulago ebagumya kitono.
mt0: <pad> But for the residents of Kifumbira Kamwokya, two kilometers away, Mulago's plan has been a little comforting.</s>

en: Used needles, syringes and blood transfusion tubes were dumped in Kifumbira, Kamwokya.
lug: Empiso ezikozeseddwa, ebbomba ezivaamu eddagala ly'empiso n'obupiira obuyisibwamu omusaayi byali bisuulibwa mu Kifumbira - Kamwokya.
mt0: <pad> The used poisons, syringes and blood transfusion tubes were recently found in Kifumbira - Kamwokya.</s>

en: Mulago Hospital has an incinerator.
lug: Mulago erina ekyuma omwokyebwa kasasiro.
mt0: <pad> The Ugandans have a very strong steel</s>

en: THE INDEPENDENT July 23 - 29, 2010 By Rosebell Kagumire and Maya Prabhu.
lug: The Independent w'Ogwomukaaga 23-29, 2010 bya Rosebell Kagumire ne Maya Prabhu.
mt0: <pad> The Independent of July 23-29, 2010 by Rosebell Kagumire and Maya Prabhu.</s>

en: The sprawling Nakivale Refugee Settlement in south-western Uganda is home to over 50,000 asylum-seekers and refugees.
lug: Enkambi y'ababundabunda eya Sprawling Refugee Settlement mu bukiikakkono bw'obugwanjuba bwa Uganda maka g'ababundabunda n'abanoonyiboobubudamu 50,000.
mt0: <pad> The Sprawling Refugee Settlement in the north-east of Uganda is home to about 50,000 refugees and IDPs.</s>

en: Okumu asked whether the government should come in as a guarantor or rely on the weak insurance market that characterises our economy?
lug: Okumu yabuuza oba Gavumenti erina okujja ng'omusembi oba yeesigame ku nkola ya yinsuwa ennafu eri mu ggwanga?
mt0: <pad> One questioned whether the government should come in as a substitute or depend on the current system of national income tax.</s>

en: This was done for easy supervision and conducting routine operations directed by the Directorate of Criminal Investigations.
lug: Kino kyakolebwa okwanguya okulondoola wamu n'okukola ebikwekweto ebikolebwa ekitongole ekinoonyereza ku buzzi bw'emisango.
mt0: <pad> This was done to enable the investigation and enforcement of the agency's actions.</s>

en: The actions by the former Allied Democratic Forces reporters if not checked can be a recipe for disaster.
lug: Ebikolwa by'abawandiika ku baaliko bamukwatammundu ba Allied Democratic Forces singa tebikolebwako biyinza okuvaamu obuzibu.
mt0: <pad> The actions of journalists on the former Allied Democratic Forces commanders if not supervised can lead to problems.</s>

en: The demand for the reinstatement of the former Allied Democratic Force liaison office at the Container Village cannot be entertained.
lug: Obwetaavu bw'okuzzaawo woofiisi z'abaaliko bamukwatammundu ba Allied Democratic Force ku Container Village tebusobola kukkirizibwa.
mt0: <pad> The need to rebuild the former Allied Democratic Force offices in the Container Village cannot be met.</s>

en: Lieutenant Col Buturo dismissed the proposal of setting up an office even after numerous complaints from the wananchi.
lug: Luteenanti Kkano Buturo yagoba okusaba kw'okussaawo woofiisi wadde nga abantu ba bulijjo baali beemulugunyizza nnyo.
mt0: <pad> Buturo refused to resign despite the huge outcry of the general public.</s>

en: All these affairs at the former Container Village were used in the name of the Joint-Terrorist Task Force of Uganda which negatively affected its image.
lug: Ensonga zino zonna ezaali ku eyali Container Village zeeyambisibwa mu linnya ly'okussaawo akakiiko akalwanyisa abatujju mu Uganda ekyayonoona ekifaananyi kyakyo.
mt0: <pad> These all the reasons about the former Container Village were used in the name of dismantling the anti-immigration commission in Uganda which has ruined its image.</s>

en: There are active serving Uganda People's Defense Force soldiers who need to observe and abide by rules and regulations of the army.
lug: Waliwo abajaasi ba Uganda People's Defence Force abaweereza abeetaaga okugondera amateeka n'ebiragiro by'amagye.
mt0: <pad> There are Ugandan soldiers of the Uganda People's Defence Force who serve those who need to comply with the laws and military regulations.</s>

en: These individuals include Benz Tushabe, Kigonya Siraje, Abdu Rashid Mukiibi, Kakooza Ahmad and others.
lug: Abantu bano mulimu Benz Tushabe, Kigonya siraje, Andy Rashid Mukiibi, Kakooza Ahmad n'abalala.
mt0: <pad> These people include Benz Tushabe, Kigonya siraje, Andy Rashid Mukiibi, Kakooza Ahmad and others.</s>

en: It was widely involved in extortion, illegal detentions and torture, and forgery of Joint-Terrorist Task Force of Uganda documents.
lug: Lyenyigira nnyo mu bulyake, okusiba okutali mu mateeka n'okutulugunya, n'okugingirira ebiwandiiko by'akakiiko akalwanyisa abatujju mu Uganda.
mt0: <pad> Engaged in murder, rape and torture, and distributing documents of the Committee to fight Childbirth in Uganda.</s>

en: The Arab world whose agenda and accountability cannot be clear and convincing.
lug: Ensi y'Abawalabu ng'ebigobererwa n'embalirira yabyo si nnambulukufu era nga tematiza.
mt0: <pad> The Arab World as a system and its goals is not transparent and unsustainable.</s>

en: It is wrong for the group to claim that the government negotiated a deal with Ali Bamuze and Muhammed Kigundu and ignored them.
lug: Kikyamu ekibinja okulumiriza nti gavumenti yakola ddiiru ne Ali Bamuze ne Muhammed Kiggundu ate n'ebasuulirira.
mt0: <pad> The committee also accused the government of making deals with Ali Bamuze and Muhammad Kiggundu and paying them.</s>

en: The Allied Democratic Forces and Lord Resistance Army leadership are still holed up in the bush fighting the government.
lug: Obukulembeze bwa Allied Democratic Forces ne Lord Resistance Army bukyalemedde mu nsiko bulwanyisa gavumenti.
mt0: <pad> The leadership of the Allied Democratic Forces and Lord Resistance Army are still in the field fighting the government.</s>

en: Therefore, it's irrelevant for the group to claim to work for and on behalf of the Allied Democratic Force.
lug: N'olwekyo tekyetaagisa kibinja kulumiriza nti kikolera oba nti kikola ku lwa Allied democratic force.
mt0: <pad> So the group does not need to declare that it works for or is working for the Allied Democratic Forces.</s>

en: It's not true that by the time Rwigyema Shafik was arrested, he was on official Joint Anti-Terrorist Task Force of Uganda duties as alleged.
lug: Si kituufu nti mu kiseera Rwigyema Shafik mwe yakwatibwa, yali ku mulimu gw'akakiiko akalwanyisa abatujju mu Uganda nga bwe kyogerebwa.
mt0: <pad> It is not true that at the time Rwigyema Shafik was arrested, he was a member of the anti-drugs commission in Uganda as it is reported.</s>

en: Much as he was initially deployed by the Joint Anti-Terrorist Task Force of Uganda in the Busoga region, he was given an official vehicle and a pistol.
lug: Wadde nga yasindikibwa mu kusooka, akakiiko akalwanyisa abatujju mu Uganda mu bitundu by'e Busoga, yaweebwa emmotoka ya gavument ne pisito.
mt0: <pad> Although he was initially sent, the anti-drugs commission in Uganda in the Busoga districts, he was offered a government car and a post.</s>

en: In 2007, after my second contract, I thought maybe I had served enough, but the board said no because of Kamonkoli.
lug: Mu nkumi bbiri musanvu oluvannyuma lwa kontulakiti yange eyokubiri, nalowooza nti nali mpeerezza ekimala naye akakiiko kaagaana olwa Kamonkoli.
mt0: <pad> Seventy years after my second appointment, I thought I was on the right track but the Fourth Council of the Commissioner's Committee decided that I should not be allowed to run.</s>

en: Secondly, because of the delays in Kamonkoli, the factory ended up costing much than it should have cost.
lug: Ekyokubiri, olw'okulwawo kwa Kamonkoli, ekkolero lyawunzika nga lisasudde kinene okusinga ku kye lyalina okusasula.
mt0: <pad> Second, because of the failure of the Commissioner, the school found itself having paid much more than it had to.</s>

en: It is true that up to 2008 we had been making profits.
lug: Kituufu nti okutuuka mu nkumi bbiri munaana twali tukola amagoba.
mt0: <pad> Truth be told, up to the year 1980 we were making leather.</s>

en: The East African Common Market is in place finally.
lug: Kyaddaaki akatale k'amawanga g'obugwanjuba bwa Afirika kagguse.
mt0: <pad> The Eastern African market was opened in 1995.</s>

en: The Common Market is a very big deal for Uganda Clays.
lug: Akatale k'omukago ka mugaso nnyo eri Uganda Clays.
mt0: <pad> The foreign market is very important for Uganda Clays.</s>

en: We are the biggest in the community in spite of our counterparts in Kenya producing at lower costs of production, but our quality is unmatched.
lug: Ffe tusinga obunene mu kitundu wadde nga bannaffe mu Kenya bafulumya ebyamaguzi ku miwendo egya wansi, naye omutindo gwaffe tegwenkanankana.
mt0: <pad> We are the biggest in the region even though our Kenyan counterparts export goods at lower prices, but our quality is not compromised.</s>

en: The job in Uganda Clays was tailor-made for me.
lug: Omulimu mu Uganda Clays gwateekebwawo nga gwange.
mt0: <pad> The job at Uganda Clays was arranged as mine.</s>

en: It has been a challenging but exciting eighteen years I have spent here, first as company secretary for nine years and then CEO for nine years.
lug: Kubadde kusoomoozebwa ate nga kisanyusa nti emyaka kkumi na munaana gye mmaze wano, okusooka ng'omuwandiisi wa kampuni okumala emyaka mwenda n'emirala mwenda nga ssenkulu.
mt0: <pad> It was a sad and exciting 18 years here, first as a company secretary for five years and then as a manager for five more.</s>

en: So I am carrying good memories for the company, the employees, and the board, especially the chairman, Professor Ssenfuma.
lug: Nolwekyo nina ebujjukizo bya kampuni ebirungi, abakozi, n'olukiiko, naddala ssentebe, pulofeesa Ssenfuma.
mt0: <pad> So I have a good memory of the company, the staff, and the board, especially the president, Mr. Prof. Ssenfuma.</s>

en: He has been my chairman since I became the chief executive officer in 2001.
lug: Abadde ssentebe wange okuva lwe nnafuuka ssenkulu w'ekitongole mu nkumi bbiri mu gumu.
mt0: <pad> He was my secretary since I became the director of the organization in 2010.</s>

en: Uganda Clays is a worker focused organisation in almost every way and I think that has been the basis of our success.
lug: Uganda Clays kitongole ekifaayo ennyo ku bakozi kumpi mu buli ngeri era ndowooza gwe gubadde omusingi gw'obuwanguzi bwaffe.
mt0: <pad> Uganda Clays is a very caring company in nearly every way and I think it has been the basis of our success.</s>

en: We have put employees first and you have seen this through the awards we have got from the Federation of Uganda Employers.
lug: Abakozi tubatadde ku mwanjo era kino mukirabye okuyita mu birabo bye tufunye okuva mu Federation of Uganda Employers.
mt0: <pad> The workers have been put on trial and you can see this through the letter we received from the Federation of Uganda Employers.</s>

en: In February next year I will make 64, how old are you?
lug: Mu gwokubiri omwaka ogujja nja kuweza emyaka nkaaga mu ena, olina emyaka emeka?
mt0: <pad> I'll be eighty in February next year, how old are you?</s>

en: In Africa that is old age.
lug: Mu Afirika, egyo myaka gya bukadde.
mt0: <pad> In Africa, those are the prehistoric years.</s>

en: I became the chief executive officer in 2001.
lug: Nafuuka ssenkulu w'ekitongole mu nkumi bbiri mu gumu.
