mt0: <pad> I became the chief of the organization in 2010.</s>

en: That means my contract has been renewed twice in 2004 and 2007.
lug: Ekyo kitegeeza nti kontulakiti yange ezziddwa buggya emirundi ebiri, mu nkumi bbiri mu ena ne nkumi bbiri musanvu.
mt0: <pad> That means my computer was hacked two times, in 2004 and 2007.</s>

en: John Wafula who has been the Chief Executive at Uganda Clays Kajjansi leaves office at the end of this year.
lug: John Wafula abadde ssenkulu wa Uganda clays Kajjansi ava mu woofiisi ku nkomerero y'omwaka guno.
mt0: <pad> John Wafula former president of Uganda Clays Kajjansi will step down at the end of this year.</s>

en: The Independent`s Patrick Kagenda talked to him.
lug: Patrick kagenda owa Independent yayogeddeko naye.
mt0: <pad> Patrick Kagenda of the Independent spoke to him.</s>

en: According to the Independent issue of July 23-29, Housing finance bank last week listed its oversubscribed bond on the Uganda securities exchange.
lug: Okusinziira ku Independent ku nsonga ya 23-29 Ogwomusanvu, bbanka ya Housing Finance wiiki ewedde yatimba olukalala lw'omugabo ogusinze oggulibwa ku Uganda Securities Exchange
mt0: <pad> According to the Independent on July 23, Housing Finance Bank last week announced its shareholding in the Uganda Securities Exchange.</s>

en: The lead participants in the bond, who invested more than 5 billion shillings, were the National Social Security Fund and Crane bank.
lug: Abeetabi abaasinga mu kibanda, abaateekamu ssente ezisukka mu buwumbi bwa siringi butaano baali ba National Security Fund ne Crane bank.
mt0: <pad> The biggest investors in the fund, with over five billion pounds invested, were the National Security Fund and Crane bank.</s>

en: The participants who invested more than 2.5 billion include the Stanbic Investment Management Services and the East African Development Bank.
lug: Abeetabamu abaasiga obuwumbi obusukka mu bubiri n'ekitundu mulimu Stanbic Investment Management Service ne East African Development Bank.
mt0: <pad> The investors who invested more than $2.2 billion include Stanbic Investment Management Service and East African Development Bank.</s>

en: Housing Finance Bank Director for Development Finance, Patrick Kabonero said the bank plans to concentrate on local funding to raise the 80 billion.
lug: Ssenkulu wa Housing Finance Bank For Developmet, Patrick Kabonero yagambye nti banka eteekateeka okussa essira ku kusiga ensimbi kuno okusobola okuweza obuwumbi kinaana.
mt0: <pad> The chief executive of the Housing Finance Bank For Development, Patrick Kabonero said the bank is planning to concentrate on this fundraising to raise the total to $400 million.</s>

en: MTN Uganda last week received its 5G network from Huawei Technologies of China.
lug: MTN Uganda wiiki ewedde yafuna neetiwaaka yaayo eya 5G okuva mu Hauwei Technologies ey'e Kyayina.
mt0: <pad> MTN Uganda last week received its 5G network from Chinese company Hauwei Technologies.</s>

en: MTN Chief Executive, Themba Khumalo said that they believe with such investments, Uganda will be among the fastest growing economies in Africa.
lug: Ssenkulu wa MTN, Themba Khumalo yagambye nti bakkiriza nti okusiga ensimbi nga kuno, Uganda ejja kuba mu mawanga agasinga okukulaakulanira ku misinde emingi mu Africa.
mt0: <pad> The CEO of MTN, Themba Khumalo said that they believe that with this investment, Uganda will be one of the most competitive countries in Africa.</s>

en: Investment in the 5G network is part of the 111 million dollars that MTN is reported to have budgeted for additional network investment.
lug: Okusiga ensimbi mu neetiwaaka ya 5G kitundu ku bukadde bwa ddoola 111 MTN bw'egambibwa okuba nga yabalirira okwongera okusiga mu neetiwaaka.
mt0: <pad> The investment in 5G network is part of the $11 billion MTN has announced to invest in the network.</s>

en: Last October, MTN signed a loan agreement with 11 commercial banks providing a one hundred million dollar for network investment.
lug: Omwezi gwekkumi oguwedde, MTN yassa omukono ku ndagaano y'ebbanja ne banka z'obusuubuzi 11 ne zigiwa obukadde bwa ddoola kikumi okuzisiga mu neetiwaaka.
mt0: <pad> Last October, MTN signed a bond deal with 11 commercial banks and they offered it $100 billion to invest in its network.</s>

en: MTN is connected to The East African Marine System cable and will connect to The East African Submarine Cable System, which goes live soon.
lug: MTN yayungibwa ku mukutu gwa The East African Marine System era ejja kuyungibwa ku The East African Submarine Cable System ogugenda ku mpewo mu bwangu.
mt0: <pad> MTN is connected to the East African Marine System and will be connected to the East African Submarine Cable System that provides faster air travel.</s>

en: Development Finance Company of Uganda Bank last week hosted its investment club members to a breakfast forum at the Kampala Serena Hotel.
lug: Development Finance company of Uganda Bank wiiki ewedde yakyaza bammemba b'ekibiina ekisiga ensimbi ku kyemisana ku Serena hotel mu Kampala.
mt0: <pad> The Development Finance Company of Uganda Bank last week welcomed the members of its board of directors at a meeting at the Serena Hotel in Kampala.</s>

en: The forum is aimed at equipping Development Finance Company of Uganda Investment Club members with skills to better manage their businesses.
lug: Omukutu guluubirira okuwa bammemba ba Development Finance Bank Company of Uganda Investment Club obukodyo okukwata obulungi bizinensi zaabwe.
mt0: <pad> The initiative aims to provide the members of the Development Finance Bank Company of Uganda Investment Club with the skills to manage their business better.</s>

en: Charles Ocici of Enterprise Uganda took the investment club members through a session on how to build lasting business clubs and investments.
lug: Charles Ocici owa Enterprise Uganda yasomesa bammemba b'ekibiina ekisiga ensimbi ku ngeri y'okuteekawo ebibiina bya bizinensi ebiwangaala n'okusiga ensimbi.
mt0: <pad> Charles Ocici of Enterprise Uganda educated the members of the fundraising network on how to set up and fundraise for small business groups.</s>

en: Ocici said that it takes more than just friendship but rather an investment in time and determination to build a strong brand.
lug: Ocici yagamba nti kitwala ekisukka ku mukwano wabula okusiga ensimbi mu budde n'obumalirivu okuzimba omutindo omugumu.
mt0: <pad> Ocici said it takes more than just a friend but investing money, time and skill to build a warm network.</s>

en: The Head of Women in Business Damalie Mukiibi said that the future of the country's economy is in the development of investment clubs.
lug: Akulira bizinensi z'abakyala Damalie Mukiibi yagambye nti ebiseera by'eggwanga eby'omu maaso mu by'enfuna biri mu kukulaakulanya bibiina by'okusiga ensimbi.
mt0: <pad> The director of women's business Damalie Mukiibi said that the country's future economic prospects are in developing micro-finance institutions.</s>

en: Standard Bank the mother bank of Stanbic Bank Uganda has been named the best investment bank in Africa in 2010.
lug: Standard Bank nnakazadde wa bbanka ya Stanbic Bank Uganda erondeddwa nga bbanka esinga okusiga ensimbi mu Afirika mu 2010.
mt0: <pad> Standard Bank, the former owner of Stanbic Bank Uganda, has been named the best bank in Africa in 2010.</s>

en: Jacko Maree, the Standard Bank Group chief executive said that it is particularly pleasing to be recognised in Africa's highly competitive banking sector.
lug: Jacko Maree, ssenkulu wa Standard Bank Group yagambye nti kisanyusiza ddala okusiimibwa mu kitongole kya zi bbanka mu Afirika ekirimu okuvuganya ennyo.
mt0: <pad> Jacko Maree, chief executive of Standard Bank Group said it was "very exciting" to be selected by the African bank industry which is very competitive.</s>

en: Being named as the best investment bank in Africa is further confirmation of our capacity to provide top quality services.
lug: Okulondebwayo nga bbanka esinga okusiga ensimbi mu Afirika kuba kwongera kukakasa busobozi bwaffe okutuusa obuweereza obw'omutindo ogwa waggulu.
mt0: <pad> The nomination as the best bank in Africa will only strengthen our commitment to delivering high-quality services.</s>

en: Standard Bank has a presence in 17 African countries, 16 countries outside the continent.
lug: Standard Bank eri mu nsi z'Afirika 17 ne mu nsi 16 wabweru wa ssemazinga.
mt0: <pad> Standard Bank is present in 17 African countries and 16 foreign countries.</s>

en: Opportunity Uganda, a microfinance institution, has dragged the Uganda Revenue Authority to commercial court for wrongful taxation.
lug: Ekitongole ky'ebyenfuna ekya Opportunity Uganda kitutte Uganda Revenue Authority mu kkooti y'ebyenfuna olw'okukiwooza emisolo mu bukyamu.
mt0: <pad> Opportunity Uganda has sued the Uganda Revenue Authority in the Economic Court for tax fraud.</s>

en: Post Bank Uganda was last week relieved from paying 288 million shillings in Value Added Tax arising from the sale of its land on William Street.
lug: Wiiki ewedde Post Bank Uganda yasonyiyibwa omusolo gwa bukadde 228 ku misolo egyali girina okweyongeramu ng'etunze ettaka ku luguudo lwa William Street.
mt0: <pad> Last week Post Bank Uganda was given an exemption of 228 million Ugandan shillings on the taxes it had to pay for its land in William Street.</s>

en: Opportunity Uganda is also contesting a stamp duty to the tune of 488 million shillings imposed on it by the tax body.
lug: Opportunity Uganda ewakanya omusolo ogw'obukadde bwa siringi 488 ogwagiteekebwako ekitongole ekiwooza ky'omusolo.
mt0: <pad> Opportunity Uganda has rejected the 488 million shillings tax imposed on it by the Tax Revenue Commission.</s>

en: It says it is not a credit institution if it is not obligated to work as a collecting agent for the Uganda Revenue Authority.
lug: Kigamba nti si kitongole ekiwozi ky'ensimbi bwe kiba nga tekirina layisinsi ya Uganda Revenue Authority ekikkiriza kukungaanya byamaguzi ebigenda okusaabazibwa.
mt0: <pad> It says that no finance institution can collect goods for taxes unless it has a licence from the Uganda Revenue Authority.</s>

en: Uganda Revenue Authority, without verifying the details of its transactions, wrongfully classified them by applying inappropriate stamp duty rates.
lug: Uganda revenue Authority nga tekakasizza biwandiiko okwaguliddwa ebintu, singa ebikolako mu bukyamu n'ebiggyako omusolo ogutatuukagana nabyo.
mt0: <pad> Uganda Revenue Authority has not verified the documents of the sale of goods, if they are in violation of the law and taxes that do not correspond to them.</s>

en: Development Finance Company of Uganda bank shareholders Khumalo Nicholas, Okwir, Aaron Agima and Damalie will host investment breakfast.
lug: Bannanyini migabo mu bbanka ya Development Finance Company of Uganda omuli Khumalo Nicholas, Okwir, Aaron Agima ne Damalie baakwogera ku by'okusiga ensimbi.
mt0: <pad> Nicholas Khumalo, Okwir, Aaron Agima and Damalie were among the senior bankers of the Development Finance Company of Uganda.</s>

en: In 1979, Harvard Business Review published an article by a young economist and associate professor, Michael E.
lug: Mu 1979, Harvard Business Review yafulumya ekiwandiiko kya munnabyanfuna omuto era eyali anaatera okufuuka Polofeesa, Michael E.
mt0: <pad> In 1979, Harvard Business Review published a paper by a young entrepreneur and soon to be professor, Michael E.</s>

en: Housing Finance Bank bond listed on use and sued for Shillings 500 million.
lug: Emigabo gya Housing Finance Bank egyalagibwa era n'ewawaabirwa mu mateeka lwa bukadde bwa siringi 500.
mt0: <pad> The Housing Finance Bank's activities are criticised and rejected by the court for the age of 500 British shillings.</s>

en: According to the Independent of July 23 - 29, 2010, awareness can help a company understand the structure of its industry.
lug: Okusinziira ku Independent owa nga 27 -29, 2010, okumanyisibwa kuyamba kkampani okumanya ekisaawe mw'ekolera.
mt0: <pad> According to the Independent of 27-29 October 2010, the publication helped the company understand the market it is working in.</s>

en: It was his first Havard Business Review article, and it started a revolution in the strategy field.
lug: Kye kiwandiiko kye ekya Havard Business Review ekyasooka era kyatandikawo enkyukakyuka mu kisaawe ekyo.
mt0: <pad> It was his first published article in the Havard Business Review and it began a revolution in the university.</s>

en: In subsequent decades, Porter's work has impacted health care and many other people's lives.
lug: Mu myaka egiddiridde, emirimu gya Porter gikoze kinene mu byobulamu ne mu bantu abalala bangi.
mt0: <pad> Over the years, Porter's work has done a lot for health and many other people.</s>

en: Porter's five forces have shaped a generation of academic research and business practice.
lug: Empagi gya Porter ettaano mu nzirukaya ya kkampuni zirambise okunoonyereza mu kusoma ne mu byobusuubuzi.
mt0: <pad> Four Porter pillars in the Porter Group have begun research in education and business.</s>

en: With assistance from Harvard Business School Professor Jan Rivkin and longtime colleague Joan Magretta, Porter extended the classic work.
lug: Ng'ayambibwako Polofeesa Jan Rivkin owa Harvard Business School ne munywanyi we gwe bamaze ebbanga eddene Joan Magretta, Porter yasobola okugaziya emirimu gye.
mt0: <pad> With the help of Professor Jan Rivkin of Harvard Business School and his longtime friend Joan Magretta, Porter was able to improve his work.</s>

en: Her attempt to reunite Ugandans around her position failed at that point.
lug: Okulafuubana kwe okw'okwagala okugatta Bannayuganda ng'akozesa ekifo ekyo kwagaana mu kaseera ako.
mt0: <pad> His attempt to unite the Ugandans by using that place was unsuccessful at the time.</s>

en: It is time for the government to try and bring Ugandans together on such an issue of national importance.
lug: Kye kiseera gavumenti okugezaako okugatta Bannayuganda ku nsonga ng'eyo egasiza awamu eggwanga.
mt0: <pad> It is time for the government to try to unite the people of Uganda on such a matter that unites the nation.</s>

en: Paget Kintu said that African Union member states have betrayed Africa.
lug: Paget Kintu yagamba nti amawanga ga African Union galiddemu Afirika olukwe.
mt0: <pad> Paget Kintu said that the African Union nations had done an act of war on Africa.</s>

en: The African Union 15th Summit in Kampala ended on July 27.
lug: Ttabamiruka wa African Union ow'omulundi ogw'e 15 eyatuula e Kampala yakomekkerezebwa nga 27 Gwomusanvu.
mt0: <pad> The 15th African Union Conference held in Kampala on 27 July was officially opened.</s>

en: Kwame Nkrumah one of Africa's greats said that revolutions are brought about by men who think as men of action and act as men of thought.
lug: Kwame Nkrumah omu ku bakyasinze mu Afirika yagamba nti enkyukakyuka zireetebwa abasajja abalowooza ng'abasajja ab'ebikolwa era ne bakola ng'abasajja abalowooza.
mt0: <pad> Kwame Nkrumah, one of the greatest Africans, said that change is brought about by men who think like men of action and act like men of thought.</s>

en: The Summit left doubt as to whether African States are capable of working together to solve Africa's most pressing challenges.
lug: Ttabamiruka yaleka okubuusabuusa oba ng'amawanga ga Afirika gasobola okukolera awamu okumalawo okusoomoozebwa okutawaanya ennyo Afirika.
mt0: <pad> The summit has not yet decided whether the African nations can work together to end the great poverty that has affected Africa so much.</s>

en: The July 11 bombings on Uganda now blamed on the Al-Quaeda, and Al-Shabab jihadist terrorists in Somalia.
lug: Okutulika kwa bbomu okwali mu Uganda mu gwomusanvu nga kkumi na lumu kwateekebwa ku bannalukalala ba Al-Quaeda ne Al-Shabab jihadist okuva e Somalia.
mt0: <pad> The July 11, 2007 bomb blast in Uganda was blamed on Al-Qaeda and Al-Shabab jihadist from Somalia.</s>

en: Despite the jihadist threats, Uganda became the first African nation to respond to the African Union call in 2007 to send troops to war-torn Somalia.
lug: Newankubadde waaliwo okutiisibwatiisibwa okuva mu ba jihadists, Uganda ly'eggwanga lya Afirika eryasooka okuddamu omulanga African Union mu nkumi bbiri mu musanvu okusindika amagye mu Somalia eyali etaaguddwataaguddwa olutalo.
mt0: <pad> Although there were some threats from jihadists, Uganda was the first African country to join the African Union in 2007 to send troops to Somalia which had been wracked by civil war.</s>

en: Uganda was followed by Burundi in sending troops to Somalia.
lug: Uganda yagobererwa Burundi mu kusindika amagye e Somalia.
mt0: <pad> Uganda was guided by Burundi in sending troops to Somalia.</s>

en: Uganda remained the lone nation in the African Union peace mission in Somalia until 2008 when it was followed by Burundi.
lug: Uganda y'ensi yokka eri mu African Union eyasigala ng'ekuuma emirembe mu Somalia okutuuka mu nkumi bbiri mu munaana bwe yeegattibwako Burundi.
mt0: <pad> Uganda is the only African Union country to have remained as a peacekeeper in Somalia until 2008 when it was joined by Burundi.</s>

en: Other African countries such as Ghana, Nigeria and Sierra Leone broke their commitment to send troops to flush out the Al-Shabab in Somalia.
lug: Amawanga ga Afirika amalala nga: Ghana, Nigeria ne Sierra Leone gaava ku bweyamo bw'okusindika amagye gaago okufufuggaza aba Al-Shabab e Somalia.
mt0: <pad> Other African countries such as Ghana, Nigeria and Sierra Leone have refused to send troops to fight Al-Shabab in Somalia.</s>

en: Until July 11, Uganda and Burundi remained the only countries in Somalia being drained both in personnel and equipment due to militant attacks.
lug: Okutuuka nga kkumi na lumu ogwomusanvu, Uganda ne Burundi ge mawanga gokka agaali gakyali e Somalia nga gakaluubirizibwa mu amagye n'ebikozesebwa olw'obulumbaganyi bw'abayeekera.
mt0: <pad> Uganda and Burundi were the only countries that were still in Somalia as of November 15, 2007, and were being limited in troops and equipment by the violence of the locals.</s>

en: There seems no concerted effort on the continent to end this growing terror in Somalia.
lug: Kirabika nga tewali nzikiriziganya ya kukolera wamu ku Ssemazinga okukomya ebikolwa eby'ekitujju ebikula mu Somalia.
mt0: <pad> There seems to be no consensus in the Somalian summit to stop the growing terrorist activities in Somalia.</s>

en: This has left only Uganda and Burundi to fight with the Lord Resistance Army uprising in northern Uganda and the troubles in Bujumbura.
lug: Kino kirese Uganda ne Burundi bokka okulwanagana n'obutabanguko bwa Lord Resistance Army mu bukiikakkono bwa Uganda n'obwegugungo mu Bujumbura.
mt0: <pad> This left Uganda and Burundi alone to fight the Lord Resistance Army in north-eastern Uganda and the rebellion in Bujumbura.</s>

en: The African Union states must show their commitment to solving Africa's problems not just by words by concrete action on the ground.
lug: Amawanga agali mu mukago ogutaba amanga ga Afirika galina okulaga obumalirivu bwago mu kugonjoola ebizibu Afirika nga tegakoma mu bigambo wabula nga gakolera ddala ku bizibu ebiriwo.
mt0: <pad> The African Union must show its resolve to address the problems of Africa not only in words but also in action.</s>

en: Nkrumah and Sekou Toure stood to liberate Africa from colonialism and yet today, no leader appears to borrow a leaf from them.
lug: Nkrumah ne Sekou Toure okununula Afirika okuva mu mikono gy'abafuzi b'amatwale kyokka mu kiseera kino tewali mukulembeze ayinza kubayigirako.
mt0: <pad> Nkrumah and Sekou Toure to free Africa from the hands of imperialists alone in this time no leader can learn from them</s>

en: That explains why the approval for the peacekeeping role in Somalia was left to only two countries for over three years now.
lug: Ekyo ekinnyonnyola lwaki okukakasa omulimi gw'okukuuma emirembe mu Somalia kwalekerwa ensi bbiri zokka okumala kati ebbanga lya myaka esatu.
mt0: <pad> That explains why the mandate to strengthen the peacekeeping force in Somalia has been left to two countries for three years.</s>

en: Allan Ssempebwa Kyobe of Makerere University thinks Al-Shabab claimed false responsibility.
lug: Allan Ssempebwa Kyobe owa Makerere University alowooza nti Al-Shabab yeewaana mu bukyamu.
mt0: <pad> Allan Ssempebwa Kyobe of Makerere University thinks that Al-Shabab is fighting in the wrong direction.</s>

en: if any Ugandan had been behind the terror attacks, with or without links to Al- Shabaab, they would never come out to take responsibility.
lug: Singa Munnayuganda yenna yabadde emabega w'obulumbaganyi bw'ekitujju oba ng'alina oba nga talina kawate ku Al-Shabaab, tebandivuddeyo kwewaana.
mt0: <pad> If any Ugandan was behind the terror attack or had any connection with Al-Shabaab, we would not have gone to war.</s>

en: The Ugandan security agencies need to continue with investigations despite the Al-Shabaab claim.
lug: Ebitongole by'ebyokwerinda mu Uganda birina okugenda mu maaso n'okunoonyereza newankubadde Al-Shabaab eraga nti yeeyakikola.
mt0: <pad> Ugandan security agencies must continue to investigate despite Al-Shabaab claiming to have done it.</s>

en: After the bomb blasts during the FIFA world cup final in two places in Kampala, Somali militants claimed responsibility.
lug: Oluvannyuma lw'okubwatuka kwa bbomu mu bifo ebibiri abantu gye baali balabira omupiira gwa fayinalo za FIFA world cup mu Kampala, abatujju okuva e Somali beewaana nti be baali emabega w'ekikolwa kino.
mt0: <pad> After the bomb blasts at two venues where people were watching the FIFA world cup final in Kampala, Somali refugees have claimed to be behind the attack.</s>

en: In his July 25 article in the Daily Monitor, Abu Ayman's attempt to prove to us that Islam is misrepresented by the terrorists confused us more.
lug: Mu mboozi ye eyafulumira mu Daily Monitor nga abiri mu ttaano ogwomusanvu Abu Ayman mwe yagerezaako okutulaga nti abayeekera bakozesa bubi Obusiraamu ne kitutabula.
mt0: <pad> In his speech published in the Daily Monitor on July 2, Abu Ayman tried to show us that the jihadists are abusing Islam and misleading us.</s>

en: David Kulubya wants to know the killing that Quran calls illegal.
lug: David Kulubya ayagala okumanya okutta Kolaani kw'egamba nti kumenya mateeka.
mt0: <pad> David Kulubya wants to know the murder of Kolain, which he says is illegal.</s>

en: He admits that the 72 virgin reward is indeed in the Hadith but it should not be taken to be true.
lug: Akkiriza nti ekirabo ky'embeera ensanvu mu omusanvu kyogerwako mu Aya naye tekirina kutwalibwa nti ntuufu.
mt0: <pad> He believes that the seven-part offer is mentioned in Aya but it should not be taken as true.</s>

en: Prophet Muhammad said that a believer remains in the scope of his religion.
lug: Nabbi Muhammad yagamba nti omukkirirza alina okutambulira mu ddiini ye.
mt0: <pad> Muhammad said that the believer should walk in his religion.</s>

en: The restoration of the East African common market is the non-material dream of all good globalists.
lug: Okuzzibwako kw'ensuubulagana y'amawanga ga East Afirika kuba kutuukiriza kirooto ekyannamaddala eky'okutambuza ebintu okusukka ensalo z'ensi zino.
mt0: <pad> The establishment of the East African Commonwealth is fulfilling an ancient dream of transporting goods across the continent.</s>

en: The East African Community goal is clear, a common economic space for all people, a space in which trade, capital, and people move freely.
lug: Ekiruubirirwa ky'omukago gwa East Africa kirambulukufu, ebyensuubulagana ebigatta abantu bonna ku bwereere, ekitundu ng'ebyobusuubuzi, entandikwa n'abantu nga beetaaya awatali kukugirwa.
mt0: <pad> The goal of the East African Union is clear, free trade between all people, the region as a commercial area, the start with the people as they want it without restrictions.</s>

en: Therefore, the East African Community's joined strategy calls for a more open border for the movement of goods and people.
lug: N'olw'ekyo omukago ogutaba amawanga ga East Africa gwaggulawo kaweefube w'okwongera okuggula ensalo zaago okusobozesa ebyamaguzi n'abantu okutambuala obulungi.
mt0: <pad> For this reason, the East African Community has launched a campaign to open its borders more widely to allow goods and people to trade more freely.</s>

en: It is absurd to believe that suddenly we can create a regional free trade area with Kenya without massive social-economic changes in our countries.
lug: Kyennyamiza okukkiriza nti tusobola okutandikawo ensuubulagana ne Kenya mu bunnambiro nga tetusoose kukola nkyukakyuka mu byanfuna mu mawanga gaffe.
mt0: <pad> It is very difficult to believe that we can start trade with Kenya in the short term without first making economic reforms in our countries.</s>

en: In common market countries, college education is free, but this can not happen in our East African Community setting.
lug: Mu mawanga agasuubuliganira awamu, okusoma ku ddaala lya college kwa bwereere, naye kino tekisobola kubaawo mu nkola yaffe ey'omukago ogutaba amawanga ga East Africa.
mt0: <pad> In developed countries, college education is free, but this cannot be true in our system of the Union of East African States.</s>

en: The East African Common Market was started in 1917 as a preindustrial stage.
lug: Okusuubulagana kw'amawanga ga East Africa kwatandika mu lukumi mu lwenda mu kkumi na musanvu nga tetunnatandika kukola byamaguzi ebiva mu makolero.
mt0: <pad> The East African Renaissance began in the mid-1970s before they started producing industrial goods.</s>

en: It was started to serve the British business interests and those settlers in Kenya.
lug: Kyatandikibwa okutuukiriza ebigendererwa by'Abangereza n'abo abaasenga mu Kenya.
mt0: <pad> It was created to fulfill the interests of the English and their allies in Kenya.</s>

en: Therefore, it came as no surprise that when joint services were established in 1945, Kenya benefited more than Uganda and Tanganyika.
lug: N'olw'ekyo, tekyagwa bugwi nti enkolagana ey'awamu bwe yatandikibwawo mu lukumi mu lwenda mu ana mw'etaano, Kenya yaganyulwa okusinga Uganda ne Tanzania.
mt0: <pad> So, it is no surprise that when the association was established in 1995, Kenya was successful in winning over Uganda and Tanzania.</s>

en: Kenya benefitted in terms of value-added to their Gross Domestic Product; more employment benefits and revenue.
lug: Kenya yaganyulwa mu ngeri omwali okwongera omutindo ku byamaguzi byabwe; emirimu n'omusolo.
mt0: <pad> Kenya has been encouraged in many ways, including improving the quality of its products; improving the employment and taxes.</s>

en: For instance, in 1971 the East Africa Railways employed 55% Kenyans, 33% Tanzanians and 12 per cent Ugandans.
lug: Ekyokulabirako, mu lukumi mu lwenda nsanvu mu gumu oluguudo lw'eggaali y'omukka olwa East Afirika lwawa Bannakenya ebitundu ataano mu bitaano ku buli kikumi emirimu, ebitundu asatu mu bisatu ku buli kikumi baali Batanzania n'ebitundu kkumi na bibiri ku buli kikumi baali Bannayuganda.
mt0: <pad> For example, in 2007 the East African Railway Company employed a fifth of the workforce as Kenyans, a third of the workforce was Tanzanians and a twelfth of the workforce was Ugandans.</s>

en: Kenya also had a higher manufacturing base than either Uganda or Tanzania, a situation that persists to date.
lug: Kenya era yalina amakolero mangi okusinga ku Uganda ne Tanzania, embeera eyo ebaddewo okutuusa leero.
mt0: <pad> Kenya also had more industries than Uganda and Tanzania, a situation that has been going on till today.</s>

en: To correct this uneven situation the British colonial government established the Raisman Commission in 1960.
lug: Okutereeza embeera eya kyekubiira eno, gavumenti y'abafuzi b'amatwale eya Bungereza yateekawo akaiiko ka Raisman Commission mu lukumi mu lwenda nkaaga.
mt0: <pad> To understand the situation of this crisis, the British government set up the Raisman Commission in 1800.</s>

en: According to Professor Brown, who was a member of the Commission, Kenya gained the most from the common market.
lug: Okusinziira ku Polofeesa Brown, eyali mmemba ku kakiiko kano, Kenya ye yasinga okuganyurwa mu katale k'awamu.
mt0: <pad> Professor Brown, a former member of the panel, said Kenya was the most favoured country in the overall list.</s>

en: Uganda gained marginally and Tanzania broke even.
lug: Uganda yafunamu kitono ate yo Tanzania yavaamu n'okuvaamu.
mt0: <pad> Uganda got little and Tanzania got nothing.</s>

en: Therefore, fiscal compensation to Tanganyika and Uganda through the distribution tool was recommended, as one of the solutions to this inequity.
lug: N'olw'ekyo, kyasalibwawo okuliyirira Tanzania ne Uganda mu by'ensimbi nga bagabana ebikozesebwa ng'omu ku kaweefube w'okumalawo obutali bwenkanya buno.
mt0: <pad> For that reason, it was decided to provide financial support to Tanzania and Uganda in order to share costs as part of an effort to end this unfairness.</s>

en: The sums involved were far short of what would be needed to lead to the development of industries in Uganda and Tanganyika.
lug: Ssente ezaateekebwamu zaali ntono nnyo okusinziira ku zaali zeetaagibwa okukulaakulanya eby'amakolero mu Uganda ne Tanganyika.
mt0: <pad> The funds allocated were too small compared to the need for development of industry in Uganda and Tanganyika.</s>

en: The sums that would be considered adequate were too high for Kenya to accept.
lug: Ssente ezanditwaliddwa nti ze zimala zaali nnyingi nnyo nga kizibu Kenya okuzikkirirza.
mt0: <pad> The amount of money that was supposed to be spent was so high that it would be difficult for Kenya to bear.</s>

en: I am now wondering what exactly was negotiated recently by the architects of the East African Community to address this situation.
lug: Kati nneebuuza ddala biki ebyateesebwako jjuuzi wakati w'abateeseza omukago ogutaba amawanga ga East Africa okusobola okutereeza embeera eno.
mt0: <pad> Now I wonder what was discussed yesterday between the negotiators of the East African Conference to try to rectify this situation?</s>

en: Abbey Kibirige Semuwemba confirms that the East African Community common market is an ideal dream.
lug: Abbey Kibirige Semuwemba akakasa nti ensuubulagana y'amawanga g'omukago gwa East Africa kikyali kirooto.
mt0: <pad> Abbey Kibirige Semuwemba says that the integration of East Africa is still a dream.</s>

en: According to the independent issue of July 30th to August 05, 2010, his act was unlawful.
lug: Okusinziira ku Independent owa nga asatu ogwomusanvu okutuuka nga ttaano ogwomunaana nkumi bbiri mu kkumi, ekikolwa kye tekyali mu mateeka.
mt0: <pad> According to the Independent of 3 July to 5 August 2010, the act was not legal.</s>

en: Byarugaba is excited at the news that finally a new Managing Director has been appointed at National Social Security Fund.
lug: Byarugaba musanyufu olw'amawulire nti kyaddaaki ssenkulu wa National Social Security Fund omuggya alondeddwa.
mt0: <pad> Byarugaba is happy with the news that a new director of the National Social Security Fund has been appointed.</s>

en: Richard Byarugaba takes over from Grace Isabirye who took over from David Jamwa and made him and Mondo Kagonyera pay their debts to NSSF.
lug: Richard Byarugaba adda mu bigere bya Grace Isabirye eyadda mu bigere bya David Jamwa eyaleetera ye ne Mondo Kagonyera okusasula amabanja gaabwe eri NSSF.
mt0: <pad> Richard Byarugaba takes over from Grace Isabirye who took over from David Jamwa who forced him and Mondo Kagonyera to pay their debts to the NSSF.</s>

en: I have never met Byarugaba but I have followed press reports about him over time.
lug: Sisisinkanagako Byarugaba naye mbadde ngoberera lipooti ezimwogerwako mu mawulire okumala akabanga.
mt0: <pad> I haven't met with Byarugaba but I've been following his media coverage for a long time.</s>

en: I was excited by the announcement that he was taking over at National Social Security Fund.
lug: Nasanyukira nnyo ekirangiriro yali alondeddwa ku National Social Security Fund.
mt0: <pad> I was very pleased with the award he received from the National Social Security Fund.</s>

en: He is no doubt better placed to drive National Social Security Fund forward.
lug: Tabuusubwabuusibwa nti y'asaanidde okutwala National Social Security Fund mu maaso.
mt0: <pad> He is reportedly to be in charge of the National Social Security Fund.</s>

en: His previous employment suggests he will make sound decisions in regard to prudent and viable investment of workers' savings
lug: By'akozeeko biraga nti ajja kukola okusalawo okutuufu mu kutereka n'okusiga obulungi ensimbi eziterekebwa abakozi.
mt0: <pad> His experience shows that he will make the right decisions in allocating and accounting for the money paid to employees.</s>

en: He can turn around the pension scheme, increase interest on workers' savings as well as returns on National Social Security Fund investments.
lug: Ayinza okulongoosaamu mu nkola ey'akasiimo, okwongera amagoba ku nsimbi abakozi ze batereka n'okubaddiza ku magoba agaba gavudde mu nsimbi eziba zisigiddwa.
mt0: <pad> He can make amendments by adding interest on the cost of the work and charging taxes on any profits from the deposits.</s>

en: As it is the tradition at National Social Security Fund let us not be quick to shoot him down.
lug: Nga bw'eri enkola ku National Social Security Fund, tuleke kwanguwa kumulemesa.
mt0: <pad> As a member of the National Social Security Fund, let's not be afraid to disqualify him.</s>

en: The time for being cynical about National Social Security Fund has long ticked away into the past.
lug: Ekiseera ky'okusuubira nti abantu beefaako bokka ku National Social Security Fund ekibaddewo emabega kyakufumwa bufumwa.
mt0: <pad> The time of expectation that people will only pay into the National Social Security Fund after the collapse of the economy</s>

en: Everybody deserves a fair chance and so let's give Byarugaba a chance.
lug: Buli agwana omukisa okutali bukwakkulizo, n'olw'ekyo tuwe Byarugaba omukisa.
mt0: <pad> Every one is blessed without conditions, so we are blessed to be a part of the journey.</s>

en: Duncan of Kyaliwajjala wouldn't call the current democracy competitive.
lug: Duncan ow'e Kyaliwajjala yabadde tasobola kuyita demokolasiya aliwo nti wa kuvuganya.
mt0: <pad> Duncan of Kyaliwajjala could not call it democracy but a vote.</s>

en: The National Resistance Movement has corruptly co-opted a large section of the electorate to serve the party's interests.
lug: National Resistance Movement era esazeewo okugulirira ettundutundu erisinga ery'ekitongole ky'ebyokulonda okutuukiriza ebigendererwa by'eibiina.
mt0: <pad> National Resistance Movement has also tried to buy the majority of the election commission to achieve the objectives of the committee.</s>

en: There is little competition for votes outside and inside the National Resistance Movement.
lug: Waliwo okuvuganyiza obululu kutono wabweru ne munda mu National Resistance Movement.
mt0: <pad> There are small political divisions outside and inside the National Resistance Movement.</s>

en: Ocheto said that Mwenda was wrong.
lug: Ocheto yagamba nti Mwenda yali mukyamu.
mt0: <pad> Ocheto said, "Maybe he was wrong."</s>

en: Andrew Mwenda missed a great point by just concentrating on symptoms and in so doing, he came up with a wrong solution to tackle the problem.
lug: Andrew Mwenda yalekayo ensonga enkulu n'ateeka essira ku bubonero era mu kukola kino, yawunzika n'enkola enkyamu okugonjoola ekizibu.
mt0: <pad> Andrew may have overlooked a major issue by focusing on the symptoms and in doing so, went with the wrong approach to solve the problem.</s>

en: Edgar says a section of the intellectual and political class in Uganda is too lazy to think over this paradox.
lug: Edgar agamba nti abayivu ne bannabyabufuzi b'omu Uganda banafu nnyo okulowooza ku mbeera eno y'okusoomooza.
mt0: <pad> Edgar says that the Ugandan intellectuals and politicians are too lazy to think about this situation of despair.</s>

en: There is an interesting discussion paper prepared by Ferraz and Finan at Berkeley in 2005.
lug: Waaliwo okukubaganya ebirowoozo ku kiwandiiko ekyategekebwa Ferraz ne Finan e Berkeley mu nkumi bbiri mu etaano.
mt0: <pad> There was a discussion of the paper by Ferraz and Finan at Berkeley in the 1980s.</s>

en: As Ocheto rightly observes, the absence of term limits in Uganda's constitution removes all such re-election incentives.
lug: Nga Ocheto bw'akiraba mu ngeri entuufu, obutabaawo kkomo ku bisanja mu Ssemateeka wa Uganda kiggyawo ebyandiyambyeko byonna mu kuddamu okulonda.
mt0: <pad> As Ocheto would see it in the right light, the absence of any amendments to the Ugandan constitution will destroy all the grounds for a re-election.</s>

en: Ocheto and Omeros think your points are questionable.
lug: Ocheto ne Omeros balowooza nti ensonga zo ziriko akabuuza.
mt0: <pad> Ocheto and Omeros thought that there were reasons for the question.</s>

en: Why should President Museveni put in place a competitive system that can cause him to lose power?
lug: Lwaki Pulezidenti Museveni ateekawo enkola ey'okuvuganya eyinza okumuviirako okuggyibwa mu buyinza?
mt0: <pad> Why President Museveni has introduced a system of voting that could lead to his ouster from power?</s>

en: Husain Haqqani, Pakistan's ambassador in Washington, addressed about Pakistan's contribution in the war on terror.
lug: Husain Haqqani, omubaka wa Pakistan e Washington, yannyonnyodde Pakistan ky'ekoze mu lutalo ku butujju.
mt0: <pad> Husain Haqqani, Pakistan's ambassador to Washington, outlined Pakistan's role in the war on terrorism.</s>

en: Andrew said democracy is not failing us, we are failing it.
lug: Andrew yagamba nti demokalasiya si y'atulemesa wabula ffe tumulemesa.
mt0: <pad> Andrew said that democracy is not what we teach it, but we teach it.</s>

en: According to the independent of July 30-August 5, 2010, how much money has been transferred in Uganda through the MTN mobile money services?
lug: Okusinziira ku Independent owa ng'asatu ogwomusanvu okutuuka nga ttaano ogwomunaana nkumi bbiri mu kkumi, ssente mmeka eziyisiddwa ku nkola ya MTN mobile money mu Uganda?
mt0: <pad> According to the Independent on Wednesday July 3 to Friday August 10, 2012, millions of dollars were transferred through MTN mobile money in Uganda.</s>

en: Bank of Africa has signed up billions of Uganda Shillings with the French Development Agency to guarantee loans for Small and Medium Enterprises.
lug: Bank of Africa etadde omukono ku buwumbi bwa siringi za Uganda n'ekitongole kya French Development Agency okusobozesa bubizinensi obutonotono okufuna looni.
mt0: <pad> Bank of Africa has signed a multi-million shilling deal with the French Development Agency to allow small businesses to get access to loan.</s>

en: Billions of Uganda Shillings was overdrawn from the Bank of Uganda.
lug: Obuwumbi bwa siringi za Uganda bwaggyiddwa mu Bank of Uganda.
mt0: <pad> Ugandan shillings of over one billion were withdrawn from the Bank of Uganda.</s>

en: The money was meant for the Ministry of Education.
lug: Ssente zaali zirina kuba za Minisitule y'ebyenjigiriza.
mt0: <pad> The money was to be for the Ministry of Education.</s>

en: The amount in billions of American dollars recently signed by Iran in a pipeline agreement is to send gas to Turkey.
lug: Omuwendo oguli mu buwumbi bwa ddoola za Amerika gye buvuddeko bwateekeddwako omukono gavumenti ya Iran mu ndagaano y'okusindika ggaasi e Turkey.
mt0: <pad> The Turkish government has signed a deal worth billions of US dollars with Iran to send gas to Turkey.</s>

en: The American bank Manager Goldman Sachs has agreed to pay 550,000,000 American dollars to settle civil fraud charges made against it.
lug: Maneja wa bbanka ya Amerika, Goldman Sachs akkirizza okusasula obukadde bwa ddoola za Amerika bitaano ataano mu butaano okuggyawo emisango gy'obufere egyamussibwako.
mt0: <pad> The chief executive of the American bank Goldman Sachs agreed to pay $45 billion to cover up allegations of fraud.</s>

en: The Kabale district administration was ordered by a court to pay 250,000,000 in millions of Ugandan Shillings to Gladys Aserua.
lug: Obukulembeze bwa disitulikiti y'e Kabale bwalagiddwa kkooti okusasula Gladys Aserua obukadde bwa siringi za Uganda bibiri ataano.
mt0: <pad> The Kabale District Council has been ordered by the court to pay Gladys Aserua 25 million Ugandan shillings.</s>

en: I condemn the attack on the innocent civilians in Kampala.
lug: Nvumirira obulumbaganyi obwakolebwa ku bantu ba bulijjo abatalina musango mu Kampala.
mt0: <pad> I condemn the violence committed against the common people in Kampala.</s>

en: Terror has no place in Africa and no place in humanity.
lug: Obutujju tebulina kifo mu Afirika ne mu buntu.
mt0: <pad> Slave trade is not allowed in Africa and in the free world.</s>

en: African Union chairman and Malawi president said those involved should find other ways of addressing their differences than waste human life.
lug: Ssentebe w'omukago gwa Afirika era nga ye Pulezidenti wa Malawi yagambye nti abo abakyenyigiddemu balina okufuna engeri endala ez'okugonjoola obutakkaanya bwabwe okusinga okutirimbula abantu.
mt0: <pad> The chairman of the African Union and President of Malawi, Dr. Peter Mutharika, said that those involved in the violence should find other ways to resolve their differences rather than killing people.</s>

en: Bingu wa Mutharika addressed presidents at the African Union Summit on July 25th.
lug: Bingu wa Mutharika yayogeddeko eri Bapulezidenti mu lukungaana lw'amawanga g'omukago gwa Afirika olwatuula ng'abiri mu ttaano ogwomusanvu.
mt0: <pad> President Bingu wa Mutharika spoke to the leaders of the African Union in July.</s>

en: We have paid a price in treasure and in blood over the last two years.
lug: Tusasudde mu kwagala ne mu musaayi mu myaka egisukka ebiri egiyise.
mt0: <pad> We have been stained with love and blood for over two decades.</s>

en: More Pakistani have been killed by terrorists, including our military officers and intelligence service officials.
lug: Abapakistani bangi batiddwa abatujju, nga mwe muli abaserikale baffe n'abakessi.
mt0: <pad> Many Pakistanis were killed by the Taliban, including our policemen and civilians.</s>

en: President Yoweri Museveni called for social-economic transformation to attain maternal and child health.
lug: Pulezidenti Yoweri Museveni yakubirizza abantu okwekulaakulanya kiyambeko okutereeza ebyobulamu bya bamaama abazaala n'eby'abaana abawere.
mt0: <pad> President Yoweri Museveni urged people to develop agricultural industries to improve the health of mothers and babies.</s>

en: If there was an attack on Venezuela from Colombian territory, promoted by the Yankee Empire, we would suspend oil shipments to the US. Venezuela's President Hugo Chavez threatened to suspend oil shipments to the United States of America in case of any attacks from Colombia.
lug: Singa waba nga waaliwo obulumbaganyi ku Venezuela okuva mu ttwale lya Colombia obwakolebwa Yankee Empire, twandiweze okutwala amafuta mu US. Pulezidenti wa Venezuela Hugo Chaves yatiisizzatiisizza okuyimiriza okutwala amafuta mu United States of America singa Colombia ekola obulumbaganyi bwokka.
mt0: <pad> If Colombia acts as an attack on Venezuela, we will stop exporting oil to the US. President of Venezuela Hugo Chaves has threatened to stop exporting oil to the United States of America if Colombia only acts as an attack on Venezuela.</s>

en: Chavez has threatened to halt oil exports to the United States if his country is attacked by Colombia.
lug: Chavez atiisizzatiisizza okucankalanya okutunda amafuta agatwalibwa mu United States ssinga eggwanga lye lirumbibwa Colombia.
mt0: <pad> Chavez has threatened to boycott oil imports from the United States if Colombia does not end its oil embargo.</s>

en: It's the first time since the fall of the regime 31 years ago that anyone responsible in any way for even a small number of the grave atrocities.
lug: Gwe mulundi ogwasoose bukyanga obukulembeze buva mu buyinza emyaka 31 emabega nga tewali muntu n'omu eyali akozesezza byuma bissi byonna.
mt0: <pad> It was the first time in 31 years that a government had been removed from power without having used any of the state-owned media.</s>

en: A prisoner of war is a man who tries to kill you and fails and then asks you not to kill him.
lug: Omusibe okuva mu lutalo y'oyo agezaako okukutta n'alemererwa n'oluvannyuma n'akusaba oleme kumutta.
mt0: <pad> The soldier from the war is the one who tried to kill you but failed and then begs you not to kill him.</s>

en: Winston Churchill said that we shall never know all the good that a simple smile can do.
lug: Winston Churchill yagamba nti tetulimanya birungi byonna akamwenyumwenyu akatono bye kasobola okukola.
mt0: <pad> Winston Churchill said that we don't know what good a small grain of salt can do.</s>

en: AMISOM as an AU and UN mandated peace keeping force has a limited capacity to protect the Presidential Palace, Mogadishu airport.
lug: AMISON ng'ekitongole kya AU ne UN ekikuumi ky'emirembe tekiyina buyinza bumala  okukuuma olubiri lw'obwapulezidenti, ekisaawe ky'ennyonyi ekya Mogadishu.
mt0: <pad> AMISON as an AU and UN peacekeepers does not have the authority to protect the presidential palace, Mogadishu airport or the capital.</s>

en: The Uganda People's Defence Force presence within the AMISOM framework does not answer the needs of the Ugandans.
lug: Okubeerawo kwa Uganda People's Defence Force mu  AMISON tekuyamba kumalawo  byetaago bya bannayuganda.
mt0: <pad> The presence of the Uganda People's Defence Force in AMISON does not help to meet the needs of the people of Uganda.</s>

en: When the population talks of wiping out Al-Shabaab from Somalia, they mean militarily defeating them thus removing ability of launching attacks.
lug: Abantu bwe boogera ku ky'okumalawo Al-Shabaab mu Somalia, bategeeza kubawangula mu kulwana olwo ne babeera nga tebakyasobola kukola bulumbaganyi.
mt0: <pad> When people talk about eliminating Al-Shabaab in Somalia, they mean their defeat in battle and their ability to carry out terror attacks.</s>

en: Since the Uganda People`s Defence Force cannot achieve that goal, the only feasible option is to withdraw from Somalia.
lug: Olw'okuba nti Uganda People's Defence Force tesobola kutuukiriza kigendererwa ekyo, engeri yokka esobola okukolebwa kwe kuva mu Somalia.
mt0: <pad> Since the Uganda People's Defence Force cannot achieve that goal, the only way to achieve it is from Somalia.</s>

en: We can then, as a member state of the UN, ask the UN Security Council for a mandate forcefully invade Somalia to pursue Al-Shabaab.
lug: Awo nno nga bammemba ba UN tusobola okusaba UN Security Council ejje mu Somalia ku mpaka efutize Al-Shabaab.
mt0: <pad> So we can ask the UN Security Council to come to Somalia to fight Al-Shabaab.</s>

en: This strategy would allow Uganda to launch attacks against the Al-Shabaab.
lug: Enkola eno yandisobozesa Uganda okukola obulumbaganyi ku Al-Shabaab.
mt0: <pad> This would allow Uganda to launch a campaign against Al-Shabaab.</s>

en: Bwesigye works with Advocates for Public International Law Uganda.
lug: Bwesigye akola ne Advocates for Public International Law Uganda.
mt0: <pad> Bwesigye works with Advocates for Public International Law Uganda.</s>

en: During its National Executive Conference in January, the NRM declared it had registered 8 million members including the under age.
lug: Mu lukiiko lwa National Exective Conference mu Gatonya, NRM yalangirira nti yali ewandiisizza bammemba obukadde 8 omuli n'abatannaweza myaka.
mt0: <pad> In the National Executive Conference on Monday, NRM announced that it had registered 8 million members including underage children.</s>

en: This was before the EC started the national voter registration exercise which also yielded about 15 million voters, up from 10 million in 2006.
lug: Kino kyaliwo nga EC tennatandika nkola ya kuwandiisa balonzi era kyayambako okutuusa  abalonzi okukunukkiriza obukadde 15 okuva ku bukadde 10 mu 2006.
mt0: <pad> This was before the EC began its electoral process and helped to bring the number of eligible voters up from 10 million in 2006 to 15 million in 2010.</s>

en: The NRM has been registering people it calls its members across the country.
lug: NRM ebadde ewandiisa abantu b'eyita bammemba baayo okwetooloola eggwanga.
mt0: <pad> The NRM was recruiting people it called members across the country.</s>

en: The Electoral Commission also doubts the authenticity of the NRM figures.
lug: Akakiiko k'ebyokulonda nako kabuusabuusa obutuufu bw'omuwendo gwa NRM.
mt0: <pad> The electoral commission also questioned the exact number of NRM.</s>

en: Early this year, the NRM also doubted the genuineness of the EC's national voter register, alleging that it contained two million ghost names.
lug: Ku ntandikwa y'omwaka guno, NRM nayo yabuusabuusa obutuufu bw'enkalala z'abalonzi eza EC ng'erumiriza nti zaalimu amannya ag'empewo obukadde bubiri.
mt0: <pad> In early this year, the NRM also questioned the authenticity of EC voting lists claiming that they contained two million fake names.</s>

en: Uganda's demographic statistics put the 2009 population projections to 30.6 million.
lug: Embalirira y'abantu mu Uganda mu 2009 eteebereza abantu okubeera mu bukadde 30.6.
mt0: <pad> The population of Uganda in 2009 is estimated at 30.6 million people.</s>

en: This implies that 14.2 million Ugandans are above 18 and thus qualified to register as voters.
lug: Kino kitegeeza nti bannayuganda obukadde 14.2 bali waggulu w'emyaka 18 n'olw'ekyo bakkirizibwa okwewandiisa ng'abalonzi.
mt0: <pad> This means that 14.2 million Ugandans are over 18 and therefore eligible to register as voters.</s>

en: Population estimates published by the Population Secretariat rise even more questions on the Electro Commission's 15 million voters.
lug: Enteebereza y'omuwendo gw'abantu eyafulumizibwa eggwandiisizo  eteekawo ebibuuzo bingi ku balonzi obukadde 15 obw'akakiiko k'ebyokulonda.
mt0: <pad> The estimated population of the draft raises many questions about the 15 million electors of the National Assembly.</s>

en: The estimates for 2010 show Ugandans of 18 years and above are 13.9 million, up from 12.9 million in 2008.
lug: Enteebereza ya 2010 eraga bannaganda ab'emyaka 18 n'okusukkawo bali obukadde 13.9 okuva ku bukadde 12.9 mu 2008.
mt0: <pad> The 2010 estimates showed that the number of Ugandans aged 18 and over was 13.9 million, up from 12.9 million in 2008.</s>

en: Given the high apathy among Ugandans to register for voting and death of some registered voters, the number of new voters would be fewer.
lug: Olw'okuba nti bannayuganda tebaagala nnyo kwewandiisa kulonda n'okufa kw'abalonzi abamu abeewandiisa, omuwendo gw'abalonzi abapya gwandibadde mutono.
mt0: <pad> Because the Ugandans don't like to register for elections and some of the registered voters died, the number of new voters will be small.</s>

en: However, the EC has said this is not the final figure.
lug: Newankubadde, EC egambye nti guno si gwe muwendo ogw'enkomeredde.
mt0: <pad> However, EC said that this is not the final number.</s>

en: Some MPs in the NRM have already accused the secretariat of creating ghost members on the register which could facilitate rigging the primaries.
lug: Ababaka abamu mu NRM bamaze okunenya eggwandiisizo olw'okutondawo bammemba ab'empewo ku lukalala ekiyinza okuleetawo okubba obululu mu kamyufu.
mt0: <pad> Some members of the NRM have already questioned the legality of appointing proxy members on the list which could lead to electoral fraud in the powerhouse.</s>

en: Kinkizi East MP Chris Baryomunsi, has cited that a person's name would be manipulated to appear several times on the same register differently.
lug: Omubaka wa Kinkizi East Chris Baryomunsi anokoddeyo nti erinnya ly'omuntu liyinza okukyusibwakyusibwa ne lirabikira ku lukalala lwe lumu mu ngeri ez'enjawulo.
mt0: <pad> The MP for Kinkizi East Chris Baryomunsi explained that a person's name can be altered and appear on the same list in different ways.</s>

en: At the recent NRM National Conference, some delegates complained that even well-known opposition members had been on the party register.
lug: Ku lukiiko lwa NRM National Conference, abakiise abamu beemulugunyizza nti ne bammemba abali ku ludda oluvaganya abamanyiddwa baabadde ku lukalala lw'ekibiina.
mt0: <pad> At the National Conference of the NRM, some delegates complained that even known opponents were on the list of members of the party.</s>

en: This had been done by some NRM officials for selfish interests.
lug: Kino kyali kikoleddwa abakungu ba NRM abamu abeeyagaliza ebyabwe.
mt0: <pad> This was done by some NRM officials who were looking for their own interests.</s>

en: The NRM deputy spokesman Ofwono Opondo has said that not all 9 million party registered members are eligible to vote as 1 million are minors.
lug: Amyuka omwogezi wa NRM Ofwono Opondo agambye nti si bammemba b'ekibiina bonna obukadde 9 abaawandiisibwa nti balonzi abatuukiridde kuba akakadde 1 si balonzi.
mt0: <pad> The deputy spokesman for the National Resistance Movement Ofwono Opondo said that not all 9 million members of the NRM are voters.</s>

en: However,a big question is; who will stop a 16 year old registered NRM member from voting if they registered with the EC ?
lug: Wabula ekibuuzo ekinene kiri nti; ani anaatangira mmemba wa NRM ow'emyaka 16 okulonda singa baba nga beewandiisa ne EC?
mt0: <pad> But the biggest question is: who will start a 16 year old NRM member to vote if they register with the EC?</s>

en: Statistics show that Uganda's population has been growing at the rate of 3.2 per annum since 2003.
lug: Ebibalo biraga nti obungi bwa bannayuganda bubadde bukulira ku bitundu 3.2 buli mwaka okuva mu 2003.
mt0: <pad> Statistics show that the population of Uganda has grown by 3.2 percent every year since 2003.</s>

en: Godber Tumushabe, ED of ACODE, a local think-tank on public policy analysis, is skeptical about the NRM claim of 9 million members.
lug: Godbler Tumushabe, ED wa ACODE, omutunuulizi w'embeera z'abantu, abuusabuusa NRM okugamba nti erina bammemba obukadde 9.
mt0: <pad> Godbler Tumushabe, ED of ACODE, a human rights analyst, has denied the NRM's claim that it has over one million members.</s>

en: It was not proper for the National Resistance Movement to register before the national Electoral Commission exercise.
lug: Tekyali kituufu National Resistance Movement okuwandiisa nga Electoral Commission tennatandika mulimu.
mt0: <pad> It was not right for the National Resistance Movement to register before the Electoral Commission began its work.</s>

en: He says political parties should focus on the EC national voter register for it is easy to verify and it's more credible than any party's register.
lug: Agamba nti ebibiina byobufuzi birina kussa essira ku lukalala lw'abalonzi olwa EC kuba lwangu okukakasa era nti lutuufu nnyo okusinga olukalala lw'ekibiina kyonna.
mt0: <pad> He said that the political parties should focus on the EC's list of voters as it is easy to verify and more precise than any other party's report.</s>

en: In 2011 Electoral Commission registers 15m voters, NRM enrolls 9m; do the figures lie?
lug: Mu 2011 Electoral Commission yawandiisa abalonzi obukadde 15, NRM yawandiika obukadde 9; Ennamba zirimba?
mt0: <pad> In 2011 the Electoral Commission counted 15, NRM registered 9; The numbers are growing.</s>

en: The Police regrets the incidents and thanks all the people who participated in the evacuation and management of the victims.
lug: Poliisi enakuwala olw'ebyatukawo era ne yeebaza abantu bonna abeenyigidde mu kusengula n'okukwasaganya abaakoseddwa.
mt0: <pad> The police department apologizes for the incident and thanked all those who participated in rescuing and supporting the victims.</s>

en: We therefore, call upon all members of the public to be aware of this threat join the Police and other agencies to fight and prevent its occurrence.
lug: N'olwekyo tukubira omulanga abantu b'ekitundu bonna okuba obulindaala eri ekizibu kino, mwegatte ku poliisi n'ebitongole ebirala okukirwanyisa n'okukitangira okutuukawo.
mt0: <pad> So we urge the mayor of the entire community to be vigilant to this problem, and work with the police and other agencies to fight it and prevent it from happening again.</s>

en: We strongly urge organizers of public events such as parties, concerts, open air public prayers, sports and others should involve the police.
lug: Tusabira ddala abateesiteese b'emikolo egibaako abantu abangi ng'obubaga, ebivvulu, okusaba okuli mu byereeerezi, ebyemizannyo n'abalala balina okwetabyamu poliisi.
mt0: <pad> We advise that organizers of large public events such as weddings, concerts, public worship, sports and others should call the police.</s>

en: We hereby give notice to the proprietors of the following, that teams of Police will visit their premises to ensure availability of adequate security.
lug: N'olwekyo tutegeeza ba nannyini bino nti, poliisi ejja kutuuka mu bifo bino okusobola okulaba nti waliwo obukuumi obumala.
mt0: <pad> So we are telling the owners that the police will be going to these areas to make sure that there is a full security.</s>

en: We call upon every member of the public with any information of security nature to call the following toll free lines;
lug: Tukoowoola omuntu yenna alina obubaka bwonna obwebyokwerinda okukuba ku nnamba zino ezitali za kusasulira.
mt0: <pad> We encourage any person with any security information to call these free numbers.</s>
<pad> If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know</s>

en: At their weekly press conference, the EC chairperson Eng Kiggundu told the public that they hadn't lent their registration kits to the NRM as alleged.
lug: Ku lukungaana lwa banamawulire olwa wiiki eno, ssentebe wa EC yinginiya Kiggundu yagambye abantu nti tebaapangisa ba NRM byambalo byabwe mwe bawandiisiza abantu nga bwe kirumizibwa.
mt0: <pad> In a press conference held this week, the EC chairman engineer Kiggundu told people that they don't give NRM their uniforms when it is sent.</s>

en: The NRM has been registering its voters using registration kits that resemble the ones of the EC in the recent national voter registration exercise.
lug: NRM ebadde ewandiisa abalonzi baayo ng'ekozesa kiiti z'okuwandiisa ezifaanaana eza EC mu kuwandiisa abalonzi okubaddewo gye buvuddeko.
mt0: <pad> NRM had registered its voters using the same registration cards used by EC in the previous election.</s>

en: There have been allegations in some media outlets that EC lent out its equipment to certain political parties to enable them register supporters.
lug: Wabaddewo ebibadde byogerebwa ku mikutu gy'amawulire egimu nti EC yapangisa ebibiina by'ebyobufuzi ebimu ebintu byayo by'ekozesa mu kuwandiisa abantu okubisobozesa okuwandiika abalonzi.
mt0: <pad> There were reports in some media that the EC had given some political parties its registration materials to allow them to register voters.</s>

en: "The commission categorically denies this allegation",Eng. Kiggundu said.
lug: Akakiiko keeganira ddala ebyogerebwa bino, yinginiya Kiggundu yagamba.
mt0: <pad> The committee agrees with all these recommendations, Mr. Kiggundu said.</s>

en: Kiggundu said that they concluded the update of the national voters' register on June 18, 2010 and retrieved all the equipment from the field.
lug: Kiggundu yagambye nti baamaliriza okuzza obuggya enkalala z'abalonzi nga 18 ogwomunaana, 2010 era ne baggya ebikozesebwa byonna mu bantu.
mt0: <pad> Kiggundu said they completed removing all election posters on 18 August 2010 and removed all electoral materials from the public.</s>

en: He said the equipment would be packed and sent to the Ministry of Internal Affairs after completion of data transfer.
lug: Yagamba nti ebikozesebwa bya kutegekebwa ne bisindikibwa ku minisitule y'ensonga z'omunda oluvannyuma lw'okumaliriza okusindika obubaka.
mt0: <pad> He said that the supplies were arranged and sent to the ministry of foreign affairs after finishing the publication of the message.</s>

en: According to Kiggundu, by July 13, the EC had uploaded 4,670,585 voters, which constitute 97% of the voters they registered in the last registration.
lug: Okusinziira ku Kiggundu nga 13 Ogwomusanvu, EC yali etaddeyo abalonzi 4,670,585, abaali baweza ebitundu 97% eby'abalonzi be baawandiisa mu kuwandiika okwasembayo.
mt0: <pad> According to the Ugandan Gazette of 13 July, EC had registered 4,670,585 voters, who represented 97% of the electorate in the final round of the election.</s>

en: According to Kiggundu, of the 4,670,585 voters, 4290,634 were registered as new, 326,609 as transferring, and 53,342 whose photos were missing.
lug: Okusinzira ku Kiggundu, ku balonzi 4,670,585, 4,290,634 be baawandisibwa nga bapya, 326,609 nga bakyusa, ne 53,342 nga baali tebalinaako bifaananyi.
mt0: <pad> According to the statistics, 4,290,634 of the 4,670,585 members were new, 326,609 were a re-entry, and 53,342 were no photo.</s>

en: The Electoral Commission expects to start displaying the national voter register on August 11 and end it on August 30.
lug: Akakiiko k'ebyokulonda kasuubira okutandika okutimba enkalala z'abalonzi nga 11 Ogwomunaana era kufundikirwe nga 30 Ogwomunaana.
mt0: <pad> The Electoral Commission is expected to begin processing voting ballots on August 11 and the polls will be open on August 30.</s>

en: This means the EC has most of its equipment lying idle when they could earn money needed to boost their election budget if they rented them out.
lug: Kino kitegeeza nti ebikozesebwa bya EC ebisinga tebirina kye bikola era bandifunyeemu ssente okwongera ku mbalirira yaabwe singa babipangisa.
mt0: <pad> This means that most EC devices are useless and would make money to add to their stock if they were rented.</s>

en: However, the Electoral Commission spokesman Paul Bukenya said the constitution does not allow them to do income generating business.
lug: Wabula, omwogezi w'akakiiko k'ebyokulonda Paul Bukenya yagamba nti ssemateeka tabakkiriza kukola mulimu guvaamu nsimbi.
mt0: <pad> But, a spokesman for the Electoral Commission Paul Bukenya said that the constitution does not allow them to do any business that generates money.</s>

en: Considering that government has consistently failed to meet the commission's budget, the EC could explore ways of generating its own income.
lug: Okusinziira nti gavumenti ezze eremererwa okutuukiriza embalirira y'akakiiko, EC yandinoonyezza engeri gy'efunamu ssente ezaayo.
mt0: <pad> Since the government has been unable to meet the EC's demands, the EC has developed a mechanism to raise its own revenues.</s>

en: Last week, the Electoral Commission had to defend itself why it cannot give every opposition party a copy of the national voters' register.
lug: Wiiiki ewedde, akakiiko k'ebyokulonda kaalina okwewozaako lwaki tekasobola kuwa buli kibiina kivuganya kkopi y'olukalala lw'abalonzi.
mt0: <pad> Last week, the electoral commission had to apologize for not being able to give every candidate a copy of the voting register.</s>

en: The Electoral Commission said it would be too expensive.
lug: Akakiiko k'ebyokulonda kaagamba nti kyandibadde kya buseere nnyo.
mt0: <pad> The electoral commission said it would be very costly.</s>

en: If the EC had other sources of revenue other than relying on remittances from the national treasury, it would reduce on such financial constraints.
lug: Singa akakiiko k'ebyokulonda kaalina we kasobola okuggya ensimbi okusinga okwesigama ku ssente entono okuva mu ggwanika ly'eggwanga, kyandikendeezezza ku buzibu bw'ensimbi nga buno.
mt0: <pad> If the electoral commission had more money to spend than relying on small amounts from the national treasury, it would have reduced this fiscal crisis.</s>

en: However, upon growing pressure from the opposition who accused the EC of incompetence, it revised its stand.
lug: Wabula, okusinziira ku maanyi agava mu bavuganya abaanenyezza EC olw'obutaba na busobozi, keetegerezza enkola yaako.
mt0: <pad> But, based on the pressure from the activists who denounced EC for incompetence, I decided to adopt its methodology.</s>

en: It promised to give the voter registers to the political parties.
lug: Kaasubiza okuwa enkalala z'abalonzi eri ebibiina byobufuzi.
mt0: <pad> He promised to give electoral registers to the political parties.</s>

en: The Electoral Commission management have added that they are in talks with government for additional money for this purpose.
lug: Abaddukanya akakiiko k'ebyokulonda baagasseeko nti bali mu njogerezeganya ne gavumenti okufuna ssente ez'ennyongereza ku nsonga eno.
mt0: <pad> The electoral commission also said that they were in discussions with the government to get extra money for this purpose.</s>

en: Electoral Commission denies lending its equipment to National Resistance Movement during the independent July 23 - 29, 2010 election.
lug: Akakiiko k'ebyokulonda keegaana okupangisa National Resistance Movement ebintu byako mu kulonda okwetengeredde okwa nga 23-29, 2010.
mt0: <pad> The Electoral Commission refused to allow the National Resistance Movement to participate in the elections held on 23-29, 2010.</s>

en: The "fresh-election-call" was made in a statement issued by Uganda Patriotic Movement Secretary General Bidandi Ssali in Kampala yesterday.
lug: Omulanga gw'okuddamu okulonda, gwakoleddwa mu sitatimenti eyafulumiziddwa Uganda Patriotic Movement Secretary General Bidandi Ssali mu Kampla eggulo.
mt0: <pad> The announcement of the re-election was made in a statement issued by Uganda Patriotic Movement Secretary General Bidandi Ssali in Kampla yesterday.</s>

en: The UPM wishes to reiterate to the world and particularly Ugandans that the forthcoming elections will be held under certain conditions.
lug: UPM esuubira okuddira ensi naddala bannayuganda nti okulonda okujja kujja kukolebwa wansi w'obukwakkulizo obumu.
mt0: <pad> UPM hopes to assure the country and its people that the next election will be held under the same conditions.</s>

en: These conditions have already rendered the elections unfair and unfree.
lug: Obukwakkulizo buno bumaze okufuula okulonda obutaba kwa mazima na bwenkanya.
mt0: <pad> This means that the election of the parliamentary assembly has become a fair and transparent process.</s>

en: Right from the beginning, it was clear that the Chairman of the Military Commission had motives other than organizing a free and fair election.
lug: Okuviira ddala mu ntandikwa, kyali kirabikirawo nti ssentebe w'akakiiko k'amagye yalina ebigendererwa okusinga okutegeka okulonda okw'amazima n'obwenkanya.
mt0: <pad> From the very beginning, it was clear that the chairman of the military commission had other motives than to organize fair and transparent elections.</s>

en: For instance the constituency where our President Yoweri Museveni`s contesting has been unlawfully altered at least three times.
lug: Okugeza mu konsitituwensi Pulezidenti waffe Yoweri Museveni gye yavuganya ebadde ekyusiddwa mu bukyamu ekitono ennyo emirundi esatu.
mt0: <pad> For example, the constitution where our President Yoweri Museveni spoke was changed in the wrong way three times.</s>

en: This includes last week and all in a vain attempt to minimize his support.
lug: Kino kitwaliramu ne wiiki ewedde era mu ngeri y'emu egezaako okukendeeza obuwagizi bwe.
mt0: <pad> This continued last week and in the same way it tried to reduce its impact.</s>

en: In all cases those who were denied registration were known opponents of UPC .
lug: Mu ngeri zonna abo bonna abaagaaniddwa okuwandiisibwa baali bantu abamanyiddwa nga ba UPC.
mt0: <pad> However, all those who were refused registration were people known as UPC.</s>

en: The imported foreigners registered were in all cases brought by UPC.
lug: Abagwira abaaleeteddwa ne bawandiisibwa mu ngeri zonna baaleetebwa UPC.
mt0: <pad> The UPC has a list of all the employees hired and registered by the UPC.</s>

en: During the nomination exercise, sixteen Uganda Patriotic Movement candidates were disqualified.
lug: Mu kusunsulwamu, abeesimbyewo kkumi na mukaaga aba Uganda Patriotic Movement baasuuliddwa ebbali.
mt0: <pad> In the transition, eighteen members of the Uganda Patriotic Movement were arrested and three were killed.</s>

en: Other UPM candidates were denied nomination on grounds that their ability to speak English was not ascertainable.
lug: Aba UPM abalala baagaaniddwa okusunsulwamu ku bigambibwa nti tebaalina busobozi bw'ogera Lungereza.
mt0: <pad> Other UPMs were refused to be taken out on the grounds that they couldn't speak English.</s>

en: These included a Lecturer Mr. Chango Macho and a Catholic Father Rev.Okoth.
lug: Bino mwabaddemu ssaabasomesa mwami Chango Macho ne Faaza Omukatolika Lev. Okoth.
mt0: <pad> They were educated by King Chango Macho and Reverend Lev. Okoth.</s>

en: All our petitions about nominations have been ignored by the Electoral Commission, for example, by the men of "integrity".
lug: Okwemulugunya kwaffe kwonna ku kusunsulwamu kugaaniddwa akakiiko k'ebyokulonda, okugeza abasajja abeesimbu.
mt0: <pad> Our complaints about the exclusion were refused by the Electoral Commission, for example, men who are elderly.</s>

en: Up to now, fifteen District Commissioners have been retired arbitrarily by the Chairman of the Military Commission.
lug: Okutuuka kati, bakamisona ba disitulikiti kkumi na bataano baawummuziddwa ssentebe w'akakiiko k'amagye mu ngeri etategeerekeka.
mt0: <pad> To date, 15 district commissioners have been removed by the chairman of the military council in an unexplained way.</s>

en: These District Commissioners were also the Returning Officers.
lug: Bakamisona ba disitulikiti bano era be baali bakulira okulonda mu bitundu.
mt0: <pad> These commissioners were also in charge of the election in their districts.</s>

en: The 15th was fired only two days ago apparently because when Obote went to Rukungiri there was no one to address people.
lug: Ow'ekkumi n'abatano yagobebwa ennaku bbiri emabega kubanga Obote bwe yagenda e Rukungiri tewaaliwo muntu yenna kwogerako eri abantu.
mt0: <pad> 15 was announced two days ago because Obote's trip to Ruanda wasn't announced by anyone.</s>

en: But why did the South African police arrest you?
lug: Naye lwaki poliisi ya South Africa yakukwata?
mt0: <pad> Why did South African police arrest me?</s>

en: I fell out with Kabila and returned to Rwanda.
lug: Nayawukana ne Kabila ne nzirayo e Rwanda.
mt0: <pad> I met Kabila through Rwanda.</s>

en: Kayumba is my friend and he knows that I cannot do something like that to him.
lug: Kayumba mukwano gwange era akimanyi nti sisobola kumukola kintu bwe kityo.
mt0: <pad> Kayumba is my friend and he knows that I can't do him that way.</s>

en: Do you still work for Rwandan intelligence?
lug: Okyakolera ekitongole kya Rwanda ekikessi?
mt0: <pad> Does he work for a private Rwandan organization?</s>

en: I used to be a soldier in the Ugandan army, later, Rwandan army and finally in the Congolese army.
lug: Nali mujaasi mu ggye lya Uganda, ne mmala ne ngenda mu ggye ly'e Rwanda ne nsembayo mu eggye lya Congo.
mt0: <pad> I was a soldier in the Ugandan army, then I went to the Rwandan army and finally to the Congolese army.</s>

en: In Congo, I was the Commanding Officer of the Presidential Guard of Laurent Kabila.
lug: Mu Congo nali mudduumizi w'eggye erikuuma Pulezidenti erya Loteenanti Kabila.
mt0: <pad> In Congo I was the head of the security forces of President Kabila.</s>

en: He spoke to the Independent's Andrew Mwenda on Kayumba`s shooting; "Karegyeya engineered my detention".
lug: Yayogerako ne munnamawulire wa Independent Andrew Mwenda ku kukubibwa kwa Kayumba amasasi nti Karegyeya ye yakulemberamu okumukuumira mu kkomera.
mt0: <pad> He told the Independent journalist Andrew Mwenda about Kayumba Nyamwasa's shooting that Karegyeya was in charge of arresting him.</s>

en: He is influential in the government of South Africa and sits on the National Executive Committee of the ruling Africa National Congress.
lug: Wa maanyi mu gavumenti ya South Africa era atuula ki kakiiko akafuzi ak'ekibiina ekiri mu buyinza ekya National Congress.
mt0: <pad> He is a powerful member of the South African government and sits on the Executive Committee of the ruling National Congress.</s>

en: Kayumba was also visited by the South African chief of police and the head of South Africa's military intelligence.
lug: Kayumba yakyalirwa ssaabapoliisi wa South Africa n'akulira obukessi mu magye.
mt0: <pad> Kayumba was recognized by South African police and the chief of the intelligence service.</s>

en: It is said that all these powerful Africa National Congress and government officials were there due to Masetera's influence.
lug: Kigambibwa nti abakungu ba Africa National Congress bano bonna b'amaanyi baaliwo olw'amaanyi ga Masetera.
mt0: <pad> They are all very powerful in the African National Congress.</s>

en: The involvement of powerful personalities from the South African government has caused some rifts in the relationship between the two countries.
lug: Okwenyigiramu kw'abantu ab'amaanyi okuva mu gavumenti ya South Africa kuleeseewo obutakkaanya mu nkolagana wakati w'amawanga abiri.
mt0: <pad> The interference of senior South African politicians has led to problems in the relations between the two countries.</s>

en: Some Rwandan insiders claim it has also biased the investigation into the Kayumba attempted assassination.
lug: Abanyalwanda abamu ab'omunda era bagamba nti kigootaanyizza okunoonyereza ku kugezaako okukuba Kayumba amasasi.
mt0: <pad> Some Ugandans in the country also say it has hampered the investigation into the attempt to kill Kayumba.</s>

en: A Rwandan source, told the Independent that Karegyeya was the one giving South African police tips on whom to arrest.
lug: Ensonda okuva mu Rwanda, yategeezezza Independent nti Karegeya ye yali awa poliisi ya South Africa obubaka ku ani abeera akwatibwa.
mt0: <pad> The source told the Independent that Karegeya was the one who gave South African police information on who was being held.</s>

en: Gakwerera also claims he was arrested on the advice of Karegyeya.
lug: Gakwerera naye agamba nti yakwatibwa ku magezi ga Karegyeya.
mt0: <pad> simply say you don't know</s>

en: Further, Rwandan officials have openly accused the South African police of incompetence.
lug: Okwongerako, Abakungu mu Rwanda bazze malumiriza poliisi ya South Africa obutaba na busobozi.
mt0: <pad> Also, Rwandan officials have accused South African police of not having the capacity to arrest the suspects.</s>

en: They claim that immediately Kayumba was shot, the first people taken to make police statements are those he had in the car.
lug: Bagamba nti amangu ddala nga Kayumba akubiddwa amasasi, abantu abaasooka okutwalibwa okukola sitatimenti ku poliisi be bo be yali nabo mu mmotoka.
mt0: <pad> They say that right after Kayumba was shot, the first people to be brought to the police station to testify were the people he was with in his car.</s>

en: However, a South African diplomat worsened things when he mentioned in an interview that the Rwandan government was behind the shooting.
lug: Wabula, omukungu okuva e South Africa yasajjula ebintu bwe yayogerera mu yintaaviyu nti gavumenti ya Rwanda ye yali mabega w'okukuba amasasi gano.
mt0: <pad> But the South African analyst went on to say in an interview that the Rwandan government was behind the attack.</s>

en: The Kayumba case seems to be setting the relationship between the two nations into a dangerous balance.
lug: Omusango gwa Kayumba gulabise okuteeka enkolagana wakati w'amawanga abiri mu lusuubo olw'obulabe.
mt0: <pad> The case of Kayumba has threatened to put relations between the two countries at risk because of the danger.</s>

en: But there is more; the Rwandan government had applied for the deportation of Kayumba on charges of terrorism.
lug: Naye waliwo ekisingawo, gavumenti y'e Rwanda yali esabye okukomyawo Kayumba olw'emisango gy'obuyeekera.
mt0: <pad> But there is something more, the government of Rwanda had requested Kayumba to be extradited for alleged crimes against humanity.</s>

en: On April 6, Spain submitted its own application to deport Kayumba on charges of crimes against humanity.
lug: Nga 6 Ogwokuna, Spain yawaayo okusaba kwayo okuzza Kayumba olw'emisango gy'okutyoboola eddembe ly'obuntu.
mt0: <pad> On June 6, Spain refused to extradite Kayumba Nyamwasa for human rights abuses.</s>

en: Two days later, France also applied for the same.
lug: Nga waakayitawo ennaku bbiri Bufalansa nayo yasaba ky'ekimu.
mt0: <pad> Two days later France also asked for the same thing.</s>

en: Kayumba could afford to rubbish Rwanda's claims against him because it is a poor country whose accusations can easily be disregarded.
lug: Kayumba yali asobola okugamba nti Rwanda by'emulumiriza nti tebiriimu nsa kubanga ggwanga lyavu nga bye lyogera bisobola okugaanibwa amangu.
mt0: <pad> Kayumba could have said that Rwanda's accusations were unfounded because a small country with a weak government can be quickly denied.</s>

en: However, France and Spain are powerful nations considered to be mature democracies and reasonable in their actions.
lug: Wabula, Bufalansa ne Spain nsi zikirimaanyi ezitwalibwa okuba ne demokolasiya ow'amaanyi n'ebikolwa eby'amaanyi.
mt0: <pad> But France and Spain are developed countries that are said to have strong democracies and strong institutions.</s>

en: So,their applications could carry more weight with South Africa.
lug: N'olw'ekyo, okusaba kwazo kwali kuzito ne South Africa.
mt0: <pad> For that reason, their request was rejected by South Africa.</s>

en: What is clear, however, is that by the time he was shot, Kayumba had begun to reassess his options.
lug: Wabula ekyo ekirabibwako, kirinti mu biseera we yakubibwa amasasi, Kayumba yali atandise okukola okusalawo kwe.
mt0: <pad> But whatever that is, by the time Kayumba was shot, he had already begun to make his decisions.</s>

en: Deportation applications from Spain and France showed that Kayumba and Kagame shared a stronger common threat.
lug: Bufalansa ne Spain okusaba okumuzza, kyalaga nti Kayumba ne Kagame baalina beerinako okutya okw'amaanyi.
mt0: <pad> France and Spain to ask for his extradition, showed that Kayumba and Kagame had a strong fear of each other.</s>

en: This common threat was stronger than the issues that separate them.
lug: Okutya kuno kwali kwa maanyi nnyo okusinga ekibaawula.
mt0: <pad> This food was much stronger than the poison.</s>

en: So, he began making contact with Kigali.
lug: N'olw'ekyo yatandika okukwatagana ne Kigali.
mt0: <pad> For that he started to communicate with Kigali.</s>

en: Kayumba is a close personal friend to Maj.Gen.Steven Kashaka, currently Uganda's military ambassador to South Africa.
lug: Kayumba mukwano nnyo gwa Maj. Gen. Steven Kashaka nga mu kiseera kino ye mubaka w'amagye ga Uganda mu South Africa.
mt0: <pad> Kayumba is a close friend of Maj. Gen. Steven Kashaka, who is currently the ambassador of the Ugandan army to South Africa.</s>

en: According to Francis Gakwerera, this thing was engineered by Patrick Karegyeya, the former director of Rwanda's External Security.
lug: Okusinziira ku Francis Gakwerera, kino kyayongerwamu amaanyi Patrick Karegyeya, eyali akulembera ebyokwerinda bya Rwanda eby'ebweru.
mt0: <pad> According to Francis Gakwerera, this strengthened Patrick Karegyeya, the former head of Rwanda's foreign security.</s>

en: Whenever I travel through South Africa, I meet and talk with Karegyeya because he is also my friend.
