lug: Buli lwe ntambula mu South Africa, nsisinkana era ne njogerako ne Karegyeya kubanga naye mukwano gwange.
mt0: <pad> Every time I travel to South Africa, I meet and talk to Karegyeya because he is my friend.</s>

en: He sometimes picks me from the airport whenever I get into South Africa.
lug: Ebiseera embimu ankima ku kisaawe ky'ennyonyi buli lwe ntuuka mu South Africa.
mt0: <pad> I often wait at the airport every time I arrive in South Africa.</s>

en: On this occasion, I got into South Africa on Wednesday and called him on Friday, the day before Kayumba was shot.
lug: Ku mulundi guno, Natuuka mu South Africa ku lwokusatu ne mmukubira ku lwokutaano, olunaku lumu nga tannakubwa masasi.
mt0: <pad> This time, I arrived in South Africa on Wednesday and left on Thursday, a day before my arrest.</s>

en: On Saturday, I had a lunch appointment with Karegyeya which he cancelled saying he was going to watch soccer.
lug: Ku lwomukaga, nalina enteekateeka y'okulya ekyemisana ne Karegyeya naye n'agisazaamu ng'agamba nti yali agenda kulaba mupiira.
mt0: <pad> On Saturday, I had planned to have a breakfast with Karega but he cancelled it because he was going to watch football.</s>

en: He later called me saying Kayumba had been shot.
lug: Oluvannyuma n'ankubira ng'agamba nti Kayumba yali akubiddwa esasi n'afa.
mt0: <pad> He then added that Kayumba was shot dead.</s>

en: I called him thirty minutes later to ask about Kayumba`s state but he said he was busy and promised to call back.
lug: Namukubira oluvannyuma lw'eddakiika asatu okumubuuza ku mbeera Kayumba gye yalimu naye n'agamba nti yali alina by'akolako n'asuubiza okuddamu okunkubira.
mt0: <pad> I called him after 3 minutes to ask about Kayumba's condition but he said he had something to do and hoped to call me back.</s>

en: I was at the home of Albert Gatare, a brother of the late Miko.
lug: Nali mu maka ga Albert Gatare muganda w'omugenzi Miko omulenzi.
mt0: <pad> I was at Albert Gatare's house, the brother of late Miko.</s>

en: He told me that Kayumba was in Riverside Hospital.
lug: Yangamba nti Kayumba yali mu ddwaliro ly'e Riverside.
mt0: <pad> He said Kayumba was in Riverside Hospital.</s>

en: It is at that moment that the police called me and said they wanted me.
lug: Mu kiseera ekyo poliisi yankubira n'engamba nti yali eneetaaga.
mt0: <pad> The police called me and said they needed me.</s>

en: Nine police men then came in heavily armed.
lug: Abasajja aba poliisi mwenda oluvannyuma bajja nga balina ebyokulwanyisa bingi.
mt0: <pad> The seven policemen came back with a lot of weapons.</s>

en: There were many policemen with police dogs.
lug: Waaliwo abapoliisi bangi nga balina embwa za poliisi.
mt0: <pad> There were many policemen with their police dogs.</s>

en: Then on Sunday night, almost 30 hours later, they brought other suspects including Richard who turned out to be Kayumba's driver.
lug: Oluvannyuma ku Sande ekiro, nga waakayita kumpi essaawa amakumi asatu, baaleeta abateeberezebwa abalala omwali ne Richard eyalinga ddereeva wa Kayumba.
mt0: <pad> After about 30 hours on Sunday night, they brought in other suspects including Richard, who was Kayumba's driver.</s>

en: The other suspects included two Rwandans, a Kenyan and a Tanzanian.
lug: Abateeberezebwa abalala mwalimu Abanyalwanda babiri, Omunakenya n'Omutanzaniya.
mt0: <pad> Other suspects include two Rwandans, a Kenyan and a Tanzanian.</s>

en: They asked me if I knew any of the suspects and I knew the two Rwandans.
lug: Baambuuza oba nali manyi omu ku bateeberezebwa nga mmanyi Abanyalwanda ababiri.
mt0: <pad> When I was asked if I knew one of the accused, I said I know two Rwandans.</s>

en: He told me that he was actually involved in the shooting of Kayumba.
lug: Yangamba nti yali yeenyigira mu kukuba Kayumba amasasi.
mt0: <pad> He says he was involved in the bombing of Kayumba.</s>

en: He said someone called him on telephone saying his name was Dr. Ndahiro.
lug: Yagamba nti waliwo eyamukubira essimu ng'agamba ye dokita Ndahiro.
mt0: <pad> He said that someone called him and said he was Dr. Ndahiro.</s>

en: He promised to give him two thousand United States dollars if he helped them kill Kayumba that is an enemy of Rwanda.
lug: Yasuubiza okumuwa ddoola z'Amerika enkumi bbiri singa abayambako okutta Kayumba eyali omulabe wa Rwanda.
mt0: <pad> He promised him $ 200 if he could kill Kayumba Nyamwasa, a former enemy of Rwanda.</s>

en: He said that Dr. Ndahiro promised that the driver would be rewarded by President Paul Kagame if he cooperated.
lug: Yagamba nti dokita Ndahiro yasuubiza nti ddereeva yandisiimiddwa Pulezidenti Paul Kagame singa yali akolaganye nabo.
mt0: <pad> He said that Dr. Ndahiro hoped the driver would be thanked by President Paul Kagame if he had spoken to them.</s>

en: The driver also said that the shooting was the second attempt on Kayumba's life.
lug: Ddereeva naye yagambye nti okukuba amasasi lwe lwali olulumba olwokubiri ku bulamu bwa Kayumba.
mt0: <pad> Ddereeva also said that the attack was the second in the life of Kayumba.</s>

en: Kayumba was sleeping in his bed with his wife.
lug: Kayumba yali yeebase mu buliri ne mukyala we.
mt0: <pad> Kayumba was hiding in the shed with his wife.</s>

en: Three days later, he tipped them off when Kayumba and wife were going to the shopping mall.
lug: Ennaku ssatu oluvannyuma, yabatwalako Kayumba ne mukyalawe bwe baali bagenda ku ssemaduuka.
mt0: <pad> Three days later, he took Kayumba and his wife while they were going to the market.</s>

en: First, I understood him to be referring to Dr.Emmanuel Ndahiro, the head of the National Security Services.
lug: Okusooka, namutegeera ng'ajuliza ku dokita Emmanuel Ndahiro, akulira National Security Services.
mt0: <pad> First, I knew him through Dr. Emmanuel Ndahiro, Director of National Security Services.</s>

en: So, I asked him if he knew this Ndahiro and he said no.
lug: N'olw'ekyo, namubuuza oba nga yali amanyi Ndahiro ono, n'agamba nti nedda.
mt0: <pad> So I asked him if he knew this story, and he said no.</s>

en: So I asked him why he believed that it was Dr. Ndahiro.
lug: N'olw'ekyo namubuuza lwaki yali asuubira nti ye yali dokita Ndahiro.
mt0: <pad> So I asked him why he thought he was Dr. Ndahiro.</s>

en: I was commanding officer of the presidential guard of rebel leader and later President Laurent Kabila.
lug: Nze nali omuduumizi w'eggye erikuuma Pulezidenti w'abayeekera n'oluvannyuma eyafuuka Loteenanti Kabila.
mt0: <pad> I was the commander of the guards of the former president and later a general Kabila.</s>

en: So I know, the story of Kayumba's shooting is all deceptive.
lug: N'olw'ekyo nkimanyi nti emboozi y'okukuba Kayumba amasasi yonna enyumizibwa bunyumizibwa.
mt0: <pad> For that reason, I know that the rumors of killing Kayumba are true.</s>

en: Then the killer went over to the side of Kayumba and they had a physical fight.
lug: Awo omutemu n'agenda eri Kayumba ne batandika okulwana.
mt0: <pad> The killer then went to Kayumba and they began to fight.</s>

en: We were then transferred to John Foster Prison on Monday.
lug: Oluvannyuma ku Mmande twatwalibwa mu kkomera lya John Foster.
mt0: <pad> Afterwards on Wednesday we were moved to John Foster's home.</s>

en: Kayumba's driver recorded his statement in my presence and he repeated to the police what he had told me in jail.
lug: Ddereeva wa Kayumba yakola siteetimenti ye nga wendi era n'addamu okugamba poliisi bye yali ang'ambye mu kkomera.
mt0: <pad> The driver of Kayumba Nyamwasa gave his statement in a separate courtroom and re-told the police what he had seen in jail.</s>

en: These people were not victimized in any way after the overthrow of Amin.
lug: Abantu bano tebaavunaanibwa oluvannyuma lw'okuggyako Amin.
mt0: <pad> These people were not prosecuted after Amin was killed.</s>

en: But there was evidence against them that they aided Amin in Killing Uganda People's Congress members.
lug: Naye waaliwo obujulizi obubalumiriza nti baayambako Amin mu kutta bammemba ba Uganda People's Congress.
mt0: <pad> But there was evidence that they helped Amin kill members of the Uganda People's Congress.</s>

en: Let Kahigiriza come here and contradict my words, if what I say is not correct.
lug: Leka Kahigiriza ajje wano awakanye ebigambo byange, bwe mba nga bye njogera si bituufu.
mt0: <pad> Let the teacher come here and challenge my words, if I am not right.</s>

en: While addressing another rally in Buzabo's constituency, Muwanga warned saying;
lug: Bwe yabadde ng'ayogera mu lukungaana olulala mu konsitituwensi ya Buzabo, Muwanga yalabudde ng'agamba;
mt0: <pad> When he was speaking at another meeting in Buganda's Bulabo constituency, Muwanga took a long time to say that he knew the truth.</s>

en: "Take the message to Buzabo and all the Democratic Party supporters that they must stop the dirty politics immediately".
lug: Twala obubaka eri Buzabo n'abawagizi ba Democratic Party nti bateekeddwa okukomya ebyobufuzi byabwe eby'emivuyo mu bunnambiro.
mt0: <pad> We send a message to Buzabo and the supporters of the Democratic Party that they must stop their political fraud in the early hours.</s>

en: The liberty which was brought by the Uganda People's Congress cost people's lives some died in Lake Victoria, others between Mutukula and Arua.
lug: Eddembe eryaleetebwa Uganda people's congress lyaviirako abantu bangi okufiirwa obulamu bwabwe abamu baafiira mu nnyanja Nalubaale abalala wakati wa Mutukula ne Arua.
mt0: <pad> The peace brought by the Uganda people's congress has led to many people losing their lives some in the Nalubaale river others between Mutukula and Arua.</s>

en: They sacrificed their lives for the freedom of everyone in Uganda.
lug: Baasaddaaka obulamu bwabwe ku lw'eddembe lya buli omu ali mu Uganda.
mt0: <pad> They sacrificed their lives for the peace of every person in Uganda.</s>

en: Muwanga warned that, members of different parties should not claim to have an upper hand on others by molesting them.
lug: Muwanga yalabude nti bammemba b'ebibiina eby'enjawulo tebateekeddwa kukaayana kubaamu na mukono ogwawaggulu nga banyiiza abalala.
mt0: <pad> Muwanga warned that members of different religious groups should not compete to be the most powerful and dominate.</s>

en: Muwanga talked to the Uganda people's Congress in Mbirizi, Masaka South-West constituency.
lug: Muwanga yayogeddeko eri Uganda People's Congress e Mbirizi mu konsitituwensi ya Masaka South-West.
mt0: <pad> Muwanga spoke to the Uganda People's Congress in Mbirizi in Masaka South-West constituency.</s>

en: The 65 year old chairman who effectively participated in last years' liberation war which toppled Amin said:
lug: Ssentebe w'emyaka 65 omwaka oguwedde eyeenyigira obutereevu mu lutalo lw'ameenunula olw'aggyako Amin yagambye;
mt0: <pad> The 65-year-old Senator who last year joined the resistance movement for his wife's release said he was "very proud" of his contribution to the fight for freedom.</s>

en: "You the youth of Uganda People's Congress will spearhead the reconstruction and development task".
lug: Mwe abavubuka ba Uganda People's Congress mujja kukulemberamu omulimu gw'okuzzaawo awamu n'okulaakulanya.
mt0: <pad> You, the young people of the Uganda People's Congress, will lead the work of reconstruction and development.</s>

en: "The first thing the Uganda People's Congress will do as soon as it comes to power will be to engage the youth in productive work.
lug: Ekintu ekisooka Uganda People's Congress ky'ejja okusookera ddala okukola ng'ezze mu buyinza kujja kuba kunyigira bavubuka mu mirimu egizimba.
mt0: <pad> The first thing the Uganda People's Congress will do when it comes to power will be to train young people in building jobs.</s>

en: Uganda People's Congress youths will spearhead this so as to set an example to the rest.
lug: Abavubuka ba Uganda People's Congress bajja kukulemberamu kino okusobola okuteekawo ekyokulabirako eri abalala.
mt0: <pad> The Ugandan youths of the Uganda People's Congress will lead this to set a good example for others.</s>

en: Muwanga also appealed to Ugandans to strive hard and establish mutual respect for each other.
lug: Muwanga era yasaba bannayuganda okufuba ennyo okwewangana ekitiibwa.
mt0: <pad> Muwanga also urged Ugandans to work harder to win respect.</s>

en: At Bwezibwera, the chairman pledged, never again shall the Uganda People's Congress allow Uganda to be humiliated as it was in the Amin's days.
lug: E Bwezibwera, ssentebe yeeyamye, aba Uganda People's Congress tebajja kuddamu kukkiriza Uganda okuddamu okujoogebwa nga bwe kyali mu biseera bya Amin.
mt0: <pad> When the president agreed, the Uganda People's Congress would not allow Uganda to be ruled again like it was in Amin's time.</s>

en: Never shall Uganda be characterized with the life of scarcities of essential commodities.
lug: Uganda teribeera mu mbeera ya bbulwa ly'ebintu ebikozesebwa mu bulamu obwa bulijjo.
mt0: <pad> Uganda does not suffer from shortages of basic necessities.</s>

en: Uganda People's Congress needs determined characters who would stand with this nation even in difficult times.
lug: Uganda People's Congress yeetaaga abantu abamalirivu abanaayimirira nayo ne mu biseera ebizibu.
mt0: <pad> The Uganda People's Congress needs people who will stand with it even in difficult times.</s>

en: Commenting on the Democratic Party led by Paulo Kawanga Semogerere, he said it was characterized by contradictions.
lug: Okwogera ku Democratic Party ekulirwa Paulo Kawanga Semogerere, yagambye nti kwalimu okukontana.
mt0: <pad> Speaking about the Democratic Party led by Paul Kawanga Semogerere, he said there was a fight.</s>

en: He commended Semogerere for his ability to lead a party which was almost torn apart by contradictions.
lug: Yasembye Semogerere ku lw'obusobozi bwe okukulembera ekibiina ekyali kumpi kitaaguddwataaguddwa okwetema engalize.
mt0: <pad> He praised Semogerere for his ability to lead a group that was almost unable to understand English.</s>

en: The Democratic Party, serious contender with the Uganda People's Congress in the polls, had given away more that 10 parliamentary seats.
lug: Democratic party eyali evuganya ennyo ne Uganda People's Congress mu kalulu, yali eviiriddwako ebifo bya paalamenti ebisukka 10.
mt0: <pad> The Democratic Party, which had been in close competition with the Uganda People's Congress in the election, had been denied over half of the parliamentary seats.</s>

en: I tend to think that Semogerere is only unfortunate to lead such men.
lug: Ngenda ne ndowooza nti Semogerere talina bubeezi mukisa ku kulembera bantu ng'abo.
mt0: <pad> I think that Semogerere is not very lucky to be in charge of such people.</s>

en: Otherwise, how can we have the 1980 parliamentary candidates who cannot fill in the forms and present them in time?
lug: Mu ngeri endala, tusobola tutya okuba n'abavuganya ku bubaka bwa paalamenti mu 1980 nga tebasobola kujjuza mpapula ne baziwaayo mu budde.
mt0: <pad> In other words, can we ever have a parliamentary debate in 1980 when they couldn't fill in the paperwork and deliver it on time?</s>

en: Nakasi's story is heartbreaking.
lug: Emboozi ya Nakasi emenya omutima.
mt0: <pad> The voice of Nakasi touches the heart.</s>

en: This series is compiled and reproduced by John Njoroge.
lug: Obutundutundu buno bwakungaanyiziddwa era ne buddamu okufulumizibwa John Njoroge.
mt0: <pad> The segment was compiled and re-released by John Njoroge.</s>

en: According to the independent issued on Jul 30- August 05, 2010, Rosebell Kagumire reported that;
lug: Okusinziira ku Independent eyafulumizibwa nga 30 Ogwomusanvu okutuuka nga 05 Ogwomunaana 2010, Rosebell Kagumire yagamba nti;
mt0: <pad> According to the Independent published on 30 July to 5 August 2010, Rosebell Kagumire said that she was pregnant with her first child.</s>

en: A young woman who was returning home outside the countryside town of Soroti was raped.
lug: Omuwala eyabadde adda ewaka wabweru w'ekibuga kya Soroti yasobezeddwako.
mt0: <pad> A woman who was walking home from the city of Charlotte was followed by a man.</s>

en: The 28 year old Grace Nakasi was a victim of an insurgency in eastern Uganda.
lug: Grace Nakasi ow'emyaka 28 yakosebwa akatabanguko mu bugwanjuba bwa Uganda.
mt0: <pad> Grace Nakasi, 28, was killed in an accident in the east of Uganda.</s>

en: She was pulled off the road to the bush and gang-raped by the men in uniform.
lug: Yasikiddwa okuva ku kkubo n'atwalibwa mu nsiko n'asobezebwako ekibinja ky'abasajja abaali mu yunifomu.
mt0: <pad> He was taken from the road and brought into the forest and attacked by a group of men in uniforms.</s>

en: I was living in Soroti town.
lug: Nali mbeera mu kibuga ky'e Soroti.
mt0: <pad> I lived in the city of Soroti.</s>

en: I met nine soldiers on patrol at about 7:00 pm.
lug: Nasisinkanye abajaasi mwenda ku paatulo ku ssaawa nga 7:00 ez'ekawungeezi.
mt0: <pad> I met all the drivers at the gate at 7 o'clock in the morning.</s>

en: Nakasi begins her story by narrating how they all raped her and abandoned by the roadside.
lug: Nakasi atandika emboozi ye ng'attottola engeri bonna gye baamusobyako ne bamuleka ku mabbali g'ekkubo.
mt0: <pad> Nakasi begins his story by telling how everyone abused him and left him on the side of the road.</s>

en: This was 1987, a year after President Yoweri Museveni had captured the reigns of state power.
lug: Guno gwali mwaka gwa 1987, nga Pulezidenti Yoweri Museveni awambye obuyinza bw'eggwanga.
mt0: <pad> It was 1987, when President Yoweri Museveni took power.</s>

en: He announced "a fundamental change", not a mere change of guard.
lug: Yalangirira enkyukakyuka ey'omuggundu so si kukyusa bukyusa bakuumi.
mt0: <pad> He announced a radical change, not a stable change.</s>

en: The heinous incident marked the dawn of repeated sexual violence against Nakasi and many other women in conflict areas.
lug: Akaseera k'entiisa kano ke kaali entandikwa y'okusobya ku Nakasi entakera n'abakyala abalala abaali mu bitundu ebirimu obutabanguko.
mt0: <pad> This horrific time was the beginning of rape for Nakasi and other women in the areas of unrest.</s>

en: "I decided to go to the bus park to take a bus to visit my home," Nakasi narrates with suppressed sadness.
lug: Nasazeewo okugenda mu paaka ya bbaasi nninnye bbaasi ngende ewange, Nakasi anyumya nga munakuwavu.
mt0: <pad> I tried to go to the bus stop and take a small bus home, but my driver knew I was elderly.</s>

en: It was on the way to the bus park that Nakasi became a victim of the second rape.
lug: Nakasi  asobezebweko omulundi ogwokubiri ku lugendo lwe okutuuka ku paaka ya bbaasi .
mt0: <pad> Nakasi was attacked twice on her way to the bus stop.</s>

en: Nakasi narrated, "I met four National Resistance Army soldiers, two of them dragged me off the road and forced themselves on me".
lug: Nakasi ya ttotodde, "nasisinkanye abajaasi ba National Resistance Movement bana, babiri ku bo ne bansika okuva ku luguudo ne banneekakaatikako."
mt0: <pad> Nakasi added, "I met four National Resistance Movement soldiers, two of them had escaped from the road and tried to get away."</s>

en: Nakasi a mother of 12 children, a resident of Soroti, was raped 16 times, infected with HIV.
lug: Nakasi maama ow'abaana 12, mutuuze w'e Soroti, yasobezebwako emirundi 16, n'asiigibwa akawuka akaleeta mukenenya.
mt0: <pad> Nakasi, a 12-year-old mother of 12 children, was followed 16 times and diagnosed with chronic fatigue syndrome.</s>

en: She was later thrown out of her marital home by the enraged husband.
lug: Oluvannyuma yagobebwa baawe omunyiivu mu maka ge ag'empeta.
mt0: <pad> He was then adopted by his wealthy father into his poor family.</s>

en: It's a touching narrative and a wider reflection of the tribulations women face in Africa's conflict-torn regions.
lug: Yabadde mboozi ekwata ku muntu nga yeefumiitiriza ku kaseera akazibu abakazi ke basanga mu bifo bya Afirika ebirimu obutabanguko.
mt0: <pad> It was a personal voice that reflected on the difficult situation women faced in African areas of unrest.</s>

en: She is one of the faces of Ugandan women that carry the burden of sexual violence.
lug: Y'omu ku bakyala abannayuganda abasanga ekizibu ky'okukabassanyizibwa.
mt0: <pad> She is one of the Ugandan women who face the problem of harassment.</s>

en: For the past decade Uganda has been applauded on the world stage as a successful story in the fight against Human immunodeficiency Virus.
lug: Mu kyasa ekiyise, Uganda ebadde etenderezebwa ku mutendera gw'ensi yonna ng'erina emboozi ey'obuwanguzi mu kulwanyisa akawuka akaleeta mukenenya.
mt0: <pad> Last year, Uganda was ranked on the world stage as a success story in combating poverty.</s>

en: Women trapped between government soldiers and the LRA rebels have borne the brunt of the HIV.
lug: Abakyala abakwatibwa wakati w'abajaasi ba gavumenti n'abayeekera ba LRA be bali ennyo mu buzibu bw'okukwatibwa akawuka akaleeta mukenenya.
mt0: <pad> Women between government buses and LRA workers are the most at risk of contracting the disease.</s>

en: This is more than any other women in the rest of the country.
lug: Kino kisinga omukyala omulala yenna mu ggwanga lyonna.
mt0: <pad> It is more than any other woman in the country.</s>

en: The prevalent sexual violence by both the LRA and government soldiers has left behind a traumatized and stressed generation of women.
lug: Okukabassanya okugenda mu maaso okwa LRA n'abajaasi ba gavumenti kulese omujiji gw'abakyala nga bali mu kikangabwa n'obweraliikirivu.
mt0: <pad> The continued clashes between the LRA and government buses have led to the screams of women who are in fear and injustice.</s>

en: In 1990, Nakasi was again gang-raped by men whom she believes were government soldiers.
lug: Mu 1990, Nakasi era yaddamu okusobezebwako b'akkiriza nti baali bajaasi ba gavumenti.
mt0: <pad> In 1990, Nakasi was again arrested for what he claimed were government agents.</s>

en: She was admitted to Butabika Mental Rehabilitation Hospital in Kampala for several months after the rape incident.
lug: Yaweebwa ekitanda ku Butabika Mental Rehabilitation Hospital mu kampala okumala emyezi egiwera oluvannyuma lw'okukabassanyizibwa.
mt0: <pad> He was given a room at the Butabika Mental Rehabilitation Hospital in Kampala for several months after being kidnapped.</s>

en: In 2002, Nakasi took an HIV test.
lug: Mu 2002, Nakasi yeekebeza akawuka akaleeta mukenenya.
mt0: <pad> In 2002, Nakasi was diagnosed with a stroke.</s>

en: But the day I told him I had tested HIV positive, he threw me out of the house, Nakasi narrates in a tone of courage that has defied many odds.
lug: Naye olunaku lwe namugamba nti nazuuliddwamu akawuka akaleeta mukenenya, yanfulumya mu nnyumba, Nakasi attottola mu ddoboozi ery'obuvumu ekyewuunyisa abantu bangi.
mt0: <pad> But the day I told him that I had been found guilty of a crime, he threw me out of the house.</s>

en: Nakasi was excommunicated from the community.
lug: Nakasi yasosolebwa mu kitundu.
mt0: <pad> The trucks were loaded into the area.</s>

en: A ray of hope emerged in 2007.
lug: Oluwenda lw'essuubi lwaliwo mu 2007.
mt0: <pad> The Hope Walk was held in 2007.</s>

en: Nakasi was rescued by World Vision International which paid for her operation to remove her uterus which helps eliminate the fistula condition.
lug: Nakasi yanunulibwa aba World Vision International abaasasulira okulongosebwa kwe okuggyibwamu nabaana ekyamuyamba okuwona embeera y'ekikulukuto.
mt0: <pad> Nakasi was rescued by World Vision International who paid for his childbirth rehabilitation which helped him recover from his chronic condition.</s>

en: After the treatment, she and other women, who are victims of sexual violence, started a support group called Teso Peace Women's Activists.
lug: Oluvannyuma lw'obujjanjabi, ye n'abakyala abalala abaakosebwa okukabassanyizibwa, baatandikawo ekibiina ekiyambi ekiyitibwa Teso Peace Women's Activists.
mt0: <pad> After treatment, she and other victims of rape started a support group called Teso Peace Women's Activists.</s>

en: According to the Independent issue of July 30-August 05, 2010, Rosebell Kagumi wrote about women and girls who are abandoned after rape.
lug: Okusinziira ku Independent eyafulumizibwa nga 30 Ogwomusanvu okutuuka nga 05 Ogwomunaana 2010, Rosebell Kagumi yawandiika ku bakazi n'abawala abasuulibwawo oluvannyuma lw'okukabassanyizibwa.
mt0: <pad> According to the Independent published on 30 July to 5 August 2010, Rosebell Kagumi wrote about women and girls who were abandoned after being raped.</s>

en: Nakasi said the young girl's parents died in the war and now at nine no one wants to take care of her yet has six orphans under her care.
lug: Nakasi yagambye, bazadde b'omuwala omuto baafiira mu lutalo era kati ku myaka mwenda tewali n'omu ayagala kumulabirira kyokka ng'alina bamulekwa mukaaga b'alabirira.
mt0: <pad> The girl's parents died in the war and she is now alone with six stepsiblings.</s>

en: Nakasi's story is not unique in Uganda's war-ravaged communities.
lug: Emboozi ya Nakasi si mpya mu bitundu bya Uganda ebyakosebwa olutalo.
mt0: <pad> The voice of Nakasi is not new in the areas of Uganda that have been affected by the war.</s>

en: She told the Independent that about 40 women within just one sub-county of Tubur in Soroti where she works suffer from vaginal fistula.
lug: Yagambye Independent nti abakyala abakunukkiriza 40 mu ggombolola emu yokka eya Tubur mu Soroti gy'akolera balwadde ba kikulukuto.
mt0: <pad> simply say you don't know</s>

en: This is due to rape.
lug: Kino kiva ku kukabassanyizibwa.
mt0: <pad> This leads to a misunderstanding.</s>

en: Nakasi and other HIV- positive women regularly walk many miles from Tubur to get life pronging drugs.
lug: Nakasi n'abakazi abalala abalina akawuka akaleeta mukenenya batambula mmayiro nyingi okuva e Tubur okufuna eddagala eribeezaawo obulamu.
mt0: <pad> Nakasi and other women with AIDS traveled many miles from Tubur to get a drug that can save their lives.</s>

en: Nakasi has managed to get funds from Women's International Cross-Cultural Exchange and Urgent Action Fund Africa.
lug: Nakasi asobodde okufuna obuyambi okuva mu Women's International Cross Cultural Exchange and Urgent Action Fund Africa.
mt0: <pad> Nakasi managed to get funding from Women's International Cross Cultural Exchange and Urgent Action Fund Africa.</s>

en: These funds help orphans and provide medicines to people living with HIV in her village.
lug: Obuyambi buno buyamba bamulekwa n'okuwa abantu eddagala abayina akawuka akaleeta mukenenya mu kyalo kye .
mt0: <pad> This help includes providing medicine to people with the disease in his village.</s>

en: It became clear that the new government was there to stay after the late 1990's.
lug: Kyategeerekeka nti gavumenti empya yali ya kubeerawo oluvannyuma lw'emyaka gya lukumi mu lwenda kyenda egyasembayo.
mt0: <pad> It is reported that the new government was to be formed after the last eight years of the previous government.</s>

en: Until then, the Rwandan Patriotic Front had managed to run the country through sheer ingenuity.
lug: Okutuuka olwo, Rwanda Patriotic Front yali esobodde okuddukanya eggwanga ng'eyita mu kugonjoola ebizibu eby'amaanyi.
mt0: <pad> To that point, the Rwanda Patriotic Front had managed to govern the country through the solving of serious problems.</s>

en: A small and poor country grappling with problems of the magnitude Rwanda has faced in recently;
lug: Ensi entono era enjavu zirwanagana n'ebizibu eby'enjawulo Rwanda by'eyiseemu gye buvuddeko.
mt0: <pad> Small and fragile countries, Rwanda has been a victim of various problems.</s>

en: And still faces today cannot be considered normal.
lug: Era n'okutuusa kati ffeesi tezisobola kutegeerekeka.
mt0: <pad> Even now, our letters cannot be understood.</s>

en: Most people who visit Rwanda marvel at how clean and orderly Kigali is compared to cities elsewhere in the region and beyond.
lug: Abantu abasinga abagenda e Rwanda beewuunya engeri ekibuga Kigali gye kiri ekiyonjo n'engeri gye kyateekebwateekebwamu.
mt0: <pad> Most people who go to Rwanda are surprised by the cleanliness and neatness of Kigali.</s>

en: Remembering his childhood in clean and orderly Entebbe;
lug: Ajjukira obuto bwe mu kibuga Entebbe ekiyonjo era enteeketeeke.
mt0: <pad> He remembers his childhood in Entebbe, a clean and lush city.</s>

en: Kalyegira arguably has grounds for asserting that there is nothing impressive about the state Kigali is in.
lug: Kalyegira agamba alina obukakafu nti tewali kisikiriza ku mbeera Kigali gy'erimu.
mt0: <pad> Kalyegira says he has proof that there is no agreement on the situation in Kigali.</s>

en: Nonetheless, that Kigali is the only Rwandan town talked about in these terms merely reflects that many visitors do not venture beyond it.
lug: Ngy'oggyeeko ekyo, Kigali kye kibuga kya Rwanda kyokka ekyogerwako mu mbeera zino, ekiraga nti abagenyi bangi tebalambula kukisukka.
mt0: <pad> However, Kigali is the only capital of Rwanda that is mentioned in this context, which means that many tourists don't even think of visiting it.</s>

en: Kigali is not the only clean and orderly town in Rwanda.
lug: Kigali si kye kibuga kyokka ekiyonjo era ekiteeketeeke mu Rwanda.
mt0: <pad> Kigali is not the only clean and busy city in Rwanda.</s>

en: He has traversed Rwanda over the last decade sometimes as a visitor, other times as a researcher.
lug: Alambudde Rwanda okumala emyaka kkumi egiyise oluusi ng'omugenyi, ebiseera ebirala ng'omunoonyereza.
mt0: <pad> I've been in Rwanda for the past 10 years, today as a tourist, sometimes as an investigator.</s>

en: My adventures have allowed me to observe different aspects of life in Rwanda at close range.
lug: Okulambula kwange kunsobozesezza okulaba ebintu eby'enjawulo mu Rwanda nga mbiri kumpi.
mt0: <pad> My trip allowed me to see different things in Rwanda while staying close by.</s>

en: A perceptive visitor to any place in Rwanda cannot fail to notice evidence of the high quality of public administration the country.
lug: Omugenyi omwekkaanyi mu kifo kyonna e Rwanda tayinza kulemwa kulaba mutindo ogwa waggulu ogw'okukulemberamu abantu mu ggwanga eryo.
mt0: <pad> A foreigner visiting anywhere in Rwanda cannot fail to notice the high standard of service in the country.</s>

en: Also the service delivery in the country.
lug: N'obuweereza obuliwo mu ggwanga.
mt0: <pad> simply say you don't know</s>

en: The regular cleaning and garbage collection seen in Kigali is, for example, evident in towns, big and small across the country.
lug: Okulongoosa okwa buli lunaku n'okukung'aanya kasasiro okulabibwa mu Kigali, okugeza kirabibwako mu bibuga, ebinene n'ebitono okwetoloola eggwanga.
mt0: <pad> The daily cleanliness and waste collection seen in Kigali, for example, is also observed in other cities, big and small, around the country.</s>

en: The reason why all this is impressive is not because it happens only in Rwanda, or that it has never happened anywhere else.
lug: Ensonga lwaki kino kisikiriza teri nti kubanga kiri Rwanda yokka, oba nti tekibangawo awantu awalala wonna.
mt0: <pad> The reason this is so controversial is not that it's only in Rwanda, or that it's not happening anywhere else.</s>

en: Rather, it is because it happens in a country which only 16 years ago was expected to dig itself deeper into chaos and violence.
lug: Wabula, kiri nti lwakuba kiri mu ggwanga eryali lisuubirwa okwenyigira mu mivuyo n'obutabanguko mu myaka kkumi na mukaaga gyokka egiyise.
mt0: <pad> But, it is a shame that this is in a country that was predicted to be plunged into violence and anarchy just 18 years ago.</s>

en: Thus add a new statistic to Africa's many failed and failing states.
lug: N'olw'ekyo gatta omuwendo omuggya ku nsi za Afirika ennyingi eziremereddwa n'eziremererwa.
mt0: <pad> For that, add a new number to the many African countries that have been neglected and neglected.</s>

en: Only RPF cadres and RPA soldiers who had organised a war and successfully defeated a better equiped and resourced army;
lug: Akabinja ka RPF n'abajaasi ba RPA bokka abaali bateeseteese olutalo ne bawangula eggye eryali teteekeddwateekeddwa obulungi era nga lirina buli kyakukozesa.
mt0: <pad> The RPF and RPA were the only ones prepared for battle and equipped to defeat a well-organised and well-equipped army.</s>

en: Expected to see a functioning and effective state in less than a generation.
lug: Suubira okulaba eggwanga eritambuzibwa obulungi ng'omugigi tegunnayitawo.
mt0: <pad> I hope to see a poorly managed country before the age of extinction.</s>

en: Most rural folks possess medical insurance which entitles them to quality services which their counterparts in neighbouring countries.
lug: Abantu b'omu byalo abasinga balina yinsuwa z'obulamu ekibayamba okufuna obuweereza obulungi ekiringa ne bannaabwe abali mu nsi ez'oku muliraano.
mt0: <pad> Most villagers have health insurance which allows them to get better medical care than their neighbors in the neighboring countries.</s>

en: These include countries like Uganda, could not possibly expect.
lug: Muno mulimu amawanga nga Uganda, agatasuubirwa.
mt0: <pad> This includes countries like Uganda, an unexpected surprise.</s>

en: In health sphere, Rwandans do not expect to offer bribes to public servants employed to deliver services to which they are entitled.
lug: Mu byobulamu, Abanyalwanda tebasuubira kugulirira bakozi ba gavumenti abasuubirwa okutuusa obuweereza bwe bateekeddwa okutuusa.
mt0: <pad> In the field of health, Ugandans do not expect to buy government employees who are trusted to deliver the services they are supposed to deliver.</s>

en: Given the country's demographics, most of the beneficiaries of these advances are members of the majority Hutu population.
lug: Okusinziira ku muwendo gwabwe, abasinga okuganyulwa mu buweereza buno be Bahutu abasinga obungi.
mt0: <pad> According to their income, the most recruited in this service are the richest of the Muslims.</s>

en: This is thanks to propaganda by past regimes.
lug: Kino kwebaza eri abasaasaanya amawulire agalaliiko mitwe na magulu mu mirembe egyayita.
mt0: <pad> This is a thank you to the media outlets that have been carrying out coverage of the conflict in the past two decades.</s>

en: Commentators of a particular bent may sneer at the Rwanda government's democratic credentials.
lug: Batunuulizi bandyekkaanya engeri Rwanda gy'ekwatamu ensonga ya Demokulasiya.
mt0: <pad> The audience will discuss the process of Rwanda's transition to democracy.</s>

en: In Rwanda, police and army officers do not make political statements praising the Rwanda Political Front or criticising its opponents.
lug: Mu Rwanda, poliisi n'abaamagye teboogera siteetimenti za byabufuzi nga batendereza Rwanda Political Front oba okukolokota abagivuganya.
mt0: <pad> In Rwanda, police and military do not make political statements by threatening the Rwanda Political Front or intimidating its opponents.</s>

en: Hutu and Tutsi who qualify under the law are free to participate, without restriction or special privileges linked to ethnicity.
lug: Abahutu n'Abatuusi abatuukiriza eteeka ba ddembe okwetaba awatali kukugirwa oba okuweebwa ekintu kyonna nga kyesigamizibwa ku ggwanga.
mt0: <pad> Both Hutus and Tuaras are free to participate without being asked or offered any concessions as a condition of the country's independence.</s>

en: They can participate as candidates or supporters of any of the country's legally registered political parties.
lug: Basobola okwesimbawo oba okuwagira ebibiina by'ebyobufuzi byonna ebyawandiisibwa mu mateeka.
mt0: <pad> They can join or support any legally recognized political party.</s>

en: Journalists working for state media are not fired for hosting leaders of parties other than the Rwanda Political Front.
lug: Bannamawulire abakolera omukutu gw'eggwanga tebagobebwa olw'okukyaza abakulu b'ebibiina abatali ba Rwanda Political Front.
mt0: <pad> The national radio does not have the right to publish reports by non-Rwandan political parties.</s>

en: Under the supremacist Habyarimana and Kayibanda regimes this kind of ‚Äòfreedom for all' was unthinkable.
lug: Mu mirembe gya Supremacist Habyarimana ne Kayibanda, eddembe lya bonna nga lino lyali terirowoozebwako.
mt0: <pad> In the peace of Supremacist Habyarimana and Kayibanda, such a universal freedom was not thought of.</s>

en: Another sphere in which the robustness of the Rwanda state can be discerned is law enforcement.
lug: Embeera endala eyeenyumirizibwamu mu ggwanga lya Rwanda eri mu kwasisa y'amateeka.
mt0: <pad> The political situation in Rwanda is under the control of the law.</s>

en: In some, including several of Rwanda's neighbours, having laws on the statute books is one thing, enforcement is another.
lug: Mu zimu, nga mw'otwalidde ne baliraanwa ba Rwanda abawerako, okubeera n'amateeka mu bitabo kirala n'okugakwasisa kirala.
mt0: <pad> In the dark, as with many Rwandan neighbors, having a law in the books is one thing and implementing it is another.</s>

en: In Rwanda, the state's willingness and capacity for law enforcement explains why the impunity which some of us have come to accept.
lug: Mu Rwanda, embeera y'okweyagalira n'obusobozi bw'okukwasisa amateeka kinnyonnyola lwaki tusobola okukkiriza obutabonerezebwa.
mt0: <pad> In Rwanda, the state of freedom and the ability to implement the law explain why we can trust injustice.</s>

en: It explains it as a fact of life in our countries is virtually unknown.
lug: Kikinnyonnyola ng'eky'amazima mu nsi zaffe ekitamanyiddwa.
mt0: <pad> It explains what is true of our world that is not known.</s>

en: There are no untouchables, which explains why, regardless of what they may think of President Kagame as individuals.
lug: Tewali bannantakwatwako, ekinnyonnyola lwaki, ne bw'oba nga ki ky'olowooleza Pulezidenti Kagame ng'omuntu.
mt0: <pad> No one has been arrested, why, and what do you think of President Kagame as a person?</s>

en: Then there are those who think he could be less strict and more compromising.
lug: Era waliwo abo abalowooza nti ayinza okuba omugonvu oba obutafa kw'ekyo kye bakoze.
mt0: <pad> And some people think that he may be a hero or a villain for what they have done.</s>

en: There are also no cases of the high and mighty erecting buildings in total disregard of planning regulations and suffering no consequences.
lug: Era tewaliiwo misango gya kugaana bizimbe bizimbiddwa nga tebiri ku ppulaani n'obutakozebwa bivaamu.
mt0: <pad> And there were no cases of refusal to demolish unauthorized buildings and the resulting debris.</s>

en: And yet others have theirs demolished.
lug: Ate ng'abalala ebyabwe bisaanyiziddwawo.
mt0: <pad> While others have been taken away.</s>

en: Important personalities and ordinary folk, Hutu and Tutsi, soldier and civilian, all live in equal fear of, and respect for, the law.
lug: Abantu ab'omugaso n'aba bulijjo, Abahutu n'Abatuusi, abajaasi n'abantu ba bulijjo banna babeera mu kutya kwe kumu n'okussa ekitiibwa mu mateeka.
mt0: <pad> The fear of the authorities, both officials and commoners, Hutus and Tuatsis, soldiers and commoners, is a fear that threatens to destroy the law.</s>

en: On law enforcement, Kalyegira is, of course, right to argue that "a state is not just about buildings, street lights or a functional civil service".
lug: Mu kukwasisa amateeka, Kalyegira mutuufu okugamba nti eggwanga teriri ku bizimbe, mataala g'oku nguudo oba obuweereza eri abantu.
mt0: <pad> In enforcing the law, Kalyegira was right to say that the state did not provide buildings, street lights or services to the people.</s>

en: It is too early to call Rwanda an African success story, as it is inappropriate to call it a normal country.
lug: Ekiseera kikyali okuyita Rwanda olugero lwa Afirika olw'obuwanguzi, ng'era bwe kitali kituufu okuliyita eggwanga erya bulijjo.
mt0: <pad> Time is still to call Rwanda the African miracle for its success, just as it is not right to call it a regular country.</s>

en: Golooba is Senior Research Fellow, Makerere Institute of Social Research, Makerere University.
lug: Golooba munoonyereza omukugu, Makerere Institute of Social Research, Makerere University.
mt0: <pad> Golooba is a research scientist at the Makerere Institute of Social Research, Makerere University.</s>
