en: She told the Independent that about 40 women within just one sub-county of Tubur in Soroti where she works suffer from vaginal fistula due to rape.
lug: Yagambye independent nti abakazi abakunukkiriza mu 40 mu ggombolola emu ey'e Tubur mu Soroti gy'akolera balina ekirwadde ky'ekikulukuto olw'okusobezebwako.
mt0: <pad> He told the Independent that about 40 women in one of the villages in Tubur district in Soroti have a mental health condition because of being abused.</s>

en: Nakasi and other HIV- positive women regularly walk many miles from Tubur to get life pronging drugs.
lug: Nakasi n'abakazi abalala abalina akawuka akaleeta mukenenya batambula mmayiro nnyingi okuva e e Tubur okufuna eddagala eribeezaawo obulamu.
mt0: <pad> Nakasi and other women with AIDS traveled many miles from Tubur to get a drug that can save their lives.</s>

en: Nakasi has managed to get funds from Women's International Cross-Cultural Exchange and Urgent Action Fund Africa.
lug: Nakasi asobodde okufuna obuyambi okuva mu Women's international cross-cultural Exchange ne Urgent action fund Africa.
mt0: <pad> Nakasi has managed to get funding from Women's international cross-cultural Exchange and Urgent action fund Africa.</s>

en: Nakasi will use the funds to help orphans and provide medicines to people living with HIV in her village.
lug: Nakasi ajja kukozesa ensimbi okuyamba bamulekwa n'okufunira abantu abalina akawuka akaleeta mukenenya eddagala mu kyalo kye
mt0: <pad> Nakasi will use the money to help the homeless and provide medicine for people with HIV/AIDS in his village.</s>

en: I tend to think that Semogerere is only unfortunate to lead such men.
lug: Ntera okulowooza nti Semwogerere si wa mukisa kukulembera basajja ng'abo.
mt0: <pad> I think that it is not a good thing for Semwogerere to be leading such men.</s>

en: The heinous incident marked the dawn of repeated sexual violence against Nakasi and many other women in conflict areas.
lug: Embeera embi ennyo yaaviraako okusobyanga ku Nakasi entakera n'abakyala abalala bangi mu bitundu ebirimu entalo.
mt0: <pad> The harsh conditions led to the rape of Nakisha and many other women in the war-torn areas.</s>

en: Reports indicated that the majority of voters had cast their ballots within three hours of polls opening.
lug: Alipoota zalaga nti abalonzi abasinga baali bamaze okulonda mu ssaawa ssatu ng'okulonda kutandise.
mt0: <pad> Report shows that most voters had voted by 3 pm when the polls started.</s>

en: For Kagame's supporters, the cheerful mood from the campaign will reenergize the Rwanda Patriotic Font base.
lug: Eri abawagizi ba Kagame, embeera y'ebugumu okuva mu kampayini ejja kuzzaamu enkambi ya Rwanda Patriotic Font amanyi.
mt0: <pad> For Kagame supporters, the crisis from the campaign to relaunch the Rwanda Patriotic Font camp is well known.</s>

en: Display of the National Voter's Register is from eleventh to thirty first August two thousand ten.
lug: Okulaga enkalala z'abalonzi kutandika nga kkumi na lumu okutuuka ng'asatu mu lumu Ogwomunaana nkumi bbiri mu kkumi.
mt0: <pad> The counting of the ballots begins at 11 to 3 pm on Monday and ends at 2 pm on Tuesday.</s>

en: The Electoral Commission has appointed eleventh August to thirty first August two thousand ten for Display of the National Voters' Register.
lug: Akakiko k'ebyokulonda kalonze olwa nga kkumi na lumu okutuuka ng'asatu mu lumu Ogwomunaana nkumi bbiri mu kkumi okukebererako enkalala z'abalonzi.
mt0: <pad> The Election Commission has scheduled the 11th to 13th of March for the count of voters' ballots.</s>

en: There twenty three thousand nine hundred fifteen polling stations throughout Uganda.
lug: Ebifo ebironderwamu mu Uganda biri enkumi ssatu mu lwenda mu kkumi na bitaano.
mt0: <pad> The number of polling stations in Uganda is 300 and the number of polling stations in Rwanda is 150.</s>

en: The display shall begin at eight in the morning and end at six in the evening at each polling station.
lug: Okukeberwa kujja kutandika ku ssaawa bbiri ez'okumakya kuggwe ku ssaawa kkumi na bbiri olweggulo mu buli kifo we balondera.
mt0: <pad> The checks will start at 2 o'clock in the morning and end at 11 o'clock in the afternoon at every checkpoint.</s>

en: The lists of all persons recommended for deletion from the National Voters' Register, shall be displayed for a period of ten days.
lug: Enkalala z'abantu bonna abalina okuggyibwa mu nkalala z'abalonzi, zijja kutimbibwa okumala ebbanga lya nnaku kkumi.
mt0: <pad> The lists of all those who are to be removed from the voting register will be posted for ten days.</s>

en: Engineer Dr Badru Kiggundu was the Chairperson Electoral Commission for the national elections two thousand eleven.
lug: Yinginiya Dr. Badru Kiggundu ye yaali ssentebe w'akakiiko k'eby'obyokulonda mu kulonda kwa nkumi bbiri kkumi na gumu.
mt0: <pad> Engineer Dr. Badru Kiggundu was the chairman of the election commission in the 2010 general election.</s>

en: On May twenty sixth, President Museveni gave a rare speech about Uganda's opposition.
lug: Mu Gwokutaano nga abiri mu mukaaga, Pulezidenti Museveni yayogera okwogera okutali kwa bulijjo ku ludda oluvuganya mu Uganda.
mt0: <pad> In August, President Museveni made an unusual comment on the political situation in Uganda.</s>

en: The president spoke at the opening ceremony of the Africa Regional Conference on the Electoral Cycle.
lug: Pulezidenti yayogera ku mukolo ogwaggulawo Africa Regional Conference ku byokulonda.
mt0: <pad> President said at the opening of the Africa Regional Conference on Elections.</s>

en: The interparty organisations dialogue hosted Democratic reforms at Munyonyo Resort.
lug: Omukago ogutaba ebibiina by'ebyobufuzi gw'ateeka olukiko ku nkola z'amateeka ezinaagobererwanga ku Munyonyo Resort.
mt0: <pad> The Ugandan government has launched a legal inquiry into the legality of the Munyonyo Resort.</s>

en: InterParty Organisation for Dialogue brings together political parties with representation in parliament.
lug: Omukago ogutaba ebibiina by'ebyobufuzi gugatta wamu ebibiina by'ebyobufuzi ebirina ababaka mu paalamenti.
mt0: <pad> The Political Party Conference brings together the political parties that have members in the parliament.</s>

en: The InterParty Organisation for Dialogue comprises of the ruling party and the opposition parties.
lug: Omukago ogutaba ebibiina by'ebyobufuzi ebirina ababaka mu paalamenti gukolebwa ekibiina ekiri mu buyinza n'ebibiina ebiri ku ludda oluvuganya.
mt0: <pad> The parliamentary assembly is made up of the ruling party and the two opposition parties.</s>

en: The president said It is the ultimate responsibility of all Africans to promote dialogue and fight dictatorship.
lug: Pulezidenti yagambye nti buvunaanyizibwa bwa buli Mufirika okutondawo enteeseganya n'okulwanyisa obwannakyemalira.
mt0: <pad> President said it was the responsibility of every African to build unity and fight poverty.</s>

en: He argued that the dialogue must be based on issues that are important to the African people.
lug: Yagambye nti okwogerezeganya kulina kukolebwa ku nsonga ez'omugaso eri Abafirika.
mt0: <pad> He said that the talks should be focused on issues of interest to Africans.</s>

en: The opposition parties suggested reforms in the method of constituting the Electoral Commission to ensure a level ground.
lug: Ebibiina ebiri ku ludda oluvuganya byasabye enkyukakyuka mu nnonda y'akakiiko k'ebyokulonda okusobola okuteekawo obwenkanya.
mt0: <pad> The two opposition parties have demanded a change in the constitution of the Electoral Commission to ensure fairness.</s>

en: In his book, Sowing the Mustard Seed, Museveni writes that Paulo Muwanga's government refused to amend the electoral law.
lug: Mu kitabo kye Sowing the Mustard Seed, Museveni awandiika nti gavumenti ya Paulo Muwanga yagaana okukyusa etteeka ly'okulonda.
mt0: <pad> In his book Sowing the Mustard Seed, Museveni wrote that the government of Paul Muwanga refused to change the election law.</s>

en: All the Uganda People's Congress members wanted the fa√ßade of an election in order to legitimise the coup.
lug: Bammemba ba Uganda People's Congress baali baagala akalulu akalungi okusobola okuggyako gavumenti.
mt0: <pad> Members of the Uganda People's Congress were looking for a fair election to remove the government.</s>

en: The electoral law reforms the president is writing about are the same reforms the opposition parties are demanding today.
lug: Ennongoosereza z'okulonda Pulezidenti z'awandiikako ze zimu n'ebibiina by'oluda oluvuganya bye zibanja leero.
mt0: <pad> The amendments he proposed to the constitution are one of the demands made by the main opposition parties today.</s>

en: Museveni too rejected the opposition's call for electoral law reforms just like Muwanga in one thousand nine hundred eighty.
lug: Museveni naye yagaana enkyukakyuka mu tteeka ly'okulonda nga Muwanga mu lukumi mu lwenda mu kinaana.
mt0: <pad> Museveni also refused to change the election law in May 2014.</s>

en: The Election Commission is very competent with people of high integrity.
lug: Akakiiko k'ebyokulonda kamanyi bulungi eky'okukola nga kaliko abantu abeesimbu nnyo.
mt0: <pad> The electoral commission knows what it is doing and has a very experienced group of people.</s>

en: The struggle for electoral law reforms in Uganda has been on since one thousand nine hundred eighty.
lug: Okulwanirira enkyukakyuka mu tteeka ly'okulonda mu Uganda kubaddewo okuva mu lukumi mu lwenda mu kinaana.
mt0: <pad> The campaign for change in the electoral law in Uganda has been on since the year 2000.</s>

en: The results of one thousand nine hundred eighty general elections were contested and a rebellion ensued.
lug: Ebyava mu kulonda kwa lukumi mu lwenda mu kinaana byawakanyizibwa era ne bivaavu okwekalakaasa.
mt0: <pad> The results of the elections in 2008 were challenged and led to protests.</s>

en: About five hundred thousand Ugandans died during the five-year insurgency that brought Museveni to power.
lug: Bannayuganda abali mu mitwalo ataano baafiira mu lutalo olw'emyaka etaano olwaleeta Museveni mu buyinza.
mt0: <pad> Ugandans have been killed in the five-year civil war that brought President Yoweri Museveni to power.</s>

en: Museveni gave one of the reasons for the National Resistance Army rebellion.
lug: Museveni yawa emu ku nsonga ezaviirako aba National Resistance Army okwegugunga.
mt0: <pad> Museveni gave one of the reasons for the National Resistance Army's resignation.</s>

en: The Supreme Court ruled that the Electoral Commission failed to conduct free and fair elections in two thousand one and six.
lug: Kkooti ensukkulumu yasala nti akakiiko k'ebyokulonda kaalemwa okuteekateeka okulonda okw'amazima n'obwenkanya mu nkumi bbiri mu gumu ne mukaaga.
mt0: <pad> The Supreme Court ruled that the Electoral Commission failed to organize fair and transparent elections in 2008.</s>

en: This is the same commission the president insists is too competent to be changed.
lug: Kano akakiiko ke kamu Pulezidenti kaalemereko nti kamanyi eky'okukola era tekayinza kukyusibwa.
mt0: <pad> The President's Committee is a body that has been established by the President and cannot be changed.</s>

en: Uganda has held four elections since one thousand nine hundred eighty.
lug: Uganda ebadde n'okulonda kwa mirundi ena okuva mu lukumi mu lwenda mu kinaana.
mt0: <pad> Uganda has had four general elections since the year 2000.</s>

en: The participating political parties in the electoral process are suspicious of the independence of the Electoral Commission.
lug: Ebibiina by'ebyobufuzi ebyetabye mu kulonda bibuusabuusa obwetengereze bw'akakiiko k'ebyokulonda.
mt0: <pad> The political parties participating in the election have questioned the impartiality of the Electoral Commission.</s>

en: The Electoral Commission organises credible elections without due influence from the ruling party.
lug: Akakiiko k'ebyokulonda kategeka okulonda okulungi okutaliimu kusendebwasendebwa kibiina ekiri mu buyinza.
mt0: <pad> The electoral commission is responsible for organizing the best possible election to replace the current parliament.</s>

en: Many analysts say that the selection of Electoral Commission members must be by a neutral committee comprising Ugandans of national integrity.
lug: Abatunuulizi b'ensonga bangi bagamba nti okulonda bammemba b'akakiiko k'ebyokulonda kulina kukolebwa akakiiko akatalina ludda nga kaliko Bannayuganda abeesimbu.
mt0: <pad> Many observers say that the election commission should be elected by an independent body with members of the country's citizens.</s>

en: The Electoral Commission members especially the chairperson and secretary should never again be persons handpicked by the ruling party alone.
lug: Bammemba b'akakiiko k'ebyokulonda naddala ssentebe n'omuwandiisi tebalina kuddamu kulondebwa kibiina kiri mu buyinza kyokka.
mt0: <pad> Members of the electoral commission, especially the president and secretary, should not be re-elected by the current assembly.</s>

en: It should be the national consensus committee of great persons that should supervise and judge the work of the Electoral Commission.
lug: Kalina kuba akakiiko k'eggwanga akatabaganya ak'abantu abasukkulumu abalina okulondoola n'okulamula emirimu gy'akakiiko k'ebyokulonda.
mt0: <pad> There must be a national committee of the people who have the power to monitor and report the activities of the Electoral Commission.</s>

en: The national consensus committee resorts to courts of laws in its supervision of the Electoral Commission.
lug: Akakiiko k'eggwanga akatabaganya kaloopa mu mbuga z'amateeka nga kalondoola emirimu gy'akakiiko k'ebyokulonda.
mt0: <pad> The National Communications Committee filed a legal action against the electoral commission.</s>

en: Uganda's political opposition groups agree with this proposal.
lug: Ebibiina by'oludda oluvuganya mu Uganda bikkaanya n'ebbago lyabwe.
mt0: <pad> The opposition groups in Uganda are arguing over their agenda.</s>

en: This arrangement has worked in Malawi
lug: Entekateka eno ekoze mu Malawi.
mt0: <pad> The explosion occurred in Malawi.</s>

en: The Malawian Electoral Commission is headed by a judge nominated by the judicial service commission.
lug: Akakiiko k'ebyokulonda aka Malawi kakulirwa omulamuzi alondebwa akakiiko k'abalamuzi.
mt0: <pad> Malawi's Electoral Commission has refused to name a new judge for the judiciary board.</s>

en: The Malawian president, in consultation with leaders of the political parties represented in parliament, appoints qualified members of the commission.
lug: Pulezidenti wa Malawi mu kwebuuza ku bakulembeze b'ebibiina byobufuzi ebirina ababaka mu paalamenti, alonda bammemba b'akakiiko abalina ebisaanyizo.
mt0: <pad> The President of Malawi, after consulting with the leaders of the political parties that have members in the parliament, elects the commissioners who meet the requirements.</s>

en: The commissioners have a four-year renewable tenure of Electoral commissions.
lug: Ab'akakiiko balina ekisanja ky'akakiiko ky'ebyokulonda eky'emyaka ena ekizzibwa obuggya.
mt0: <pad> The assembly has a four-year term of the election commission which is filled in by mistake.</s>

en: Africa's new kingmaker Yoweri Museveni addresses a rally in one thousand nine hundred eighty.
lug: Omukulembeze wa Afirika ayambako abalala okujja mu buyinza Yoweri Museveni ayogerako eri abantu mu lukumi mu mwenda mu kinaana.
mt0: <pad> The African leader who helped others to succeed in power Yoweri Museveni spoke to a crowd of 100,000 people on Saturday.</s>

en: Ghana on the other hand has the most detailed process of selecting its Electoral Commission team.
lug: Ku ludda olulala Ghana y'esinga emitendera emiwanvu mu kulonda akakiiko kaayo ak'ebyokulonda.
mt0: <pad> Ghana is the most transparent country in the world to hold its first general elections.</s>

en: The current Ghanaian Electoral Commission members were appointed in the year one thousand nine hundred ninety-three.
lug: Bammemba b'akakiiko k'ebyokulonda aka Ghana akaliko baalondebwa mu mwaka gwa lukumi mu lwenda mu kyenda mu ssatu.
mt0: <pad> The Ghanaian National Assembly was elected in 1993.</s>

en: AMISOM as the AU and UN mandated peace keeping force has a limited capacity to protect the Presidential Palace, Mogadishu airport.
lug: AMISOM ng'ekiragiro kya AU ne UN eky'okukuuma emirembe tebirina busobozi kukuuma lubiri lw'obwapulezidenti, Mogadishu airport.
mt0: <pad> AMISOM as the AU and UN peacekeeping force is not able to protect the presidential palace, Mogadishu airport.</s>

en: The Uganda People's Defence Force presence within the AMISOM framework does not answer the needs of the Ugandans.
lug: Okubeera kwa Uganda Peolpe's Defence Force mu AMISOM tekyanukula byetaago bya bannayuganda.
mt0: <pad> The presence of the Uganda People's Defence Force in AMISOM does not meet the needs of the Ugandan people.</s>

en: When the population talks of wiping out Al-Shabaab from Somalia, they mean militarily defeating them thus removing ability of launching attacks.
lug: Abantu bwe boogera ku kusaanyaawo Al-Shabaab mu Somalia, bategeeza okubawangula mu by'ekijaasi awo ne baba nga tebakyalina busobozi kukola bulumbaganyi.
mt0: <pad> When people talk about eliminating Al-Shabaab in Somalia, they mean their defeat in the battlefield so that they are no longer able to launch bombings.</s>

en: Since the Uganda People`s Defence Force cannot achieve that goal, the only feasible option is to withdraw from Somalia.
lug: Olw'okuba nti Uganda People's Defence Force tesobola kutuukkirza kirubirirwa ekyo, ky'esobola kyokka okukola kwe kuva mu Somalia.
mt0: <pad> Since the Uganda People's Defence Force cannot stop this attack, the only way it can do is to withdraw from Somalia.</s>

en: We can then, as a member state of the UN, ask the UN Security Council for a mandate forcefully invade Somalia to pursue Al-Shabaab.
lug: Ffe nga bammemba ba UN tusaba akakiiko k'ebyokwerinda okuyisa ekiragiro okuyingira mu Somalia ku kifuba twengange Al-Shabaab.
mt0: <pad> We as UN members urge the Security Council to adopt a resolution to enter Somalia to fight Al-Shabaab.</s>

en: This strategy would allow Uganda to launch attacks against the Al-Shabaab.
lug: Enkora eno yandisobozesezza Uganda okukola ennumba ku Al-Shabaab.
mt0: <pad> This would allow Uganda to launch a bombing campaign against Al-Shabaab.</s>

en: Bwesigye works with Advocates for Public International Law Uganda.
lug: Bwesigye akola ne Advocates for Public International Law Uganda.
mt0: <pad> Bwesigye works with Advocates for Public International Law Uganda.</s>

en: During its National Executive Conference in January, the NRMovement declared it had registered 8 million members including the under age.
lug: Mu lukungaana lwayo olw'akakiiko akafuzi mu Gatonya, NRMovement yalangirira nti yali ewandiisizza bammemba obukadde munaana omuli n'abali wansi w'emyaka.
mt0: <pad> In its executive board meeting on Tuesday, NRMovement announced that it had registered over eight million members, including under-age members.</s>

en: This was before the EC started the national voter registration exercise which also yielded about 15 million voters, up from 10 million in 2006.
lug: Kino kyaliwo nga EC tennatandika nteekateeka ya kukebera nkalala z'abalonzi era ekyavaamu abalonzi obukadde 15 okuva ku bukadde 10 mu 2006.
mt0: <pad> This was before EC began a process of reviewing the voting registers and resulted in 15 million voters from 10 million in 2006.</s>

en: The NRM has been registering people it calls its members across the country.
lug: NRM ebadde ewandisa abantu b'eyita bammemba abaayo okwetoloola eggwanga lyonna.
mt0: <pad> The NRM was recruiting people it called members of the female battalion across the country.</s>

en: The Electoral Commission also doubts the authenticity of the NRM figures.
lug: Akakiiko akalonzi nako kabuusabuusa obutuufu bw'emiwendo gya NRM.
mt0: <pad> The committee also questioned the NRM's budget.</s>

en: Early this year, the NRM also doubted the genuineness of the EC's national voter register, alleging that it contained two million ghost names.
lug: Nga omwaka guno gutandika, NRM nayo yabuusabuusa obutuufu bw'enkalala z'abalonzi ez'akakiiko k'ebyokulonda, ng'egamba nti zirimu amanya obukadde bubiri ag'empewo.
mt0: <pad> In the early years of this year, the NRM also questioned the authenticity of the National Electoral Commission's voting registers, claiming that they contained two million false names.</s>

en: Uganda's demographic statistics put the 2009 population projections to 30.6 million.
lug: Ebibalo by'abantu mu Uganda mu 2009 baatuuka ku bukadde 30.6.
mt0: <pad> The population of Uganda in 2009 was 30.6 million.</s>

en: This implies that 14.2 million Ugandans are above 18 and thus qualified to register as voters.
lug: Kino kitegeeza nti obukadde 14.2 obwa Bannayuganda bali waggulu w'emyka 18 n'olw'ekyo bakkirizibwa okwewandiisa ng'abalonzi.
mt0: <pad> This means that 14.2 million Ugandans are over 18 years old and therefore eligible to register as voters.</s>

en: Population estimates published by the Population Secretariat rise even more questions on the Electro Commission's 15 million voters.
lug: Enteebereza y'omuwendo gw'abantu eyafulumizibwaeggwandiisizo ly'emiwendo gweyongera n'ebibuuzo ebisingawo ku balonzi b'akakiiko k'ebyokulonda obukadde 15.
mt0: <pad> The estimated population of the assembly election commission is expected to be increased by more questions about the assembly's electoral districts.</s>

en: The estimates for 2010 show Ugandans of 18 years and above are 13.9 million, up from 12.9 million in 2008.
lug: Ebyateberezebwa bya 2010 biraga bannayuganda eb'emyaka 18 n'okugenda waggulu bali obukadde 13.9 okuva ku bukadde 12.9 mu 2008.
mt0: <pad> The 2010 estimates showed that the number of Ugandans aged 18 and over was 13.9 million, up from 12.9 million in 2008.</s>

en: Given the high apathy among Ugandans to register for voting and death of some registered voters, the number of new voters would be fewer.
lug: Olw'okuba nti Bannayuganda tebaagala kwewandiisa kulonda n'okufa kw'abalonzi abawandiise, omuwendo gw'abalonzi abapya gwandibadde wansi.
mt0: <pad> Because the Ugandans don't want to register for voting and the death of registered voters, the number of new voters will be low.</s>

en: However, the EC has said this is not the final figure.
lug: Newankubaddde EC egambye nti guno si gwe muwendo ogw'enkomeredde.
mt0: <pad> However, EC said that this is not the final number.</s>

en: Even if some superman had inherited the presidency, it was practically impossible for anyone to govern Uganda.
lug: N'omufuusa ne bwe yandisikidde pulezidenti, kyandibadde kizibu omuntu yenna okulembera Uganda.
mt0: <pad> Without the military, it would be difficult for anybody to rule Uganda.</s>

en: Various conflicting parties had begun fighting for power back in Moshi sorted out each other.
lug: Ebibiina eby'enjawulo ebyali byatandika okulwanira obuyinza mu Moshi byatabagana.
mt0: <pad> The different groups that began to fight for power in Moshi clashed.</s>

en: After the fall of Idi Amin, all successor regimes were nothing but caretakers, stop-gap measures, until the final showdown.
lug: Oluvannyuma lwa Idi Amin okuva mu buyinza, emirembe gyonna egyaddako gyali gya kaseera buseera okutuuka lwe gyaviirawo ddala.
mt0: <pad> After Idi Amin's departure, the peace that followed was only temporary until it finally ended.</s>

en: This only happened in one thousand nine hundred eighty-six with President Yoweri Museveni's National Resistance Movement emerging as a victor.
lug: Kino kyatuukawo mu lukumi mu lwenda kinaana mukaaga oluvannyuma lwa National Resistance Movement eya Pulezidenti Yoweri Museveni okuwangula.
mt0: <pad> It happened in Uganda in 1978 after the National Resistance Movement of President Yoweri Museveni won the election.</s>

en: It is therefore surprising that Binaisa, in spite of all this, was able to hold on to power for nearly a year.
lug: Nolwekyo kyewuunyisa nti nga oggyeko bino byonna, Binaisa yasobola okumala mu buyinza kumpi mwaka mulamba.
mt0: <pad> That's why it is surprising that despite all this, Berlusconi managed to stay in power for nearly a year.</s>

en: Ugandans might as well be grateful that here was a man who never craved to be president.
lug: Bannayuganda bayinza okuba abasanyufu nti wano waaliwo omusajja ataayayaanira kuba Pulezidenti.
mt0: <pad> Ugandans may be happy that there was a man who did not run for president.</s>

en: He held Uganda together, made her laugh and was gradually steering her to normality before the forces of instability struck.
lug: Yakuuma Uganda nga eri bumu, yasekererwa naye mu mpola mpola baatandika okumwagala obutabanguko bwe bwali nga tebunnatuukawo.
mt0: <pad> He kept Uganda together, he was criticised but over time they began to love him for the peace that had not happened.</s>

en: He asserted civilian supremacy by demoting the Army Chief of Staff, General Oyite Ojok.
lug: Yakakasa obuyinza bw'omuntu wa bulijjo nga assa eddaala ly'akulira amagye, Genero Oyite Ojok.
mt0: <pad> He proved his power by wearing the uniform of the general, General Oyite Ojok.</s>

en: An umbrella government was embraced by National Resistance Movement once it came to power.
lug: Gavumenti ey'awamu yateekebwawo National Resistance Movement bwe yajja mu buyinza.
mt0: <pad> The National Resistance Movement set up a coalition government when it came to power.</s>

en: Binaisa was also not a corrupt president as his personal life reveals.
lug: Binaisa naye yali Pulezidenti atalya nguzi ng'obulamu bwe obwa bulijjo bwe bulaga.
mt0: <pad> But he was also a vegetarian president, as his daily life showed.</s>

en: Immediately after the loss of his presidency, he fled back to New York where he resumed his law practice.
lug: Amangu ddala ng'avudde ku bwa pulezidenti, yaddayo e New York okuddamu okukola obwannamateeka bwe.
mt0: <pad> Soon after leaving the presidency, he returned to New York to pursue his legal practice.</s>

en: In the year one thousand nine hundred eighty-six, soon after the National Resistance Movement government had come to power he returned.
lug: Mu mwaka gwa lukumi mu lwenda kinaana mukaaga, amangu ddala nga National Resistance Movement ezze mu buyinza, yakomawo.
mt0: <pad> In 1968, very soon after the National Resistance Movement came to power, it was abolished.</s>

en: He put up an unfinished shell at the top of Mutundwe hill.
lug: Yazimbawo ennyumba etaggwa waggulu ku kasozi k'e Mutundwe.
mt0: <pad> He built a house on the top of the prison of Mt.</s>

en: He opened a law firm, walked freely on the streets of Kampala as he had nothing to hide.
lug: Yaggulawo kkampuni y'amateeka, yatambulanga kyere ku nguudo z'e Kampala nga talina kintu kyonna kya kukweka.
mt0: <pad> He opened a legal firm, he walked naked down the streets of Kampala without anything to cover himself.</s>

en: After the violent death of former freedom fighter leader, Andrew Kayira fled back to exile in New York.
lug: Oluvannyuma lw'okufa okw'effujjo okwa eyali omukulembeze omulwanirizi ow'eddembe, Andrew Kayira yaddayo mu buwanganguse mu New York.
mt0: <pad> After the assassination of a prominent peace activist, Andrew Kayira returned to New York to pursue his own career.</s>

en: Museveni compatriot Andrew Kayira fled back to exile in New York where he took up a lowly job as a state attorney.
lug: Munywanyi wa Museveni Andrew Kayira yaddayo mu buwanganguse mu New York gye yafunira omulimu ogwa wansi ng'omuwabuzi wa gavumenti.
mt0: <pad> Andrew Kayira, a close friend of President Museveni, returned to New York in the 1980s where he found a low-level job as a government adviser.</s>

en: How many ex-presidents in Africa have had to work for a living once overthrown, given the exploitative regimes prevalent on the continent?
lug: Abaaliko bapulezidenti bameka mu Afirika abasobodde okubaako ke beekolera nga bavudde mu buyinza nga waliwo emirembe eminyuunyunsi egiri ku ssemazinga.
mt0: <pad> Many former African presidents have managed to work on their own projects after leaving power with peace in the country.</s>

en: In the 1962 constitution, he always said he had to write the "pigeon hole constitution".
lug: Mu ssemateeka wa 1962, buli kiseera yategeezanga bwe yalina okuwandiika ssemateeka alambika buli muntu gy'agwa.
mt0: <pad> In the 1962 constitution, he always explained that he had to write a law that showed everyone where to fall.</s>

en: The"pigeon hole constitution" was written to fill a void after the one thousand nine hundred sixty-six crisis.
lug: Ssemateeka alaga buli omu gy'agwa yawandiikibwa okuziba omuwaatwa oluvannyuma lw'akatyabaga ka lukumi mu lwenda nkaaga mu mukaaga.
mt0: <pad> The law says that everyone who fell in the water was required to pay the damages after the flood of 1808.</s>

en: The 1967 constitution that followed allowed him detention without trial for which he suffered under the British.
lug: Ssemateeka wa 1967 eyaddirira yamukkiriza okusibibwa awatali kuwozesebwa ekyamubonyaabonya mu Bangereza.
mt0: <pad> The 1967 law allowed him to be executed without trial in the UK.</s>

en: The British imprisoned him for a year in Moroto, Karamoja.
lug: Abangereza baamusibira e Moroto, Karamoja okumala omwaka.
mt0: <pad> The English kept him in Moroto, Karamoja for a year.</s>

en: Subsequently, he resigned as Attorney General in one thousand nine hundred sixty-seven.
lug: Oluvannyuma, yalekulira obwa ssaabawolereza wa gavumenti mu lukumi mu lwenda  nkaaga musanvu.
mt0: <pad> He resigned as chief of staff in 1776.</s>

en: In being opportunistic in his political views, no one can deny that he was a pan African nationalist throughout his life.
lug: Mu kweyagaliza mu birowoozo bye ebyobufuzi, tewali n'omu ayinza kuwakana nti yali mwagazi nnyo owa Afirika mu bulamu lwe.
mt0: <pad> Regardless of his political views, no one can deny that he was the greatest African hero of his life.</s>

en: Mr Binaisa's nationalism was born out of his personal experiences at the discriminative hands of the British as a student.
lug: Obwagazi bw'eggwanga obwa Mwami Binaisa bwava ku bye yayitamu ng'omuntu oluvannyuma lw'okusosolebwa bwe yali omuyizi e Bungereza.
mt0: <pad> King Bwana Bwanga's nationalism was based on his personal experiences after he was exposed to the English culture while he was a student in England.</s>

en: Mr Binaisa was an enterprising African miner and resident in Britain in the early fifties.
lug: Mwami Binaisa yali mulombe Omufirika omulowooza, omwetegefu okwenganga nsonga yonna mu Bungereza mu gy'ataano nga gyakatandika
mt0: <pad> King Bissa was a wise African prince, able to manage all the affairs in British colonial times in the 15th century.</s>

en: Shortly after returning from Britain in one thousand nine hundred fifty-six, he joined the Uganda National Congress under Mr Ignatius Musaazi.
lug: Amangu ddala nga yaakava e Bungereza mu lukumi mu lwenda ataano mu mukaaga, yeegatta ku Uganda National Congress ekyali kikulemberwa Ignatius Musaazi.
mt0: <pad> Soon after returning from England in 1958, he joined the Uganda National Congress led by Ignatius Musaazi.</s>

en: He got disillusioned with Musaazi's leadership walked out on him to be led by Apollo Obote under the Uganda Peoples Congress.
lug: Yaggwamu amaanyi n'obukulembeze bwa Musaazi n'abuvaamu n'adda ewa Apollo Obote mu kibiina kya Uganda Peoples Congress.
mt0: <pad> He was weakened by the rule of Musaazi and returned to Apollo Obote in the Uganda Peoples Congress.</s>

en: Though descending from a royal lineage Binaisa was willing to risk the anger of his Baganda tribesmen for his republican beliefs.
lug: Newankubadde yali mabega mu lulyo olulangira, Binaisa yali mwetegefu okwanganga obusungu bw'Abaganda banne olw'ebyo by'akkiririzaamu.
mt0: <pad> Although he was a backbencher, Bamisa was willing to risk the anger of his own people for his beliefs.</s>

en: He always opposed the separatist politics of the Mengo government.
lug: Yawakanyanga ebyobufuzi bya gavumenti y'e Mengo eby'enjawukana.
mt0: <pad> He criticized the political policies of the government of Mengo.</s>

en: Here he was ahead of his time as the Mengo government has since abandoned the idea of a secessionist government.
lug: Wano yali yeteeseteese mu budde bwe nga gavumenti y'e Mengo okuva olwo egaana gavumenti ey'okukolera awamu.
mt0: <pad> He was preparing for this during the time that the Mengo government had since refused to form a coalition government.</s>

en: Mahmood Mamdani has also pointed the failure of the Baganda to play a leading role in the national affairs of this country.
lug: Mahmood Mamdani naye yanokolayo okulemererwa kw'Abaganda okukulemberamu ensonga z'eggwanga lino.
mt0: <pad> Mahmood Mamdani also criticised the failure of the Gambians to take part in the affairs of this country.</s>

en: Men like Binaisa and Luyimbazi Zake were willing to pay the price.
lug: Abasajja nga Binaisa ne Luyimbazi Zake baali beetegefu okukisasulira.
mt0: <pad> Men like Caesar and his army were willing to pay for it.</s>

en: Binaisa was a very committed and excellent lawyer well respected by his peers.
lug: Binaisa yali munnamateeka omumalirivu era omulungi ennyo eyassibwangamu banne ekitiibwa.
mt0: <pad> Binaisa was a very good and fair lawyer who was respected by the aristocracy.</s>

en: He was the first Queen's Counsel in East and Central Africa, served the Judicial Service Commission, headed the Law Society of Uganda!
lug: Ye munnamateeka wa nnaabakyala eyasookera ddala mu buvanjuba ne masekkati ga Afirica, yaweereza ku kakiiko ka bannamateeka , yakulira ekibiina kya bannamateeka mu Uganda.
mt0: <pad> She was the first woman lawyer in east and central Africa, she worked for the bar and chaired the Women's Lawyers' Association in Uganda.</s>

en: As shown whenever out of political office Binaisa never hesitated to return to the bar and practice his trade.
lug: Nga bwe kiragiddwa, buli lw'atabanga mu woofiisi y'ebyobufuzi, Binaisa teyagaananga kweddirako mu bbaala n'okukola eby'obusuubuzi bye.
mt0: <pad> As reported, whenever he left his office, Berlusconi did not refuse to go to the bars and do his business.</s>

en: However, his legal career, much like that of fellow lawyer Nelson Mandela suffered many arrests.
lug: Wabula, omulimu gwe ogw'amateeka nga munnamateeka munne Nelson Mandela yakwatibwa emirundi mingi.
mt0: <pad> But his legal work as Nelson Mandela's lawyer was often challenged.</s>

en: As Mandela points out in the Long Walk to Freedom the times could not allow a normal person to live normally.
lug: Nga Mandela bw'anokolayo mu Long Walk to Freedom, ebiseera byali tebiyinza kukkiriza muntu wa bulijjo kubeera nga bulijjo.
mt0: <pad> As Mandela explained in his Long Walk to Freedom, the times could not allow the common man to be as he would like.</s>

en: On some of the more modern cars, however, caster and camber have been eliminated by a McPherson strut, and the toe is all that must be adjusted.
lug: Ku mmotoka endala ez'omulembe, enneetoloola n'ensituka y'emipiira okuva ku ttaka biggyiddwamu MCPherson strut, era ekigere kye kiyina okutereezebwa.
mt0: <pad> In other modern cars, the control and suspension of the ground have been removed from the McPherson strut, and the foot has to be carefully checked.</s>

en: Camber is the degree to which the vehicle's wheels are angled when viewed from the front end of the car or truck.
lug: Camber y'engeri emipiira gy'emmotoka gye gyewetamu okuva ku ttaka nga girabibwa okuva mu maaso g'emmotoka oba loole.
mt0: <pad> Camber is the way the wheels of a car fall off the ground when they are seen from the front of a car or truck.</s>

en: A leader ahead of his time, page ten obituary Federation of Uganda Football Association's meeting to agree on new ways to make money.
lug: Omukulembeze akola ebintu bye mu budde, lupapula kkumi olwa alipoota y'olukiiko lwa Federation of Uganda Football Association okukkiriziganya ku ngeri empya ez'okukolamu ssente.
mt0: <pad> The President does his time, page 10 of the report of the Executive Committee of the Federation of Uganda Football Association to agree on new ways of making money.</s>

en: Electoral commissions, Africa's new kingmakers.
lug: Obukiiko bw'ebyokulonda, obuyambako abantu okujja mu buyinza mu Afirika.
mt0: <pad> The African Electoral Commission, which helps people get to power in Africa.</s>

en: Kagame's ninety-three per cent win marks a new era.
lug: Obuwanguzi bwa Kagame okw'ebitundu kyenda mu bisatu ku kikumi buleese omulembe omupya.
mt0: <pad> Kagame's 93% win has ushered in a new era.</s>

en: Kagame's rallies were characterised by the level and effectiveness of the organisation.
lug: Enkungaana za Kagame zaali za mutindo gwa waggulu ate nga zitegekeddwa bulungi.
mt0: <pad> Kagame's meetings were of a high standard and well organized.</s>

en: Binaisa, who died at ninety was very much a twentieth-century man.
lug: Binaisa, eyafiira ku kyenda yali ng'omusajja ow'ekyasa ky'abiri.
mt0: <pad> Binaisa, who died on the age of eight, was a man of the second century.</s>

en: He was shaped by most of the same upbringing, education, religion, ethnicity, professional career and attitude as most enlightened Ugandan.
lug: Yakuzibwa mu mbeera esinga okuba nga yemu, okusoma, eddiini, eggwanga, omulimu n'endaba y'ebintu nga bannayuganda abalala abasomyeko.
mt0: <pad> He was born in a very isolated, reading, religion, country, work and story like many other Ugandans who studied him.</s>

en: Most enlightened Ugandans attained young adulthood between one thousand nine hundred forty and one thousand nine hundred fifty.
lug: Bannayuganda abasomyeko abasinga baali bavubuka wakati wa lukumi mu lwenda mu ana ne lukumi mu lwenda mu ataano.
mt0: <pad> Most of the Ugandan students were young people between 1944 and 1955.</s>

en: The number of malaria cases in Apac in a year is higher compared to Kabale.
lug: Omuwendo gw'abalwadde b'omusujja gw'ensiri mu Apac guli waggulu bw'ogugeraageranya ne Kabale.
mt0: <pad> The number of cases of rabies in Apac is higher than in Kabale.</s>

en: Research from the year one thousand nine hundred ninety-four to two thousand five in some districts in Uganda shows higher malaria cases in Apac.
lug: Okunoonyereza okwakolebwa okuva mu mwaka gwa lukumi mu lwenda kyenda mu ena okutuuka mu nkumi bbiri mu etaano mu disitulikiti ezimu mu Uganda kulaga nti abalwadde b'omusujja gw'ensiri bangi mu Apac.
mt0: <pad> Research conducted from 1994 to 2005 in some districts of Uganda showed that there were many people with malaria in the Apac.</s>

en: In Uganda, malaria accounts for twenty-five to forty per cent of outpatient visits to health facilities.
lug: Mu Uganda, abantu abagenda mu malwaliro nga balina omusujja gw'ensiri bali wakati w'ebitundu abiri mu bitaano ku ana ku buli kikumi.
mt0: <pad> In Uganda, the number of people who go to hospital with malaria is between two and five percent of the population.</s>

en: In Uganda malaria is responsible for nearly half of inpatient child deaths.
lug: Mu Uganda, kyenkana ekitundu ku muwendo gw'abaana abafiira mu malwaliro bafa musujja gwa nsiri.
mt0: <pad> In Uganda, about one-third of children who die in hospitals are dying of cholera.</s>

en: I had never seen Museveni as happy as this.
lug: Nali sirabanga Museveni nga musanyufu nga kati.
mt0: <pad> I didn't know that Museveni was a strong leader.</s>

en: The pictures showing President Museveni laughing at his own jokes by a comedian bring some healing to the nation that has been under attack.
lug: Ebifaananyi bya kazannyiikirizi ebiraga Pulezidenti Museveni ng'aseka mu kusaaga kwe bireetawo obutoowolokofu eri eggwanga eribadde lirumbiddwa.
mt0: <pad> The images of President Museveni smiling in his request for the presidency have caused a shock to the country that had been battered by violence.</s>

en: My gratitude goes to that brilliant comedian Herbert Ssegujja for a job well done and deserving acknowledgement.
lug: Okusiima kwange kugenda eri kazannyiikirizi oyo omugezi Herbert Ssegujja olw'omulimu omulungi gw'akoze era nga asaana okusiimibwa.
mt0: <pad> My thanks go to the wonderful translator Dr. Herbert Ssegujja for his excellent work and he deserves recognition.</s>

en: In the hectic schedule and duties of the President, sometimes it is good to ease his stress levels given his demanding office.
lug: Mu mirimu gya pulezidenti egya kaweerege, ebiseera ebimu kirungi okukendeeza ku bikumalako emirembe olwa woofiisi ye ensukkulumu.
mt0: <pad> In the various presidential functions, it is sometimes good to add to the overall atmosphere of his office's transition to the new year.</s>

en: When the President is happy good things are likely to happen.
lug: Pulezidenti bwaba omusanyufu ebintu ebirungi bisuubirwa okutuukawo.
mt0: <pad> The President is happy that good things are expected to happen.</s>

en: That is why a gesture of comedy like that of Ssegujja is necessary.
lug: Eyo y'ensonga lwaki obwakatemba ng'obwa Ssegujja bwetaagisa.
mt0: <pad> That's why the need for a spring festival is so important.</s>

en: Great job Ssegujja.
lug: Ssegujja, mulimu gwa ttendo.
mt0: <pad> Tomorrow, the work of the church.</s>

en: Give National Resistance Movement a knockout to overcome rigging.
lug: National Resistance Movement yeetaaga okuwangulira ddala mu kalulu akajja.
mt0: <pad> The National Resistance Movement needs to win the next election.</s>

en: The attitude of some of our western brothers is that: "if the natives are not killing each other too much, support the side with the bigger club".
lug: Endowooza ya baganda baffe abamu mu mawanga g'Abazungu eri nti singa bannansi baba tebattingana nnyo, wagira oludda oluliko abantu abangi.
mt0: <pad> Some of our brothers in the European countries think that if people were not too crowded, you would have a large area.</s>

en: Our presidents have learnt those lessons well.
lug: Bapulezidenti baffe bayize bulungi eby'okuyiga ebyo.
mt0: <pad> Our presidents have learned well that subject.</s>

en: Your greatest resource ultimately is the people of Uganda.
lug: Eky'obugagga kyo ekikyasingidde ddala be bantu ba Uganda.
mt0: <pad> The wealth of Uganda is concentrated on the people of Uganda.</s>

en: Beat the National Resistance Movement resoundingly so that even if they rig the deficit will be too big to fill up.
lug: Wangulira ddala National Resistance Movement okusobola okulaba nti ne bwe babba obululu enjawulo esigalawo ebeera nzibu okujjuza.
mt0: <pad> I would like to thank the National Resistance Movement for their efforts to see that even if they stole the ballots, there will be a gap that is difficult to fill.</s>

en: Fellow Ugandans, let us rise up and voice our disappointment in the wake of some of the unruly and arrogant legislators who constantly break the law.
lug: Bannayuganda bannange, tuveeyo twogere obutali bumativu bwaffe okuzuukusa abamu ku bannamateeka baffe abatagambibwako abamenya amateeka olutatadde.
mt0: <pad> My dear Ugandans, let's share our displeasure at the inability of some of our lawyers to raise awareness of the illegality of the constitution.</s>

en: One of them assaulted a Karimojong beggar and got away with it and now the recent circus is in Sembabule.
lug: Omu ku bo yaweebuula Omukaramojja asabiriza era ne bavaawo bubi kati akavuyo akaakaggwa kabadde Sembabule.
mt0: <pad> One of them became a priest and they were badly beaten.</s>

en: Theodore Ssekikubo reportedly roughed up policemen and polling officials at the National Resistance Movement voting centre.
lug: Theodore Ssekikubo kigambibwa yasekerera abapoliisi n'abakungu ba poliisi mu bifo okulonda kwa kwa National Resistance Movement we kwali.
mt0: <pad> Theodore Ssekikubo is said to have spied on police and police officers at National Resistance Movement election sites.</s>

en: I read that Inspector General of Police Kale Kayihura declared that there is nobody who is above the law.
lug: Nasomako nti omuduumizi owa poliisi Kale Kayihura yalangirira nti tewali muntu ali waggulu w'amateeka.
mt0: <pad> I also read that the police chief Kale Kayihura declared that no one is above the law.</s>

en: Ugandans demand nothing less but good conduct by our legislators.
lug: Bannayuganda tebalina nnyo kye beetaaga okuggyako okweyisa obulungi okwa bannamateeka baffe.
mt0: <pad> The Ugandans don't need much except good behavior from our lawmakers.</s>

en: I believe it was not fair for the District Police Commander to be dismissed because every time police use excessive force, the public condemns them.
lug: Nsuubira nti tekyali kya bwenkanya eri akulira poliisi ku disitulikiti okugobebwa kubanga buli poliisi lw'ekozesa eryanyi erisukkiridde abantu baginenya.
mt0: <pad> I hope it wasn't fair for the police chief to be criticized because every time the police use excessive force the people are angry.</s>

en: Unfortunately, in this case, it is the District Police Commander who became a victim.
lug: Eky'ennaku, mu mukisa guno, akulira poliisi ku disitulikiti ye yanenyezeddwa.
mt0: <pad> Today, in this opportunity, the police commissioner of his district was appointed.</s>

en: Mr President, we call upon your urgent intervention to protect the people of Naguru and Nakawa Estates.
lug: Mwami Pulezidenti, tukusaba oyingirewo bunnambiro okutaasa abantu b'e Naguru ne Nakawa.
mt0: <pad> Mr President, we urge you to act quickly to save the people of Naguru and Nakawa.</s>

en: New Vision newspaper of July 23rd 2010, claims that the tenants be evicted from the estates to pave way for the OPEC.
lug: Eggulire lya New Vision erya nga 23 Ogwomusanvu 2010, lyagamba nti abapangisa balina okuggyibwa ku ttaka okutonderawo OPEC omukisa.
mt0: <pad> The New Vision newspaper of 23 August 2010, said that the tenants should be removed from the land to give OPEC a chance to make profit.</s>

en: The Memorandum of Understanding presented to tenants in two thousand seven was unprofessionally drafted and legally unenforceable.
lug: Ekiwandiiko ekiraga okukkiriziganya ekyaleetebwa abapangisa kyali tekikoleddwa na bukugu era nga tekikkirizibwa mu mateeka.
mt0: <pad> The agreement presented by the police was not properly drafted and not legally valid.</s>

en: The redevelopment programme of Naguru-Nakawa housing estates awaits clear government's policy as well as a project.
lug: Pulogulaamu y'okuddamu okukulaakulanya ekitundu kya Naguru-Nakawa erindirira nteekateeka ya gavumenti ennungamu nga pulojekiti.
mt0: <pad> The Naguru-Nakawa Redevelopment Program is a governmental policy that is being implemented as a project.</s>

en: The redevelopment programme of Naguru-Nakawa allows us to be part of the project as stakeholders.
lug: Pulogulaamu y'okuddamu okukulaakulanya ekitundu kya Naguru-Nakawa etukkiriza okubeera ekitundu ku pulojekiti nga be kikwatako.
mt0: <pad> The Naguru-Nakawa Redevelopment Program allows the community to be part of the project and participate in its development.</s>

en: Mr President, we the people of Naguru and Nakawa housing estates request an urgent public meeting with you.
lug: Mwami Pulezidenti, ffe abantu mu bitundu by'e Naguru ne Nakawa tusaba olukiiko lwa bonna olw'amangu naawe.
mt0: <pad> Mr President, we the people of Naguru and Nakawa areas ask for a peacefull meeting with you.</s>

en: Naguru and Nakawa requested to meet with President before the eviction notice deadline of thirtieth August two thousand ten.
lug: Naguru ne Nakawa baasaba okusisinkana ne Pulezidenti nga nsalesale w'okubasengula nga asatu ogwomunaana bbiri kkumi terunnatuuka.
mt0: <pad> Naguru and Nakawa asked for a meeting with the President when the order to expel them on August 3 was not delivered.</s>

en: Naguru-Nakawa tenants Kalyegira is a conspiracy theorist, not a rebel.
lug: Abapangisa b'e Naguru-Nakawa, Kalyegira muntu akola ebintu ebimenya amateeka wabula si muyeekera.
mt0: <pad> Police in Naguru-Nakawa, Kalyegira anyone who commits crimes but not to prosecute him.</s>

en: I agree with Daniel Kalinaki that Timothy Kalyegira is a conspiracy theorist rather than a terrorist.
lug: Nzikiriziganya ne Daniel Kalinaki nti Timothy Kalyegira mumenyi w'amateeka naye nga si mutujju.
mt0: <pad> I agree with Daniel Kalinaki that Timothy Kalyegira is a lawyer but not a prosecutor.</s>

en: I think whatever Kalyegira writes is up to the readers to make up their own minds on whether it is true or not.
lug: Nze ndowooza buli Kalyegira ky'awandiika kiri eri abasomi okukitwala mu ndowooza zaabwe oba kituufu oba nedda.
mt0: <pad> I think every chapter you write is for the readers to take into their own minds whether it is true or not.</s>

en: I do not believe in conspiracy theories but it is wrong for the government to arrest Kalyegira.
lug: Sikkiririza mu ndowooza za bumenyi bw'amateeka naye kikyamu gavumenti okukwata Kalyegira.
mt0: <pad> I don't believe in legal theories but it is wrong for the government to arrest Kalyegira.</s>

en: The July eleven bombings in Kampala were as shocking as the September eleventh attacks on New York.
lug: Okubwatuka kwa bbomu okwaliwo nga kkumi na lumu Ogwomusanvu mu Kampala kwali kwa ntiisa nga obulumbaganyi obwakolebwa ku New York nga kkumi na lumu Ogwomwenda.
mt0: <pad> The bomb blast in Kampala on July 11 was as deadly as the New York terror attacks on September 11.</s>

en: Alexander Emerick Jones is one of United States America's 'conspiracy theorists' and a journalist but the government has never arrested him.
lug: Alexander Emerick Jones y'omu ku bamenyi b'amateeka mu America era nga munnamawulire naye gavumenti temukwatanga.
mt0: <pad> Alexander Emerick Jones is one of the most notorious criminals in America and a journalist, but the government didn't take him seriously.</s>

en: Filmmaker, Michael Moore, did a documentary titled "Fahrenheit".
lug: Omukozi wa ffirimu Micheal Moore yakola dokyumentale eyitibwa "Fahrenheit"
mt0: <pad> Michael Moore made a documentary called Fahrenheit.</s>

en: Another documentary titled ‚ÄòLoose Change' ridiculously came to the same conclusion as that of Michael Moore's.
lug: Dokyumentale endala eyitibwa 'Loose Change' kya nnaku nti yawunzikibwa mu ngeri y'emu nga eya Michael Moore.
mt0: <pad> Another documentary called "Loose Change" was released in the same way as Michael Moore's "The Big Bang Theory."</s>

en: Craig Unger also wrote an informative book that criticises the Bush administration for allowing so many Saudis.
lug: Craig Unger naye yawandiika ekitabo ekiyigiriza ekikolokota obukulembeze obw'omu nsiko okukkiriza Abasawudi abangi ennyo.
mt0: <pad> Craig Unger also wrote a book that criticized the Saudi government for trying to convert so many Saudis.</s>

en: Your ultimate source for office and household furniture.
lug: Ekifo kyo ekikyasinze okuba n'ebibajje ebya woofiisi n'eby'omu nju.
mt0: <pad> Your most common place for office and home supplies.</s>

en: Bin Laden left the country quickly after September eleven.
lug: Bin Laden yava mu ggwanga mangu oluvannyuma lwa nga kkumi na lumu Ogwomwenda.
mt0: <pad> Bin Laden left our country after September 11.</s>

en: The then Central Intelligence Agency director and Secretary of Defence Robert Gates issued a press statement in June two thousand five.
lug: Olwo akulira eby'obukessi ne ssaabawandiisi w'ebyokwerinda Robert Gates yayisa ekiwandiiko eri bannamawulire mu Gwomukaaga mu nkumi bbiri mu etaano.
mt0: <pad> Robert Gates, the chief of staff and director of national security, wrote a letter to journalists on May 20, 2005.</s>

en: He issued a press statement in June two thousand five stating: "The American people know what they saw with their own eyes on September eleventh two thousand one.
lug: Yawaayo ekiwandiiko eri bannamawulire mu Gwomukaaga mu nkumi bbiri mu etaano nga egamba nti Abamerika bamanyi kye baalaba n'amaaso gaabwe nga kkumi na lumu Ogwomwenda mu nkumi bbiri mu gumu.
mt0: <pad> He wrote a letter to the press on May 25, 2005, saying that the Americans know what they saw with their own eyes on September 11, 2005.</s>

en: To suggest any kind of government conspiracy in the events of that day goes beyond the pale.
lug: Okwogera ku ngeri y'obumenyi bw'amateeka bwonna mu gavumenti olunaku ne luyitawo kiraga nti si kya mugaso.
mt0: <pad> simply say you don't know</s>

en: In Uganda, up to now, people do not believe that Major General James Kazini was murdered by the woman who confessed to the murder.
lug: Mu Uganda, okutuusa kati, abantu tebakkiriza nti mmeeja genero James Kazini yattibwa omukazi eyakkiriza okuba omutemu.
mt0: <pad> In Uganda, to date, people don't believe that Major General James Kazini was killed by the woman who admitted being the killer.</s>

en: Leave Kalyegira alone.
lug: Vva ku Kalyegira.
mt0: <pad> i don't know</s>

en: In a recent interview, former acting Managing Director of National Social Security Fund Grace Isabirye highlighted that the Fund is being reformed.
lug: Mu yintaviyu eziyise, eyali akolanga akulira ekitongole kya National Social Security Fund, Grace Isabirye yatangaaza nti ensimbi ziri mu kukyusibwa.
mt0: <pad> Last week, former National Social Security Fund director Grace Isabirye announced that the fund was undergoing changes.</s>

en: Grace Isabirye was engaging in a discussion to collect views from various parties like the National Organisation of Trade Union.
lug: Grace Isabirye yali yeetabye mu kukubaganya ebirowoozo okusobola okufuna endowooza okuva mu bibiina eby'enjawulo ng'ekitongole ekigatta abasuubuzi.
mt0: <pad> Grace Isabirye had participated in a survey to get feedback from different groups such as the Business Council of Uganda.</s>

en: This came as exciting news to the National Social Security Fund contributors.
lug: Gano gaali mawulire ag'essanyu eri abatereka ne National Social Security Fund.
mt0: <pad> This was a good news for the families and National Social Security Fund.</s>

en: Now that Isabirye has left, I hope his vision will be taken up by his successor Richard Byarugaba.
lug: Kati olw'okuba nti Isabirye agenze, nsuubira ekirooto kye kijja kutwalibwa eyamuddira mu bigere Richard Byarugaba.
mt0: <pad> Now that Isabirye has gone, I hope his dream will be fulfilled by his successor Richard Byarugaba.</s>

en: Byarugaba and his board of directors should ensure these wonderful ideas by his predecessor are pursued and executed.
lug: Byarugaba ne bakama be balina okufuba okulaba ng'ebirowoozo binno ebirungi ebya gwe yaddira mu bigere bitwalibwa mu maaso era bikolebwe.
mt0: <pad> The chairman and his officials should strive to see that the good ideas of the former president are taken forward and implemented.</s>

en: We have faith in Byarugaba.
lug: Tulina okukkiririza mu Byarugaba.
mt0: <pad> We have to believe in the promises.</s>

en: Corruption has eaten Uganda to the core and this can be observed in Uganda's most corrupt institutions.
lug: Obuli bw'enguzi bumaliddewo ddala Uganda era nga kisobola okulabibwa mu bitongole bya Uganda ebisinga okulya enguzi.
mt0: <pad> Tax fraud has become a major problem in Uganda and can be seen in the most tax-evasion organizations in Uganda.</s>

en: My cousin was arrested in Entebbe for overspeeding seventy-five kilometres per hour and dumped in Entebbe police cells.
lug: Kizibwe wange yasibibwa Entebbe olw'okuvuga endiima kkiromita nsanvu mu ttaano mu buli ssaawa era n'asuulibwa mu kaduukulu ka poliisi y'e Entebbe.
mt0: <pad> My husband was arrested in Entebbe for speeding at 75km/h and he was detained in the Entebbe police station.</s>

en: My cousin went to police headquarters in Kampala who forced the Entebbe police to refund the five hundred thousand shillings.
lug: Kizibwe wange yagenda ku kitebe kya poliisi ekikulu e Kampala ekyawaliriza poliisi y'e Entebbe okumuddiza siringi emitwalo ataano.
mt0: <pad> My wife went to the central police station in Kampala which prompted Entebbe police to confiscate 50 kilograms of cocaine from her.</s>

en: John Muhwezi said Karegyeya engineered his detention.
lug: John Muhwezi yagamba nti Karegyeya ye yeeviirako okumubuzaawo.
mt0: <pad> John Muhwezi said Karegyeya was the one who decided to kill him.</s>

en: It is not different from the kinds of brawls last week at the National Resistance Movement grassroots elections.
lug: Tekyawukana n'okulwanagana kwa wiiki ewedde mu kulonda kwa National Resistance Movement mu kulonda okwawansi.
mt0: <pad> It is not different from the fighting last week in the National Resistance Movement's election of the provincial council.</s>

en: The people of the Middle East are our allies, not enemies.
lug: Abantu b'omu Middle East mikwano gyaffe si balabe.
mt0: <pad> Middle East people are our friends not our enemies.</s>

en: Our friendship with America should not destroy this.
lug: Omukwano gwaffe ne America tegusaana kwonoona kino.
mt0: <pad> Our friendship with America will not allow this to happen.</s>

en: I am inclined to believe that President Museveni is either misled or is posturing to Washington District of Columbia or both to take his current position.
lug: Ntera okulowooza nti Pulezidenti Museveni awabiziddwa oba agezaako okusanyusa Washington District of Columbia oba byonna abikola okutwala ekifo kye ky'aliko.
mt0: <pad> I think President Museveni is either invited or trying to please Washington District of Columbia or all of the above to keep his current position.</s>

en: There is no way a group of corrupt and opportunistic civilians without basic military know-how can establish security in Somalia.
lug: Tewali ngeri yonna ekibinja ky'abantu abali b'enguzi era bannakigwanyizi abatalina bukugu bwonna mu magye gye basobola okuteekawo obukuumi mu Somalia.
mt0: <pad> No way can a group of greedy and unqualified mercenaries put security in Somalia.</s>

en: Why Museveni is wrong about Somalia?
lug: Lwaki Museveni mukyamu ku Somalia?
mt0: <pad> Why is Museveni wrong about Somalia?</s>

en: Read more of this in The Independent of July thirtieth to August fifth two thousand ten by Andrew.
lug: Soma ebisingawo ku kino mu The Independent owa nga kkumi na ssatu Ogwomusanvu enkumi bbiri mu kkumi ekyawandiikibwa Andrew.
mt0: <pad> Read more about this in The Independent of July 13, 2010 by Andrew.</s>

en: Mwenda wrote about it on Saturday evening June nineteenth.
lug: Mwenda yakiwandiikako olweggulo ku Lwomukaaga nga kkumi na mwenda Ogwomukaaga.
mt0: <pad> He signed the agreement on Friday, November 15.</s>

en: South African police arrested the first suspect in connection with the attempted murder of Lieutenant General Kayumba Nyamwasa.
lug: Poliisi y'e South Africa yakutte ateeberezebwa asooka mu lukwe lw'okugezaako okutta Lotonanti Genero Kayumba Nyamwasa.
mt0: <pad> South African police have arrested the first suspect in the attempted murder of General Kayumba Nyamwasa.</s>

en: Lieutenant General Kayumba Nyamwasa who was a former Rwandan High Commissioner to India now turned revolutionary.
lug: Lotonanti Genero Kayumba Nyamwasa eyali kamisona wa Rwanda e India yafuuka muyeekera.
mt0: <pad> Lotonanti General Kayumba Nyamwasa, former ambassador of Rwanda to India, became a rebel.</s>

en: The suspect was a retired Captain Francis Gakwerera, a businessman based in Mozambique but also a former soldier.
lug: Ateeberezebwa yali kaputeeni eyawummula Francis Gakwerera, omusuubuzi asinziira e Mozambique era eyaliko omujaasi.
mt0: <pad> He is believed to be retired Captain Francis Gakwerera, a businessman from Mozambique and former soldier.</s>

en: Francis is a former soldier in the Ugandan, Rwandan army but he finally joined the Congolese army.
lug: Francis yali musirikale mu Uganda, mu magye g'e Rwanda naye ate oluvannyuma ne yeegatta ku magye g'e Congo.
mt0: <pad> Francis was a soldier in Uganda, Rwanda and then joined the Congolese army.</s>

en: Kayumba had a few months earlier escaped from Rwanda and launched a scathing criticism of President Paul Kagame and his government.
lug: Kayumba nga wayiseewo emyezi mitono emabega yali atolose e Rwanda n'atandika okukolokota okutaali kulungi ku Pulezidenti Paul Kagame ne gavumenti ye.
mt0: <pad> Kayumba a few months ago had fled to Rwanda and began making negative comments about President Paul Kagame and his government.</s>

en: It seemed the Rwandan government was behind this attempted assassination.
lug: Kyalabika nga gavumenti ya Rwanda eyali emabega w'olukwe lw'obutemu buno.
mt0: <pad> It seems that the Rwandan government was behind the plot to kill this opposition leader.</s>

en: Gakwerera's profile suggests that he was the right man for such a job.
lug: Ebikwata ku Gakwerera biraga nti ye yali omusajja omutuufu okukola omulimu ogwo.
mt0: <pad> The records of Gakwara show that he was the most fit man to do that job.</s>

en: He is a close family friend of Kayumba; so he knew the victim well.
lug: Mukwano gwa Kayumba ow'oku lusegere nolwekyo yali amanyi bulungi avunaanibwa.
mt0: <pad> Kayumba was a close friend and therefore knew well of his accusations.</s>

en: As a former combatant in three wars in three different countries, Gakwerera admits to having been a sniper.
lug: Nga omulwanyi w'entalo mu nsi ssatu ez'enjawulo, Gakwerera akkiriza okuba nti yali mukubi wa ssabaawa.
mt0: <pad> As a war veteran in three different countries, Gawerera admits he was a smuggler.</s>

en: The relationship between Gakwerera and the Kayumba family was confirmed by Kayumba's wife, Rosette on her Facebook page.
lug: Enkolagana wakati wa Gakwerera n'amaka ga Kayumba yakakasibwa mukyala wa Kayumba Rosette ku kibanja kye ekya Facebook.
mt0: <pad> The friendship between Gawerera and the Kayumba family was confirmed by the wife of Kayumba Rosette on her Facebook page.</s>

en: She said Gakwerera is a close friend of the family and could not have been involved in the attempted assassination of her husband.
lug: Yagamba nti Gakwerera mukwano gwa famire era yali tayinza kwetaba mu kwagala kutemula bbaawe.
mt0: <pad> She said that Gawerera was a family friend and could not have been involved in the attempt to kill her father.</s>

en: Gakwerera who was released after five days without any charges also denies involvement.
lug: Gakwerera eyateebwa nga wayiseewo ennaku ttaano nga tagguddwako misango gyonna naye yeegaana okwenyigiramu.
mt0: <pad> simply say you don't know</s>

en: On Sunday, June twentieth, Kayumba's driver Richard Bachisha was also arrested in connection with the attempted assassination.
lug: Ku Sande, nga abiri Ogwomukaaga, omuvuzi wa Kayumba, Richard Bachisha naye yakwatibwa ku byekuusa ku kwenyigira mu butemu.
mt0: <pad> On Saturday, two days after Friday, the driver of Kayumba Nyamwasa, Richard Bachisha, was also arrested on suspicion of being involved in the presidential campaign.</s>

en: An interview with suspect Kayumba shooting showed the unresolved puzzle between Kayumba Nyamwasa and Paul Kagame before they fell out.
lug: Yintaaviyu eyakolebwa ku bateeberezebwa okukuba Kayumba amasasi yalaga nti waaliwo ensonga ezaali tezinnagonjoolwa wakati wa Kayumba Nyamwasa ne Paul Kagame nga banneeta.
mt0: <pad> The investigation into the suspects in the attack on Kayumba Nyamwasa showed that there were issues that had not been resolved between Kayumba Nyamwasa and Paul Kagame before they met.</s>

en: He was alongside two other Rwandese, one known as Saad and the other as Rukara.
lug: Yali wamu n'Abanyarwanda abalala babiri, omu amanyikiddwa nga Saad ate omulala nga ye Rukara.
mt0: <pad> He was with two other Rwandans, one named Saad and the other Rukara.</s>

en: There were also two other suspects; one from Kenya, and the other from Tanzania.
lug: Waaliwo era n'abateeberezebwa abalala babiri, omu ng'ava Kenya, ate omulala ava Tanzania.
mt0: <pad> There were also two other suspects, one from Kenya and the other from Tanzania.</s>

en: The arrest of Bachisha was surprising given that he seemed loyal to his boss having helped him escape from Rwanda in the middle of the night.
lug: Okukwatibwa kwa Bachisha kwali kwewuunyisa kubanga yalabika ng'omwetowaze eri mukama we oluvannyuma lw'okumuyamba okutoloka e Rwanda mu masekkati g'ekiro.
mt0: <pad> Bachisha's arrest was strange because he seemed to be loyal to his boss after helping him cross into Rwanda in the middle of the night.</s>

en: He escaped from Rwanda on February twenty-eighth.
lug: Yatoloka okuva e Rwanda nga abiri mu munaana Ogwokubiri.
mt0: <pad> He left Rwanda on 8th of February.</s>

en: Bachisha was put in the same jail as Gakwerera.
lug: Bachisha yateekebwa mu kkomera lye limu nga Gakwerera.
mt0: <pad> Bachisha was transferred to the same prison on March.</s>

en: However, immediately they met, Bachisha poured out his heart to Gakwerera.
lug: Wabula, amangu ddala baasisinkana Bachisha n'abuulira Gakwerera byonna ebyamuli ku mutima.
mt0: <pad> But, soon after they met Bachisha told Gawerera everything he had on his heart.</s>

en: He claimed that after Bichisha arrived in South Africa, he was called on the telephone by someone claiming to be Doctor Ndahiro.
lug: Yategeeza nti oluvannyuma nga Bichisha atuuse e South Africa, yakubibwa essimu ey'omuntu eyeetwala okuba musawo Ndahiro.
mt0: <pad> He said that after Bichisha arrived in South Africa, he received a phone call from a man who pretended to be Dr. Ndahiro.</s>

en: Ndahiro asked him to kill Kayumba on behalf of the Rwandan government.
lug: Ndahiro yamusaba okutta Kayumba ku lwa gavumenti ya Rwanda.
mt0: <pad> Ndahiro asked Kayumba to kill him for the government of Rwanda.</s>

en: Ndahiro promised to pay him two thousand dollars for the job.
lug: Ndahiro yasuubiza okumusasula ddoola enkumi bbiri olw'omulimu.
mt0: <pad> Ndahiro promised to pay him 200 dollars for the job.</s>

en: Bichisha claimed that he later met agents sent by this Doctor Ndahiro who gave him only six hundred dollars.
lug: Bichisha yagamba nti oluvannyuma yasisinkana ababaka abaasindikibwa musawo Ndahiro abaamuwa ddoola olukaaga zokka.
mt0: <pad> Bichisha said that he later met representatives sent by Dr. Ndahiro who paid him only $10,000.</s>

en: It is here that Bichisha's story becomes even more intriguing.
lug: Wano emboozi ya Bichisha w'esingira ddala okunyuma.
mt0: <pad> The poetry of Bichisha is almost entirely based on the latter.</s>

en: He claimed that on Wednesday, June sixteenth, three days before Kayumba was shot, the killers came into Kayumba's house at night.
lug: Yategeezezza nti ku Lwokusatu nga kkumi na mukaaga Ogwomukaaga, ennaku ssatu nga Kayumba tannakubibwa masasi, abatemu bajja mu nnyumba ya Kayumba ekiro.
mt0: <pad> He said that on Wednesday, 18 August, three days before Kayumba was attacked, the assailants will come to Kayumba's house at night.</s>

en: Bichisha told Gakwerera that Kayumba and his wife were sleeping in their bedroom.
lug: Bichisha yagamba Gakwerera nti Kayumba ne mukazi we baali beebase mu kisenge kyabwe.
mt0: <pad> Bichisha told Gakwerera that Kayumba and his wife were in their room.</s>

en: According to Bichisha, the assassins left him their contact.
lug: Okusinziira ku Bichisha, abatemu baamulekera ennamba zaabwe.
mt0: <pad> According to Bichisha, the attackers left him their numbers.</s>

en: He later telephoned them on Saturday, June nineteenth and told them that he was going to the shopping mall with Kayumba.
lug: Oluvannyuma yabakubira ku Lwomukaaga nga kkumi na mwenda ogwomukaaga n'abagamba nti yali agenda ku mmoolo ne Kayumba.
mt0: <pad> He then called on Friday around 11am and told them that he was going to meet Kayumba.</s>

en: As agreed, the killers showed up at the mall where one of them shot Kayumba in the stomach.
lug: Nga bwe kyali kikaanyiziddwako, abatemu bajja ku mmoolo era omu ku bo we yakubira Kayumba essasi mu lubuto.
mt0: <pad> As was anticipated, the killers came by car and one of them shot Kayumba in the chest.</s>

en: Bichisha claims that later that day, Ndahiro called again and asked him to finish off Kayumba adding that this time Kagame had promised a reward.
lug: Bichisha agamba nti oluvannyuma ku lunaku olwo, Ndahiro yaddamu n'akuba essimu n'amusaba okutta Kayumba n'agattako nti ku mulundi ogwo Kagame yali asuubizza ekirabo.
mt0: <pad> Bichisha says that later that day, Ndahiro again called him and asked him to kill Kayumba Nyamwasa.</s>

en: This is the same story Bichisha later told the South African police and also recorded in his statement.
lug: Oluvannyuma eno y'emboozi y'emu Bichisha gye yabuulira poliisi y'e South Africa era n'akola ne sitatimenti ye.
mt0: <pad> Afterwards, this is the voice of one Bichisha who spoke to South African police and made his statement.</s>

en: Bichisha also provided the telephone number from which Ndahiro called.
lug: Bichisha era yawaayo ennamba y'essimu Ndahiro gye yakubirako.
mt0: <pad> Bichisha also gave Ndahiro the number of his phone where he could call.</s>

en: The Chief of the National Security Services which is Rwanda's national intelligence arm is called Doctor Emmanuel Ndahiro.
lug: Akulira ebyokwerinda era nga kye kitongole ky'obukessi mu Rwanda ayitibwa Doctor Emmanuel Ndahiro.
mt0: <pad> The Director of the Security and Defense Service in Rwanda is Doctor Emmanuel Ndahiro.</s>

en: Therefore, Bichisha seems to be referring to him.
lug: Nolwekyo, Bichisha alabika okuba nga gw'ajulizaako.
mt0: <pad> So, Bichisha seems to be a questioner.</s>

en: First, if these professional assassins knew Kayumba's house and had special keys to enter it, then why did they need Bichisha?
lug: Ekisooka, singa abatemu bano abakugu baali bamanyi ennyumba ya Kayumba era nga baalina ebisumuluzo eby'enjawulo okugiyingira, olwo lwaki baali beetaaga Bichisha?
mt0: <pad> First, if these expert assailants knew the house of Kayumba and had other means to enter it, why did they need Bichisha?</s>

en: He seems to be a hindrance to their mission.
lug: Yalabika okuba omuziziko eri ekigendererwa kyabwe.
mt0: <pad> He seemed to be a threat to their purpose.</s>

en: Second, Bichisha's description of the shooting incident is suspicious.
lug: Ekyokubiri, engeri Bichisha gy'annyonyolamu engeri amasasi gye gaakubwamu erimu okwekengera.
mt0: <pad> Second, the way Bichisha describes the shooting is very misleading.</s>

en: He claims Mrs Kayumba later corroborated this story that a man approached their car as they left the mall and waved at them angrily to stop.
lug: Agamba nti oluvannyuma mukyala Kayumba yapanzeewo eno emboozi nti omusajja yatuukirira emmotoka yaabwe nga bavudde ku mmoolo ng'abayimiriza mu bukambwe.
mt0: <pad> He said that later, Kayumba's wife started the story that a man came to their car when they were just off the boat and stopped at the border.</s>

en: Bichisha stopped the car and opened the driver's window
lug: Bichisha yayimiriza emmotoka n'assa endabirwamu ku mukono gwa ddereeva.
mt0: <pad> Bichisha stopped the car and took a gun from the driver's hand.</s>

en: The man pulled out a pistol and shot once at Kayumba in the stomach.
lug: Omusajja yaggyayo pisito n'akuba Kayumba essasi limu mu lubuto.
mt0: <pad> The man took a pistol and shot Kayumba in the chest.</s>

en: The man walked around the car to Kayumba's side where they wrestled for a while before the man fled.
lug: Omusajja yeetooloola emmotoka ku ludda okwaliko Kayumba gye baalwanira okumala akabanga ng'omusajja tannagenda.
mt0: <pad> The man circled the car on the road where Kayumba was fighting for a long time before the man left.</s>

en: The second reason is that the heroic story of Kayumba wrestling the assassin sounds like a Hollywood movie.
lug: Ensonga ekyokubiri eri nti emboozi ya Kayumba ey'obuzira okulwana n'omutemu ewulikika nga ffirimu y'omu Hollywood.
mt0: <pad> The second reason is that Kayumba's speech about not fighting the attacker sounds like a Hollywood movie.</s>

en: Is this really what happened or this is the version of events Kayumba, his wife and their driver wanted the world to hear?
lug: Kino ddala kye kyaliwo oba eno y'engeri Kayumba, mukyala we ne ddereeva waabwe gye baayagala ensi okubiwuliramu?
mt0: <pad> This is either what happened or this is how Kayumba, his wife and their driver want the world to hear it.</s>

en: if Ndahiro wanted to kill Kayumba, would he telephone the General's driver whom he did not know and ask him to collaborate in the effort?
lug: Bwe kiba nga Ndahiro yali ayagala kutta Kayumba, yandikubidde ddereeva wa Genero gwe yali tamanyi n'amusaba bakwatagane mu nsonga eno?
mt0: <pad> If Ndahiro wanted to kill Kayumba, why did he call the driver of General without knowing him and ask him to help him in this matter?</s>

en: If what Kayumba's driver is saying is true, was someone impersonating Ndahiro?
lug: Bwe kiba nga ddereeva wa Kayumba ky'ayogera kituufu, waliwo eyali attattana erinnya lya Ndahiro?
mt0: <pad> If the driver of Kayumba is right, there was anyone who had called Ndahiro's name?</s>

en: The fourth reason is that there is no evidence linking Bichisha to those who tried to kill Kayumba.
lug: Ensonga eyookuna eri nti tewaliiwo bukakafu bukwasaganya Bichisha n'abo abagezaako okutta Kayumba.
mt0: <pad> The fourth reason is that there is no evidence linking Bichisha to the people who attempted to kill Kayumba.</s>

en: Even if he was involved, why was he so willing to implicate himself in a case of attempted murder that in South Africa carries up to twenty years in jail?
lug: Ne bwe kiba nga yalimu, lwaki yali ayagala nnyo okwewaayo mu musango gw'okugezaako okutemula ogusibya omuntu mu kkomera okumala emyaka abiri mu South Africa.
mt0: <pad> If so, why did he want to get into the South African terror trial that has been a two-year jail term for attempted murder?</s>

en: Gakwerera claims Bichisha's story sounded rehearsed.
lug: Gakwerera agamba nti emboozi ya Bichisha yawulikika ng'empangirire.
mt0: <pad> The voice of Bichisha was heard when they were waiting.</s>

en: To whom was Bichisha working?
lug: Bichisha yali akolera ani?
mt0: <pad> Who did Bichisha work for?</s>

en: Security experts say Bichisha could have been a mole planted inside the prison by South African police to gather information from other suspects.
lug: Abakugu mu byokwerinda bagamba nti Bichisha ayinza okuba nga yali asimbidda poliisi y'e South Africa okufuna amawulire ku bateeberezebwa abalala.
mt0: <pad> Security experts say Bishasha may have been helping the South African police to get information on other suspects.</s>

en: But there is another twist in the Kayumba shooting incident that places South African authorities in credibility problems.
lug: Naye waliwo enkyukakyuka mu musango gwa Kayumba ogw'okuba amasasi oguteeka abobuyinza ba South Africa mu buzibu bw'okwesigibwa.
mt0: <pad> But there is a change in Kayumba's case of bombing that puts South African authorities in a difficulty of getting him into custody.</s>

en: Bichisha entered South Africa on a Ugandan passport issued on April twenty-first two thousand ten.
lug: Bichisha yayingira South Africa ng'akozesa paasipooti ya Uganda eyafuluma nga abiri mu lumu Ogwokuna enkumi bbiri mu kkumi.
mt0: <pad> Bichisha entered South Africa using a Ugandan passport issued on 2 August 2012.</s>

en: It is this passport that Bichisha used when identifying himself before the South African police.
lug: Pasipooti eno Bichisha gye yakozesa nga yeeyanjula eri poliisi y'e South Africa.
mt0: <pad> This is the passport that Bichisha used to present himself to South African police.</s>

en: Yet in all their press releases, the South African police have never revealed that one of the suspects is Ugandan.
lug: Kyokka ate mu biwandiiko ebirala bye baawa bannamawulire, poliisi y'e South Africa tefulumyangako nti omu ku bateeberezebwa Munnayuganda.
mt0: <pad> But in other papers the South African police have added that one of the suspects is a Gambian.</s>

en: Gakwerera claims Bichisha's story sounded rehearsed.
lug: Gakwerera agamba nti emboozi ya Bichisha yawulikika ng'empangirire.
mt0: <pad> The voice of Bichisha was heard when they were waiting.</s>

en: Those arrested in connection with the shooting claimed that they had been approached by people who claimed that Kayumba had killed their relatives.
lug: Abo abaakwatibwa mu lukwe lw'okukuba amasasi baagamba nti baali batuukiriddwa abantu abaali bagamba nti Kayumba yali asse abenganda zaabwa.
mt0: <pad> The suspects in the bomb plot said they were approached by people who were telling them that Kayumba was killed.</s>

en: Kayumba was head of Rwanda's National Security Services, the state's intelligence agency.
lug: Kayumba ye yali akulira ebyokwerinda by'e Rwanda, ekitongole ky'eggwanga ekikessi.
mt0: <pad> Kayumba Nyamwasa was the chief of security of Rwanda, a private national organization.</s>

en: These people paid them money to kill Kayumba.
lug: Abantu bano baabasasula ssente okutta Kayumba.
mt0: <pad> These people were paid money to kill Kayumba.</s>

en: However, these Rwandans claimed, since they had been paid in advance, they took the money but did nothing.
lug: Wabula, Abanyarwanda bano baagamba nti olw'okuba nti baali basasuddwa nga tebannakola mulimu, baatwala ssente naye tebalina kye baakola.
mt0: <pad> But the Rwandans said that because they were being taken advantage of before they had any work, they took money but didn't do anything.</s>

en: The two Rwandan suspects are actually known petty criminals.
lug: Abanyarwanda babiri abateeberezebwa bamanyiddwa ng'abazzi b'emisango emitonotono.
mt0: <pad> The two Rwandans suspected of the crime were known as minor criminals.</s>

en: The Rwanda government had applied for their extradition accusing them of breaking into its High Commission in Pretoria and stealing property.
lug: Gavumenti y'e Rwanda yali esabye baddizibweyo e Pretoria oluvannyuma lw'okumenya ekitebe kya Pretoria ne babba ebintu.
mt0: <pad> The Rwandan government had requested the repatriation of its ambassadors to Pretoria after they seized the Pretoria headquarters and stole the property.</s>

en: South African authorities had been dragging their feet on the case.
lug: Aboobuyinza mu South Africa baali babalinnya kagere olw'emisango gyabwe.
mt0: <pad> South African authorities were angry at them for their crimes.</s>

en: There has been a lot of politics in Kayumba's case.
lug: Mubaddemu ebyobufuzi bingi mu musango gwa Kayumba.
mt0: <pad> There were many political twists in the case of Kayumba.</s>

en: First, on the day he was shot, the deputy president of South Africa showed up at the hospital where Kayumba had been admitted.
lug: Okusookera ddala, ku lunaku lwe yakubwa amasasi, amyuka Pulezidenti wa South Africa yalabikako mu ddwaliro Kayumba gye yali aweereddwa ekitanda.
mt0: <pad> Finally, on the same day that he was shot, South African deputy president Cyril Ramaphosa visited Kayumba at the hospital where he was being cared for.</s>

en: He was joined by South Africa's former chief spy, Bill Masetera, a close friend of Patrick Karegyeya also a dissident with Kayumba.
lug: Yeegattibwako eyali akulira bambega e South Africa, Bill Masetera mukwano ennyo gwa Patrick Karegyeya bwe bali ennyo ku mbiranye ne Kayumba.
mt0: <pad> He was joined by former South African police commissioner Bill Masetera, a close friend of Patrick Karegyeya when they were very close with Kayumba.</s>

en: Masetera was the head of South Africa's National Intelligence Agency when Karegyeya was Rwanda's director of External Security.
lug: Masetera ye yali akulira ekitongole ekikessi mu South Africa Karegyeya gye yali akulira ebyokwerinda wabweru wa South Africa.
mt0: <pad> Masetera was the director of the South African intelligence service while Karegyeya was the director of security overseas.</s>

en: Masetera later became a security advisor to former South African president, Thabo Mbeki.
